reviews.text: Although I love that they have barcode menus and payment this place just isn&#39;t what it used to be.<br><br>The only thing that I enjoyed at my last visit were the sweet corn tamale cakes. Samosas weren&#39;t good, egg roll sampler was actually gross. This used to be one of my favorite places but I never have to visit again and I&#39;ll be ok.

Update: they leave comments pretending to care asking to message them but they never follow up. This was from my meal in DECEMBER. DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU HAVE ANY FOOD ALLERGIES. MANAGERS AND STAFF DO NOT CARE. <br><br>This place has gone down hill. My favorite dishes are now hit or miss. Sometimes inedible and loaded with salt. They don&#39;t care about allergies here so don&#39;t come here if you have any. Decided to treat myself to a pasta dish for pickup after a long week. Specifically told them no onions for allergies. Get 30 minutes home and there are some buried in. Called right away said they would send a gift card but never did. I followed up with some rude male manager that refused to do anything until he talked to all the other managers to see what the problem was. Like i was lying about an allergy? Two months later nothing. Lol skip this place especially in Oakbrook you have so many better options with better service.

Well I went in the morning with my family , we were going to celebrate something. So two ladies were at the front desk. One was with a nasty attitude on her face  and the other she was so amazing in customer service.  I didn&#39;t see there names  sorry for not giving u a great review on that person on the front table . But the  one who took care of us on the table on our food was so so aMazing on Custormer service , his name  was Rick and he help us very much on getting our food and so friendly to our kids on the table and everything. My family  loves his customer service  and hospitality. Awesome job Rick . We would like to go again laterr in the future again. Hope we have a beautiful day again.

Takeout review:<br>Ordered three (3) cheesecakes: vanilla bean, red velvet, and peanut butter + chocolate.<br><br>Vanilla bean was the best and not over the top. Light enough, sweet, and vanilla-ey.<br><br>The red velvet is a favorite of mine, the whip cream serves as a good way to cut the richness of this cake.<br><br>The peanut butter + chocolate is very rich, sweet, and over the top.  Need more whip cream to cut the madness!<br><br>Probably 40 people waiting to be seated while I ordered, paid, and left with my cheesecakes! Each cheesecake slice runs about $8.00 after tax.

I came on a Friday afternoon for a late lunch with some friends. Parking was kind of tough but i managed to find a spot. They offer valet parking, although i really don&#39;t find that necessary lol. <br><br>I haven&#39;t been to this chain in years! The menu is very extensive. I always play it safe with some type of chicken sandwich. I went with the southwest chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries. The server was nice and attentive. Our food came out pretty quickly.<br><br>The sandwich was okay. The chicken was a little dry, but overall not bad. I appreciate that they have a &#34;skinny menu&#34; since the majority of their menu is on the heavy calorie side. <br><br>Verdict: pretty average chain restaurant with decent service.

Omg came in to  purchase a cheesecake only because I was out shopping and just made it home after a hour drive and found a long piece of hair in on top of my cheesecake   Smfh I&#39;m mad. Smfh they should wear hairnets behind the counter

Sat -Jan 4-2020<br>Cheesecake Factory around 8:30pm<br>Seated at a Bar table  <br>I do not pay for poor service <br>Problems Warm Food / Bad presentation <br>1. The waiter bring the warm bread out in a aluminum basket sitting on top on the butter. <br>2. The food was late arriving <br>3. When the food did arrived the temperature was warm ( warm French fries loaded with X--salt, warm Tacos) <br>3. Warm Tacos with hard cheese  (The look<br>of cheese after sitting out too long).<br>4. Brought the matter to The waiter attention  ( he said I&#39;ll get the manager) where is the customers service Mr. waiter?  It was extremely busy its late I am tried and hungry, apparently the waiter was busy, tired and didn&#39;t give a rats a$$ about me and my guest.( I am thinking quietly a simple I am sorry would have been sufficient, I am starving) but No he passed the Accountably over to the Friendly Manager, who offer to have it warm<br>Up or get me something else.(no thank you Sir, he offer a Free slice of cheese cake, thank you sir, but no thanks!! my guest was hungry and consume one of her tacos. when the Vanilla cake came out the Whipped whatever supposedly (cream) it had 2 small black  items on the side,am I to assume it was chocolate shaving? Well I don&#39;t assume anything) that&#39;s hows the CCFactory training their waiter, (to engaged the manager)it&#39;s ok with me!!! I will not return to the Oakbrook,IL <br>Cheesecake Factory.

Our Daughter and Son-in-Law bought us 2 slices of  strawberry cheese cake from this place on 8/19/2020. My husband and I couldn&#39;t wait to open and eat the next day after work. Next day we opened to eat our cheese cake, we sit at the dinner table first time opening the cheese cake we eating i ask what is that in the whipped cream on top of the cheese cake it was a long piece of straight black hair this was disgusting I almost vomit. We threw it away never again will I eat from this place. Did they have hair nets on apparently not. Stay away from this place unless you want hair in your food or cake!!!!!

To long of a wait had a reservation and when I got there on time are table was not ready we waited an extra 20 minutes outside on a hot day what is the point of having a reservation? By the time we got seated the waitress said she would be back after she gave us are menu half hour later she takes are order left us water and butter at table asked her for the bread that goes with the butter and she completely ignored us by the time the food came my steak was burnt asked for well done not burnt to a crisp the shrimp scampi was ok . The cheesecake was good that was the only I liked about the place. Had to leave cause management and waitress was terrible! I was leaving chewing my grapes and management raised his voice at me to tell me to put on mask!Really I guess u have to wear a mask there while chewing your food Do not recommend!

We arrived and it was packed, we were told 30-40 mins wait time. Well that was ok....we got seated after 45 mins. our waiter came over, but could not come close to the table as were jammed in a 2 seat table, next to a group of five, so we had to hand and accept water and food to the server. We basically knew what we wanted,  and my wife is gluten free.  We ordered, it took forever to get our food. Over 45 mins. When we received our food, it was cold, and not correct. My wife&#39;s burger didn&#39;t have the grilled onions she asked for. Instead she had a not so nice looking pile of raw onions, tomatoes, shriveled up pickles, and few strips of lettuce. She asked for mayo on the side and something was in it, and she wasn&#39;t sure what it was. Ick. The bun was hard as a rock, the Patti was ice cold, and the fries had so much salt on them that it felt like an entire bag of salt was used. We were able to get the waiter over, tell him the bun was disgusting, and she could not eat these fires. He offered to get me a new bun, but we had waited forever for our food, and did not want to wait again (as my husband has his food and we like to eat together) but I didnacxwpt the offer for new fries without slat (they did come back relatively quick and were good). My food was cold as well, and was incorrect, because I was supposed to get peppers and onions, and side salad instead of potatoes. No peppers to be found. The waiter was actually friendly and nice. But the food was all wrong. For the price, and the wait for food to arrive,it was a complete disappointment. <br>We did order cheesecake as we were excited to see low carb and Gluten free options. The desert was the best part of the meal.   While there were many negatives, the worst was the profanity. We had problems being right next to a bussing station that they kept pitchers of beverages on. As the employess stood there, the used the &#34;F-word&#34; multiple times. I am Glad my kids were not there to hear such unprofessional language. I did tell the manager about the language, and he apparently did talk to the transgressors because I then got to hear them complain about their unfair manager having it out for them.  I want to come back and try some other items, but i just don&#39;t know that they are deserving of a second chance.
DO NOT EAT HERE. The manager at this location is a racist pig that does not know a thing about customer service. This place should be shut down.

So, where do I begin...<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location multiple times and every time, I&#39;ve experienced a problem with my food.  Let me say that my family has not experienced the same issues - only me, which is why I&#39;ve tried this location multiple times.<br><br>One time, my chicken fettucine looked undercooked (boiled chicken that was pink), I ordered plain fettucine (no meat) and the sauce was watery and bland.  Each time, the manager was apologetic and replaced my meal.<br><br>The latest failure was that I found a long black hair in my cobb salad (my hair is coily and brown). The manager was apologetic and replaced the meal but my appetite was ruined.  We left with our cheesecake slices and later when I got home, I found a short black hair in my cheesecake.<br><br>I&#39;ve given enough chances to a restaurant whose standards are clearly low.  I won&#39;t be back and will make sure to share my bad experiences with others.  Unless you like sub-standard/foreign items in your food, don&#39;t spend your money.

Very good service and good food. Our waiter Sincere (possible wrong spelling) was friendly and patient. Our party consist of 7 people total (5 adults and 2 children).  Cocktails were tasting- my go to was a coconut mojito and it was yummy.. expensive but tasty.

I come here just for Cheesecake.  The food is ok and I love it when you&#39;re with a big crowd because they have something for everyone.<br><br>The Cheesecake, tho....well if they messed that up then it would be really awkward.<br><br>I love the Vanilla Bean, the hubby like the Classic with fresh strawberries.  We are here twice a month, rain or shine.

Cheesecake Factory is my all time favorite restaurant and has been since I was a little girl. My mom came from out of state to come visit me and we decided to go have dinner at our favorite place but we were left with disappointment. We went in around 8 to ask for a table for 2 we were told it was abt a 20 min wait in probably the most disrespectful way, we gave our number and sat in the car waiting for our table. Suddenly it&#39;s around 8:40 and we have had no buzz, so my mom went in to ask abt how much longer and she was told &#34;we&#39;ve been buzzing you guys for quite awhile now&#34; lies she double checked the phone number and not once were we. <br>At this point we are both hungry and just wanted to sit. <br>Our server took about 10 min to come to our table and luckily we already knew what we wanted cuz neither her or I could hear a word he was saying even after mentioning we couldn&#39;t hear him. <br>We put in our order and I look at the clock and at this point it&#39;s about 20 min till 10 I look at my mom apologize because she had just driven 5 hours to see me and all we wanted was to enjoy dinner together. Finally our food arrives, my turkey burger was good, her flat bread was burnt to a crisp and my Caesar salad tasted rotten and was made with the shredded lettuce they put on burgers or something. I order the same meal every time I come in it&#39;s my absolute favorite and I was so disappointed. As we were eating not once did our server come to check on us, ask us for refills or anything as a matter of fact we had been done eating for abt 15 min and had to ask another employee if they had seen our server so we could order some cheesecake and get out of there. He came back did not apologize asked us what cheesecake we wanted then turned and walked away. We get the check we finally leave get to the car and realize they only gave my mom her cheesecake. She ran back inside and they proceeded to try and kick her out and not give her the item she had paid for. A girl working behind the cheesecake bar (I wish I knew her name) noticed what was going on grabbed her a slice told her not to worry abt it and sent her on her way. I grew up in fine dining as well as I work in fine dining now, and I am beyond disappointed. From the disrespectfulness of the hostesses, the carelessness of the server and carelessness of food prep. I wish I could get my money back. I work in oakbrook and live in oakbrook and will not return to this location. It&#39;s one thing if you are busy but they were not and even then you show the people who are sat with you respect or you shouldn&#39;t be in the service industry period.

Waited for curbside pickup for 10 minutes before anyone every approached my car. Everyone else was waited on except for me. I even called the front desk no one came to my car and there were only 2 cars waiting. Could not go inside because my infant was sleeping. Had to get out of My car and leave to door open to inform them that I have not been waited on. Food is great but the service I received today is horrible.
Made reservations at 6 &amp; was told to wait for a text. Other larger parties without a reservation were serviced before us. We waited so long we left. Terrible customer service.

We haven&#39;t been to the cheesecake factory in years, so just when our daughter called asking about meeting for dinner the distance was a great compromise. After 5:00 no reservations so we were a little apprehensive about getting in after 6:00. We got seated right away, menus, water and drinks ordered. Julie was our waitress and she was on top of her game. We got our drinks a classic Mojito for my wife and I had Lagunitas IPA on tap while we ordered two appetizers for sharing. The calamari was perfectly fried and Crab and artichoke dip with toasted bread was great. For our entrees I had the factory burrito, my wife had the chicken primavera and our daughter had roasted mushroom flat bread. I think I&#39;m still in shock with the quantity of food, we all took enough home for another meal! Everything was perfectly presented. My burrito was a knife and fork meal nicely seasoned with guacamole and sour cream on the side very tasty. The mushroom flat bread was like a personal pizza only bigger. My daughter let me taste a bite, it was good. Yum! My wife&#39;s primavera she said was good, but should have had more sauce on the noodles. The chicken was nicely cooked, but the noodles got dry. Julie packed up our take home and we ordered two slices of cheese cake to share. Key lime cheese cake is always spectacular and the cinnamon cinnamon really knocked me out. I have to say we got two full meals for three people. Take a look at my photos for the details.  Definitely a place to go to even on a busy Thursday night.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory after taking the family to an outing downtown. I&#39;ve been here many times. This review is about our server, Enrique is his name.  THIS DUDE WAS AWESOME. Food came out on time, he was really personable, was very patient with my lady (who takes forever to order). Was spot on with recommendations and was overall the best server I&#39;ve experienced in long time. I&#39;m giving this five stars just because of Enrique

A great spot at Oakbrook for lunch before shopping. There&#39;s so much on the menu there is something for everyone. Lunch portion salads &amp; pastas are a plus and a cheesecake slice is a must!<br><br>My favs include: BBQ chicken salad, four cheese pasta, club sandwich, veggie burger<br><br>Cheesecakes: coffee &amp; cream, s&#39;mores, Hershey&#39;s chocolate, red velvet <br><br>If you come early, there won&#39;t be a wait but it can definitely get crowded mid afternoon or on a nice weather day when lots of people are shopping. Not too pricey for oakbrook.

If I were an alien seeking to study the excesses of the modern American diet, this is where I&#39;d come. The portions are always generously sized, generously buttered (or mayonnaise-ized), and generously excessive. My chicken salad sandwich was sufficient for two -- and while lacking in flavor, I certainly achieved the desired level of &#34;fullness&#34;. A consistent operation - prompt service, and no complaints or surprises. At the Cheesecake Factory, you know what you&#39;re going to get (whether you like it or not is up to you).

Thirty five minutes for 1 slice of cheesecake Togo .... and a manager who says it will only be 5 minutes and proceeds not to jump in and help ..... girls fill orders but don&#39;t bag orders leaves orders on top counter ... only for the cashier to now reread the orders and try to bag them .... we watched our order sit in a line for up to 10 minutes... that&#39;s after it took 20 minutes before it got in a bag:( <br><br>You can&#39;t fill orders Togo while trying to run a all deserts there same area !!!!<br><br>You charge too much for this type of service !!!!!

I&#39;ve been coming to The Cheesecake Factory Oak Brook location for YEARS. It&#39;s always been a go-to for date nights, family reunions, holidays, and even when we have friends from out of town. The menu has options to accommodate all your tastes and dietary restrictions (even vegans too!), the food is always delicious and portions are generous, and last but not least, the cheesecake!!! Save room for dessert!! This is the place to indulge!! Also, the curbside pickup has also been awesome!! Thanks for everything!
The food was really good but there service was terrible we were waiting for our check for 40 minutes I could of taken a shower

After a good day of shopping nothing beats a nice meal from the Cheesecake Factory. The menu offers something for everyone. They added a lot of small plate options to share with friends as well as meals and snacks to fit all dietary needs. They do offer valet if you&#39;re fancy but there is also plenty of parking since the restaurant is adjacent to the mall. The hostess and server staff was nice and friendly.
Outstanding food, service and cheesecake!  The menu has something for everyone. And the cheesecake is to die for! I love the Pecan Turtle or the Godiva cheesecake.

I don&#39;t know what happened to this place I feel like Covid is an excuse for everything. It&#39;s starting to be so ridiculous. Currently sitting inside and across from me 3 tables available yet customers are waiting to be seated. I know social distance is important, but these tables are available and there is an empty table in between each one. We waited 30 min for a table and to come in and to see this makes me question the management and how they run the restaurant.  Woodfield Schaumburg location is so much better and it runs smoothly. Such a disappointment. The staff at the door is nor friendly at all. From greeting to overall friendliness no one smiles. The waiters on the other hand are friendly and I had no issues.

I like going to Cheesecake Factory for obvious reasons (cheesecake). I knew what I wanted before I showed up: skinny licious tacos with Reese&#39;s Cheesecake.<br><br>The bread was delicious and warm. My waiter George kept my glass filled with water. Then came the tacos...<br>The shells were harder than expected. When I asked my waiter about it, he simply said that happens sometimes. I wanted a better response than that.  <br><br>The cheesecake was awesome and he brought a to go box because I couldn&#39;t eat it all. Cellular service in there sucked. I couldn&#39;t check my email or read. That&#39;s what I normally do when traveling for work.

Their cheesecake is so good and they have so many options BUT be prepared to wait.  Not 5 minutes but more like 10-20, EVEN if you order online and give them 20+ minutes less time to prepare.  When I arrived to pick up my curbside to go order, I called the number to let them know I&#39;m here as ins.  My call was &#34;transferred&#34; twice; once a person answered, I was told that my order was being prepared.  I even gave them extra time from my pickup time they needed because I have never gotten anything quickly from this place.  It took over 30 mins in total for four slices of cheesecake.  I&#39;d probably come here more often if it wasn&#39;t such a time drain every time I do come.
Celebrating our Anniversary and after a long work week, best place to grub! Huge portions, delicious options, great family atmosphere.

Our Saturday lunch rates 5-stars.  Everything was perfect.  Unbelievably, there was no waiting at 1pm.  Our server was so professional. The warm bread with butter was wonderful.  We ordered the fried zucchini sticks as an appetizer.  Excellent.  I think the menu said it came with ranch dressing but it tasted like a really good creamy garlic.  Cheesecake Factory is known for its generous portions.  My husband loved the chicken pot pie so much that he basically licked the plate clean.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad.  It was huge.  The salads come with the dressing on them.  Next time I will ask for dressing on the side.  I couldn&#39;t really taste the dressing.  The only food item we won&#39;t order again is the house salad.   It was a mix of fancy lettuces but the lettuces were so bitter.    It was fun watching the servers come out with all of the different food for the other diners.  The hamburgers looked good.  The orange chicken smelled great.  The nachos order looked really good also. And of course the cheesecakes all looked fabulous.

I like Cheesecake Factory, feel like it is always a safe bet but today something was off. I got there before my large group (8 chairs and 3 highschairs) gave the hostess the number of people and she said she couldn&#39;t seat us until everyone was there which is fair. No big deal. Once everyone was there I went back up and there was a different lady and she said that they only made room for 8. But the original hostess came back and seated us so I think it was just poor communication. Waitress and service was really nice, but the food was mediocre. I got the Thai lettuce wraps which were eh, and the dynamite shrimp which were also eh. The checks also took a really really long time which was a bit frustrating. I think if I had better tasting food this time, it would have been 4 stars. I know they are capable of good food, esp the Louisiana pasta, but didn&#39;t hit the mark this time.

My family and I went on half price cheesecake day and decided to order dinner as well. I tasted the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and it was completely delicious. Another in my party had the Pasta Neopalante which is like a meat lovers pasta and that was superb as well. Our waitress was the best I&#39;ve seen in a while and I&#39;m pretty attentive to being served. Also the wait was a little over 20 minutes and that&#39;s miraculous for dinner time on this discount day for this type of restaurant. This is definitely going on my top 10 for restaurant.<br>Here is the description of the picture:<br>Entrees: Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, , Grilled Cheese Jenga style, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Pasta Neopalante, Veggie burger <br>Desserts: Cinnabon Cinnamon Swirl, <br>Snickers Bar, White Chocolate Caramel, Macadamia Nut Caramel Pecan Turtle
This place went somewhat downhill and is not as good as it used to be. The crispy cheese was decent and the portions were huge.

Always a great choice to visit here! Downside is that if you go in the evening, you will have to wait 30 to 45 minutes. Otherwise, the food is always fantastic, a huge menu of over 20 pages, service is fast and generally always right! One of my favorite places to go! <br>The cheesecake is always delicious and very very good too.

I also agree with everyone else there customer service is garbage and why is it taking three hours to have dinner , shit crazy we wait wait wait then just to get horrible service ! With a high ass bill Cheese cake factory need to train their employees about courtesy and being nice to humans !

Take reservations already!<br>Everything here is very salty. Must be why the glasses are so large. Never worth the wait. More crowded after church on Sundays than any other time.<br>If you just want cheesecake, you buy a slice of all the popular flavors at Barnes&amp;Noble in the mall and eat it outside in the mall area in front of the store if the cafe has no seat

To the rude hostess whom answered the phone and hung up @ 11:15AM on 7.20.20 regarding a party of 8. Having worked in management in the restaurant industry, your lack of hospitality and care, especially in a time where your company would appreciate the business, is most unappreciated. Management: Please re-train your staff. Hanging up on a customer inquiring on a reservation and then telling them to go to yelp is exactly what I am doing now. We will be celebrating elsewhere.

The Cheesecake Factory has an extremely varied menu that reminds me of the phrase, &#34;jack of all trades, master of none.&#34; While their entrees are alright, the real specialty here is the cheesecake. They have a ton of different variations on the classic cheesecake and are great for satisfying any sweet tooth.

I accept a $90 order for the Cheesecake Factory. Walk inside, hostess says that DoorDash drivers have to wait in the prep kitchen. Since the order is MASSIVE and the drive to the customer is 5 minutes away (I have an insulated blanket in the car) I don&#39;t bring in my bag. Had over 1000 orders, not bringing the bag has never been an issue, I always just show them the order on the app if they ask for verification.<br><br>I&#39;m waiting in the prep kitchen area. I ask about 3 different people for help. They say someone will be with me shortly.<br><br>I wait 45 FUCKING MINUTES. Patiently. No one speaks to me or asks me anything. I&#39;m literally standing in the middle of the prep kitchen being ignored. Then other DoorDash drivers start showing up. They are immediately helped. I then ask the young woman who is helping them (she specifically ignored me even when I talked to her earlier) &#34;hey, I&#39;ve been waiting for 45 minutes, I know it&#39;s busy but I&#39;m supposed to pick up an order?&#34; She looks at me like I&#39;m a piece of shit and says &#34;where the FUCK is your bag then?&#34; I say, &#34;I left it in the car since it&#39;s a huge order, however here is the order on the app&#34; &#34;I don&#39;t give a fuck what you try to show me, either go get your bag or get the fuck out,&#34; she said without even looking at my phone. I said &#34;I will go get my bag, but you can speak to me with some respect!!!&#34; She says &#34;DONT FUCKING COME BACK, IM NOT GIVING YOU THE FOOD, GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY RESTAURANT AND STAY THE FUCK OUT.&#34; She screamed this in front of about 250+ people.<br><br>I run out to my car and contact the customer and DoorDash support. The customer is INCREDIBLY KIND and supportive, they say if DoorDash doesn&#39;t back me up they are cancelling the order and complaining to the manager. DoorDash support is AMAZING. Literally calmed me down from having a panic attack (being screamed at and kicked out in front of a ton of people will do that lol) and said that if I didn&#39;t want to go through with the delivery, I would still be reimbursed. I say I want to do it, the customer has now been waiting an hour and a half. DoorDash calls Cheesecake Factory and complains to the manager. I went back inside and he gave me the food directly so I wouldn&#39;t have to deal with the prep kitchen people again. Customer tipped me 30+, they were unbelievably kind and patient.<br><br>The person who really was hurt in this situation was the customer. They spent so much money on ice cold food and a stressful situation. <br>I am in shock that this happened.

Had a good dinner here today with my daughter. We ordered the Nashville nuggets and loaded tots for appetizers. They were both good. We ordered salads for our meal. The food was good. I was just a little turned off with the smeared mashed potatoes in the booth, dirty fork and dirty menus with smeared food and hair. Our waitress was awesome! She gave us good recommendations.

Unfortunately I had to come here again because they seem to be the only place that can accommodate large parties. <br><br>We were celebrating the birthday of my friend who passed away from breast cancer. Her family and friends wanted to still celebrate her life. <br><br>We arrived at 4pm and put our names on the list for 17 ppl. 3 hours later we were seated at 7pm. We were told a 1 hour wait. At 5pm we were told that we could break up our group. Just after that we were told that we couldn&#39;t break up our group. At 6pm we were told they could do 2 groups at two booths. Then were told that they would accommodate our party and that they were just waiting for a large party to pay and leave. At 7pm our party was finally seated. We ate and finished up by 8:45pm. <br><br>Again, the food is underwhelming.

When you first walk in, there is a magnificent bakery showcase full of oversized cakes and elegant patisseries. My companion and I got really excited about which ones we were going to sample. The hostess station was empty, though. We looked around. After several minutes, a young woman came to seat us but did not greet us.<br>Before we ordered, I went to the ladies&#39; room and it was so dark in there that I felt like Velma from Scooby Doo, feeling around to find the toilet. Am I going to touch something gross? Eww!<br>When I returned to my seat, it was so dark that I literally could not read the menu. I said the only justification for such a dark restaurant was if you were in there with someone else&#39;s husband. My friend got mad at me. &#34;You better not ruin this place by writing a bad review. I have seen so many marriage proposals in here and I used to eat here for my anniversaries. It&#39;s romantic.&#34; Just read the menu to me, please.<br>We both ordered the buffalo chicken appetizer since I refused to share, and a side of fried macaroni &amp; cheese. That&#39;s 2 appetizers and a side for $40. I mean, damn! We ended up not ordering any cheesecake at all because it was $13 per slice.<br>At this point, I&#39;m thinking 2-star review - but then the food came out. It was so delicious and had such unique flavor from any other restaurant I tried recently. Wow! The pastry coating was fluffy and the food was obviously freshly prepared for me, not reheated. The food was great, but far too expensive for my tastes. Definitely eat there, but bring a flashlight and a title loan. $40 for appetizers. No entrée, no drinks, no coffees, no cheesecake.
I find it really annoying that every time I go there for takeout the spaces designated for that are always full and I seem to be the only person in line to be picking up food
As you can see, the Business Manager&#39;s response to my review reads like a form letter, a canned response. Really pathetic.

This place still does not take reservations on weekends, so we ended up waiting 2 hours just to be seated-- there were only 2 of us. Not my first choice of restaurants, but we really wanted cheesecake. In the future we will probably get the cheesecake to-go and skip the sit down meal. Food, service and atmosphere were simply mediocre.

Amazing restaurant! I went with my family to celebrate my birthday and the service was amazing. Since it was a bit packed it took longer to serve us but they continued coming around asking for refiles and bringing bread with butter. Not to mention the food was so good and the chocolate moose cheesecake is delicious! I will definitely come back.

Definitely your typical Cheesecake factory location- Nothing out of the ordinary. <br><br>I&#39;ve consistently had decent servers who know a great deal about the cheesecakes and the giant menu- which is surprising, but good.<br><br>I have to note, and I think this is a constant at all cheesecake factories, the lighting is absolutely horrible. I&#39;m not sure what type of ambiance they&#39;re going for, but it&#39;s one short step above dining in the dark. <br><br>Food is decent, the portions are out of control large, and the cheesecake is a must.

This rating is based on the Pasta Napoletana dish which looks and sounds so good on the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s website.  I tried it for the first and last time today.  The description of the dish states that the dish comes with Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Housemade Meatball, Mushrooms, Peppers, Bacon, Onions and Garlic in a Rich Tomato Sauce served over Parmesan Cream Pasta.    There was a HUGE amount of pasta.  However, as for the meat, there was hardly any!  I never did see any bacon. I saw one ore two pepperonis, a chunk or two of Italian Sausage and a chunk of meatball. Also, there&#39;s barely any tomato sauce.  This dish was $19 with tax.  For the most part, all that I got for my money was lots of pasta!  I wouldn&#39;t waste my money on this dish.  Maybe they give you more meat if you dine-in.  I don&#39;t know.  What I do know is that for my carry-out order, there was little meat.  Very disappointing. I may call the manager just to let him/her know how disappointed I was with my meal.  Now all that is left of my dish is tons of pasta.
We went on a Thursday afternoon. It was great. I had the Orange Chicken and my wife had the Chicken and Biscuits. We both had Cheesecake. The food, cheesecake and service was great. We will be back.

Walking into the building, and seeing a huge amount of people waiting gives you both a good and bad sign. It is 5pm and it&#39;s already packed. The food must be good but the wait is going to be long. <br><br>We made our way to the front desk and was told the wait would be about 45 minutes. Well, eventually our buzzard went off and we slowly made our way to the front... only to be waited again. Interesting system where we gave up our seats but now we have to wait all over again. Here&#39;s an idea... don&#39;t buzz anyone until you are completely ready. That was one star off the review sadly because it was just silly in my eyes. The room is packed beyond belief. So those who gave up the buzzard must make their way to the front and awkwardly wait in front of the desk, blocking the newer customers now. And the secondary wait brings again. Really?<br><br>Well, after an additional 15, give to take, we were finally called out and seated. Our server was quick to arrive and very friendly. He asked if we had any questions, and didn&#39;t seem he was busy even tho we knew he was. He actually seemed to like his job which is rare these days and with these kids. <br><br>I ordered the Bone in New Year strip, Medium rare. It came out a little more well done but no big deal but it was tough. I wonder if they used lemon pepper or something similar since I did have a hint of an aftermarket citrus scent to it. But at least the steak was seasoned. Today was my mood for meat and potatoes so instead of a veggie, it was a double order of mashed potatoes. The potatoes were a little drier than I preferred but it was at least seasoned.  <br><br>The rest of my table all got burgers and there were no complaints. In fact everyone did finish their food. Afterwards, our server came back and asked about the dessert. You come to Cheesecake and even tho the portions were large, you must have the cheesecake even if it&#39;s to go so that&#39;s what we did. The server did talk to us about the dessert so at least he was also knowledgable about the menu too<br><br>Overalll, the wait was long and I did not enjoy the secondary wait line since we lost our seats because of it and was unaware about waiting again, after giving the buzzard. The front desk people were busy but didn&#39;t seem too happy or friendly. They all gave short and simple replies. The food would please all types of diners with plenty of food. Price was reasonable. Our server was friendly and actually liked his job. I&#39;m sure to return, more especially if the wait system improved.
The food was good but the service was ok and not as efficient. The waiter kinda forgot about us and didn&#39;t bring us utensils until like 30 minutes later.

Today, my team and I held a small business brunch (a party of about 15) and the service was great. Our server was excellent, very helpful and we had no issues whatsoever. I just wanted to commend the restaurant and the staff for being so helpful and never once making us feel out of place. Sometimes businesses stereotype us young adults, especially minorities, but we had zero problems. We stayed quite some time, as we were discussing business and there was no rush or attitude. Such a pleasant experience! Not to mention, my steak was absolutely perfect and I&#39;m picky, haha. Thank you so much, the management and hiring team is doing wonderful.

Went here on Sweetest Day to celebrate our 7 year anniversary. It was around 10pm. Waited to be seated for 20 minutes. Not bad. But once seated, we waited forever to get our drinks and appetizer. We weren&#39;t even asked if we were celebrating anything (there were two different groups around us there for birthdays). Once we received our entrees I tried mine and it was OVERLY salty!!! I get the same thing every time I go. Pasta Neopolenanta. Waiter noticed I hadn&#39;t touched my food and asked what was wrong. I told him it was too salty and he said &#34;oh okay&#34;. Didn&#39;t even ask to bring it back to the kitchen and have a new one made. Very upset how the service and food was. Such a shame because we go here quite often and have never had an issue.

Service here either is a struggle or excellent as we go often. If you get there weekends before 11 as they open earlier for brunch, there is one small area you can sit.   <br><br>The other areas are closed. But there are several servers standing around. Then you ask for a closed area because seating and ambience is nicer. They&#39;ll get you a temporary server until that area is officially opened. <br><br>Seriously ? Never again.

I ordered food on Mother&#39;s Day of course for a pick up. It was for a 2:34 PM pick up. I got there at 2:40 PM. Of course the line was long so I finally was able to let the staff know I arrived about 3:15 PM. They brought out the cheesecake but stated they were still working on the 2 meals I&#39;d ordered. About 3:45 I asked the staff could they give me an estimate of when it would be ready, but they abruptly stated they didn&#39;t know. About 4:30 there were people walking out who had later pick up times than I had. Long story short, at 5:00 PM the staff stated they&#39;d asked the chef to put my order as a priority and I left at 5:45. It literally took 3 hours to get our food. There was complete disorganization and I never even got an apology for the inconvenience of it all. By the time I got the food and cheesecake to my mother and stepmother, the cheesecake started to melt because of the 2 hour lapse in time between getting the cheescake and getting the food. I was embarrassed.

Edit: the general response of &#34;sorry we didn&#39;t meet your expectations&#34;... Kind of ridiculous.  Why reply at all? What do you even mean not meeting my expectations? No I don&#39;t expect to wait over an hour AFTER my estimated wait time. Yes, I expect my waitress NOT to offer my 9 year old food that may require an epipen... after being told multiple times that she has an allergy. Sorry for these apparently high expectations you were unable to meet. <br><br>I had a horrible experience at The Cheesecake Factory. As did my daughter and we were there for HER BIRTHDAY! YAY! All she wanted was a fancy dinner. We can do that. <br>So.. I called and trued to make a reservation for 11. They dont take them. I spoke to someone who said to have a member of our party arrive an hour early and they will give them an estimated wait time, then that person can call the rest of the group to let then know what time to arrive. Sounds like a plan. Inconveniencing one person is much better than 11. <br><br>My husband arrives at 6:30. I understand this is peak time. That&#39;s fine. We had to come after an emergency job her had. Plus- the rest of us aren&#39;t coming until they tell is to. They tell him the wait is ONE HOUR to ONE HOUR AND FIFTEEN MINUTES. Fine. So by 7:45 we should be sitting down. They tell him to come back to the desk in 45 minutes to check the progress. He does. They say about half an hour. Cool.. Right on schedule.. the rest of us head on over. <br><br>At 7:45 they tell him about 35 more minutes. We are now all in the parking lot. I have my daughter, son, and their cousin. They don&#39;t know everyone will be there so we have to sit in the car. 35 minutes. 3 kids. Great. 35 minutes pass. My husband goes to the desk again. Low and behold we have to wait ANOTHER 35 MINUTES. At this point I want to leave but we are far from home and everyone is here..... waiting... over an HOUR longer than they said. <br><br>I bring them inside and they see everyone is here. Fine. We wait 35 more minutes. This is not the end of this horrible experience.  We are all seated. Waitress comes over. Couldn&#39;t tell you her name.. never got it. No apology for the wait... whatever no big deal. As I sit at the wobbliest table I have ever sat at in a resaturant (like literally we had 6 tables lined up and they all were super wobbly) I EXPLAIN TO THE WAITRESS that my daughter has a milk allergy (not lactose intolerance- allergy). She can handle a bit of milk and I want to get her chocolate cake versus cheesecake because there is significantly less milk. Ok so remember this. I TOLD her we can&#39;t do milk. K. <br><br>Rushes our drink order. We tell her we are ready to order already and she seems bothered. We order. We wait. Drinks come maybe 15 minutes later.  Everyone&#39;s but the birthday girl. Thanks! We point in out she brings it a little less than 10 minutes after that. We get our food. <br><br>My husband asked for a buffalo chicken sanwich<br>There was NO buffalo sauce on it.  He points that out. She says &#34;oh want me to bring some&#34;? Ok no apology? Nothing? Ok. So my husband doesn&#39;t like the sandwich to begin with. Sauce should be on the sandwich.. like she specifically told him it came when he ordered it. The rest of the food was ok.<br><br>We are about to finish eating and I ask for the menu one more time to order the correct slice of cake for my daughter. I explain to her AGAIN about the milk. She says &#34;yes that&#39;s right&#34;. I choose the cake- a chocolate cake and tell her to bring that so we can sing. She offers to bring ice cream too. I tell her NO she can&#39;t have milk like that. She apologizes (shocking based on the rest of the experience) and says ok and asks how to spell her name to write it on the plate. I tell her. <br><br>We are all finished.  Nobody else orders dessert and we wait maybe like 15 minutes for her to come back WITH ONLY AN ICE CREAM SUNDAE TO SING HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO MY DAUGHTER. Are you kidding me? We sing cause they are all singing. We loved the guys with their little sound effects and name drops btw. Then she tell my daughter, who&#39;s sitting 4 seats down from me, to take a bite. ARE YOU KIDDING ME, LADY? So I yell across the table that she can&#39;t eat milk. This must be the fifth time I tell her. We wait 10 more minutes for her to bring the cake. So annoying. She did such a horrible job. Completely ruined the experience.. even moreso than waiting more than an hour past our expected wait time. <br><br>Food was good for the most part. I didn&#39;t think it was as pricey as most people say it is.. and I am not rich. I probably would have returned had it not been for such HORRIBLE HORRIBLE service. Like it was legitimately bad. Long wait, rude, didn&#39;t listen at all, no concern.. And even encouraged my kid to eat something she is allergic to. <br><br>Horrible. Myself and the rest of our party will never go back. Really liked the backup singer guys tho..

Worst experience with the Cheesecake Factory ( Oakbrook Center).  The silverware and glasses were dirty and no one attempted to clean underneath the table which was also filthy.  Once brought to the waiter&#39;s attention ( whom was very nonchalant), he provided no resolution in addition to providing misleading information to my family and I stating that he had notified the manager of these particular issues.  <br><br>The manager was on the floor assisting another customer with issues pertaining to their order including issues with the waiter that was also the sever for our table.  I was able to approach and engage the manager of our concerns / issues in which she too provided no resolution but to offer a slice of cheesecake.   <br><br>Their customer service skills ( which were lacking), and the urgency to correct these issues were unacceptable.    If you&#39;re ever at this particular location (Oakbrook Center ), and are expecting fine dining with great customer service skills, do not waste your time..

Have been going to Cheesecake Factory for years since 2009. I still enjoy coming here every once in awhile but it&#39;s probably not my first choice like it used to be. The food is still pretty good but the last few times I&#39;ve been here the portion size seems to get smaller and smaller and the quality is not there like it used to be. The appetizers are still very good though! I love the fried Mac and cheese balls and avocado egg rolls and highly recommend those. The Cajun jambalaya pasta is my forever favorite dish here - it comes with shrimp and chicken and is spicy! The last few times I got this dish it&#39;s gotten significantly smaller in portion with only 4 or 5 pieces of shrimp and chicken, so that was a bit disappointing. I do enjoy the lunch specials and usually order the chicken piccata. My other go to dish is the crispy chicken costoletta, it&#39;s a crispy chicken breast in a  creamy lemon sauce served with mashed potatoes - so good! The sauce really ties this dish together, so sometimes when there is not enough sauce the dish is just okay. Cheesecake is always phenomenal here and I&#39;ve never had a cheesecake that I didn&#39;t like from here. I&#39;ve tried almost every cheesecake on the menu and the red velvet is my favorite with Adams peanut butter fudge coming in a close second!

My wife &amp; I stopped in for lunch at CF; Steven, our waiter was perfect. He got our water &amp; bread quickly (bread was tasty sour dough &amp; a multigrain dark rye), took our orders precisely, and served us promptly. We felt like VIP diners.<br>I enjoyed the soup/salad/half turkey sandwich.<br>My wife had a chopped salad with her favorite blue cheese dressing. Thanks Steven. Happy wife,  happy life I keep saying.

This restaurant if run very poorly. If you have more than 4 people, don&#39;t bother going there. The food is pricey and not that good. Desert was good BUT OUR WAITER WAS RUDE.. he was taking our drinks order but one of us were not sure what to get and he just walked away to serve another table. Didnt say a word , just blew us off.. They over charged me on my bill when I asked it was an upcharge for something the waiter told me was free and refused to remove it. My friends food came out cold TWICE. Awful experience wont be returning

Wonderful service today! During these difficult times, I didn&#39;t get to celebrate my birthday like I do every year obviously. My fiancé ordered from this location and I was so impressed by them! We went to pick up the food and had to wait in the car for curbside pickup. The staff got our order right and were prompt bringing our food (they got through the curb side pick up pretty quickly). They were pretty busy, but nothing but exceptional customer service! Great job everyone there and I hope you stay safe and healthy!

Great cheesecakes but overpriced. The Avocado Egg Rolls are our favorite appetizer and their Asian Peach Martini is delicious. We are eClub members and take advantage of their promos, for each $25 gift card purchased you get two free e-slices, seems like this promo only happens during Christmas, too bad.

My husband ordered the whole family dinner from here on 4/4/2020 for my birthday.  Let me tell you OMG the food was soo good when he brought it home. Everything was fresh, hot, and very delicious ! We ordered burgers, impossible burgers, asian cauliflower wings, and got a fee slice of pie !. All were very delicious ! Thank you cheesecake factory for making this an enjoyable bday...

I&#39;m really late at writing this review. But i tried my best for the redemption part. On Mother&#39;s Day weekend 2 items from what we ordered for take out was missing. We picked up an hour before closed and we called them once we realized. They told us someone will contact us the next morning. No one did. So i called again and they said their waiting for an office manager. And no one got back to me. For i was charge 89.98 for two Alfredo pasta. Fast forward to a month ago from now. I made another order cause no hard feelings. It was during the pandemic and I just let them keep the free money. This time around, the complimentary bread wasn&#39;t in the bag, no utensils, and my cheesecake was given to me upside down in the bag. I didn&#39;t have the energy to keep going in and out cause I&#39;m pregnant. I reallllyyyy loooove Cheesecake Factory and i loooveee supporting their business and i always tip 20% regardless of the services. But I&#39;m really disappointed at the last two pick ups i experienced in this location

Took my teenage sons here for the first time.  We had a good experience - staff was friendly and the service was timely.  All of the items we ordered were delicious. The boys loved the mac and cheese burgers and I enjoyed the Creole Shrimp and Sausage.  Obviously the cheesecake was the main event and it did not disappoint.  Even the low-carb one was good.

Two words - don&#39;t bother<br><br>Always overcrowded, always a wait of 1-3 hours, not enough room in the waiting area to handle the crowds, just a disastrous mess. On a Saturday night the might be 100 people waiting for a table and you can&#39;t even get in the front door.<br><br>It&#39;s too bad because their food is great. But the place is too small to handle the crowds and the last time we called on a Sunday at 4:30 and were told there was an hour and 15 minute wait, we decided we&#39;ve just given up on this place. <br><br>If you want to eat here, try a Tuesday at 2pm. It&#39;s probably the only time you won&#39;t wait over an hour for a meal.<br><br>They need to be on Open Table and accept reservations. It&#39;s 2019 - get a clue.<br><br>The manager replied and said &#34;we know it&#39;s hard to wait when you&#39;re hungry.&#34; Lol. It&#39;s not that - my point is who wants to waste two hours of their time on a Saturday night waiting to eat dinner? Especially when you have a toddler with you and the waiting area is so overcrowded that it&#39;s a fire hazard? Nice try, Cheesecake Factory. Most people don&#39;t want to eat dinner

Hello everyone. My review is just from an ordinary person who loves food. Ok what is not to love about the Cheesecake Factory ? The food is better than delicious. The cheesecake ? To die for! Ok we came here in the late afternoon on a Friday. Wait time was not that long but I have been here where I had to wait over 30 minutes. So be prepared. The restaurant is located in beautiful oak brook. I have been to the ones located in orland park and downtown Chicago and this by far is my favorite. Love how the restaurant is themed and decorated. I have never had anything from the menu that I did not like. I tried something newer off the menu and it is out of this world. It&#39;s called pasta campagna. Omg !!! Would highly recommend if you are looking for something different. My daughters always get fettuccini  Alfredo which is delicious. My wife had the fish tacos which were just as delicious. The staff is fantastic. I want management to know that Michael ( Asian as there are two ) was just fantastic . He went above and beyond to make our dinner just perfect. He truly is an asset to the company. So highly recommended and will back often. Great job Cheesecake Factory ! Michael (Asian) thanks for being an outstanding server !

The Cheesecake Factory, a great franchised American staple that everyone knows and loves! Sure portion sizes aid in the epidemic of obesity and ordering a cheesecake for dessert will push you over the Richter scale of gluttony but that&#39;s what doggie bags are for! I have one dish I am infatuated with and get nearly every time I come here. That is, the Jamaican Blackened Pepper Shrimp! Dear Lord, everything on this plate goes so well with together. Platanos, black beans, white rice, pineapple salsa, shrimp, and amazing spicy black pepper sauce that will have you dipping bread in it until every last drop is gone! If you haven&#39;t tried this yet, please order it! <br><br>Some of my other favorites include:<br>-Tex Mex Eggrolls as an appetizer <br>-SkinnyLicious Shrimp Summer Rolls (my only dislike is that they&#39;re not rolled tight enough and sometimes the ingredients fall out into the dipping sauce.)<br>-Orange Chicken <br>-Cajun Jumbalaya Pasta <br><br>Dessert favorites include:<br>-Godiva Cheesecake <br>-Chocolate Mouse Cheesecake <br>*Whipped Cream is everything! <br><br>The Oakbrook location has a large outdoor patio and decor and ambiance is always stunning. During peak hours there&#39;s always a wait so be prepared.

If you have more time than money, this restaurant is for you.  Their waitlist system is atrocious.  When we walked in, we were told it would be a 50 minute wait.  It was clear that we would never have a table in 50 minutes, especially since people in line in front of us had been waiting over an hour.  Every single person who came after us was also told 50 minutes.  There has to be a better system than giving customers false estimates of wait times.  Even worse is that they never take the time to update you and you have to keep going back to ask how long the wait will be.

The quality of their food has declined drastically! Dined here 7/25/17 for my daughters birthday and she ordered Fettuccine but it looks like chicken noodle soup <br>We had some type of chicken appetizer and it looked like the chicken was looking at us on the TABLE!  <br><br>The ambiance is still nice, it&#39;s pretty good for a meeting place for drinks, that&#39;s the impression i gathered. So many patriots had cocktails but not eating.  I guess i didn&#39;t get that memo. <br><br>The waitress was nice.  But so disappointed in the restaurant! Will not visit again.

Love this place their porrtions are pretty big and have lots of calories but once in a while won&#39;t hurt. The cheesecake selection is great as well but sometimes when it gets too busy they don&#39;t check on you often, they might need more waiters to help and it&#39;s very hard to find  parking because it&#39;s always full.
Food was great, but our server was nowhere to be found for the beginning of our meal. Cheesecakes as always were wonderful. Strawberry martini is the best I ever had.

Travelling for business, I visited alone and sat at the bar. I had great service at the bar but it was a Monday night at like 5pm, so they weren&#39;t that busy.  It has been years since I&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake factory.  I have always ordered the Chicken Mediera and decide to order it this time, hoping it would be as delicious as I remembered it, and it was!  Although I had a hard time picking what I wanted to eat because the menu selection is HUGE, and this time I had no one to share or split a meal with.  The portions are also very large. Overall I think this restaurant chain has maintained its quality and selection over the years.

I know it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory but there was pervasive hygiene issues with my food.  Hair, pieces of a blue plastic bag and finally rotten, slimy lettuce.  We played a game similar to &#34;where&#39;s Waldo&#34; in looking for more.  We did leave laughing but won&#39;t be coming back.

Food is good, although eclectic. slightly overpriced but has healthy options. Overall a chain that has sustainability.<br><br>The good : cheesecake for desert is amazing, if you&#39;re going for that it might be worth it.<br><br>Side note: my friend pointed out that the ambiance is kind of odd. We can&#39;t figure out the theme..Egyptian ?

My family and I went to cheesecake factory for a special occasion and we all got stomach troubles after eating something off the menu.<br><br>We always go there for Mexican food since its so good but we ended up order something different. We decided to not order entrees again and stick to appetizers and desserts from now on.

I enjoy coming here and the food is always pretty good. Unfortunately this review isn&#39;t for the food. I was here the other day and accidentally left my nice pair of sunglasses on the table. The next morning I called over multiple times about it and asked if they could send me a picture of the pair of sunglasses they said fit my description. Well, it&#39;s been quite some time now and I have yet to receive the email with the picture. Perhaps they know that one of their employees stole my sunglasses off the table? I understand that it was my fault for leaving them on the table, but the help they&#39;ve given me regarding trying to get them back has been pathetic. It&#39;s not cheap to eat here and the least they can do is try to help me out a bit. I&#39;m going to second guess myself next time I think about coming here. A paying customer shouldn&#39;t be treated this way!

I come here once in a while because it&#39;s right by my work.<br><br> This Cheesecake factory always seems to get us seated fairly quickly whether it&#39;s for lunch or for dinner. However, be warned that if you come for lunch, you will be here for a good solid hour or more! They do not provide good quick lunches for business folk. <br><br>Everything on the menu has been okay for me- from salads to sandwiches, appetizers; all of it seems fairly good franchizey kind of food. I&#39;ve never had anything really excellent, but I&#39;ve never had anything terrible either.<br><br>One thing is awesome is the cheesecake- there&#39;s no denying it! However at about $8 a slice, you&#39;d think they could lower the price. <br><br>Cheesecake factory is a middle-of-the-road place for those shopping at the mall.

food and service are always great and the vegan options are awesome. the tomato basil pasta without the cheese is amazing, and the bread is vegan too! always love coming here. thank you for your options.

Service here is better compared to the Orland Park location.. its sad I need to travel 30 miles away to enjoy this chain when there is one literally a mile away on Orland. Any how I had the Lousiana Chicken is was amazing I usually get the orange chicken but glad I switched things up this time around. Wife had her usually chicken fettuccine Alfredo no complaints there. Service was 100 percent better at this location. Sucks I can&#39;t come here often cause of the distance.
Ordered the Evelyn&#39;s pasta- chock full.of veggies, very flavorful yet light. Ordered to go- great service spot on timing, well.prepped service to take with me.

Great cheesecake, great service, decent enough food, but WAY overpriced.<br><br>I get why people like to come or want to try this out. It looks nice and is nice. The service is outstanding, as well as their cheesecake, but the quality of food doesn&#39;t equal to what they charge.

I spent 10 years in chicago, this is the Restaurant I grow up with my family. I spent enough time and money here, because I love this place. Family oriented place with good and plentiful food in a servings. I could never finished my plate.. too much to eat. Love the portion and the variety of foods. Chicken samosas are amazing. Kale salad is very refreshing. Corn tamale cake delicious. The wheat bread is one of a kind , I love it all the times to have a bite. Parking on the street and they also have valet parking. Please make a reservation if you have a big group. Average noise level. Good for family. Come hungry and go happy. Love this place.
Good food order from the skinny menu. Taste was great portion was just smaller<br> Tried the shrimp alfredo. Had strawberry cheesecake never dissapoints

Worst experience in Oak Brook location ever. The host lady was rude. I was told for 20min wait for party of 6. 20 min passed I went up and checked with her. She said you had to wait. For how long? She didn&#39;t know. I saw other group were called and almost no one was left waiting. Then a new group came I went up to her. She seemed to care about other and ignored me. A while longer I got the flashing lights indicated that my table ready. I went up. She took the indicator away and called a few more.. seats them. I asked again. Then another lady came and seated us. I was about to walk out many times but because I had recommended my friends this place and the best cheesecakes in town. It was my friends first and probably their last.

Warning if you have more than 4 people in your party they will treat you like you are unimportant and unwelcome. We called the day before to make a reservation only to find out they do not accept reservations. We arrived during a non peak dining time, about 3.55pm. We were told the approximate wait time our party of nine people would be 65-95 minutes, it was not even super crowded, there were people waiting but they were getting seated quickly. Table after table of people with just 3 or 4 people in their party got seated almost immediately or with an under 10 minute wait. I understand that a group of 9 is larger than normal and might require having two tables be pushed together, I saw on several occasions two 4 top tables open up side bay side which could have accommodated us since we had 3 kids in the group. Don&#39;t even waste your time on this place, you&#39;re just a number.
Love this place! I always return for the same food item chipotle pasta, so good! &amp; Dulce de leche cheesecake is my go to every time as well..

3 stars for great location (oak brook mall), great tasting food, and good service. <br><br>I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants so I usually won&#39;t eat at one at my own will but Cheesecake Factory  gets me every time. I take my clients for business lunch here often because of the variety in food. The variety range from Chinese to French cuisine! And plus their cheesecakes are truly decadent!<br><br>MUST HAVE: tamale cakes for appetizer, southwest chicken chipotle pasta, &amp; Hershey&#39;s chocolate cheesecake. <br><br>This is my first time ordering from their skinny menu. My order had hair in it so I didn&#39;t take one bite of if. I was offered by the server to get another entree but who knows if they will just remove the hair, stick it in the microwave and re serve the same dish??? So as hungry as I was, I refused to eat anything there at that time. It just took away my appetite. But I will most definitely come back!

I&#39;ve patronize this place probably 10xs give or take a few. I&#39;ve had pasta, Cajun meals , chili, burgers etc...and my conclusion is that the cheesecake is all they do well. The portions are excessive but they usually lack flavor. The wait is based up your timing so I get that. The bottom line is cut the menu in at least half and have a few signature meals. Friday, Applebee&#39;s , Chili&#39;s even D&amp;B is better value and taste.

The tempura fish tacos were absolutely amazing. Although they were fried, they didn&#39;t seem heavy and greasy. Perfectly crispy on the outside and fresh on the inside. The rice and beans on the side were also good. Server let us take our time and was attentive to refilling our glasses of water. The hazelnut crunch cheesecake was a perfect way to finish the meal.

Food was nothing to get excited about. Bathrooms were very dirty, paper towels overflowing everywhere and water all over sink and floors. It wasn&#39;t even that busy and we waited over 30 minutes for one piece of cheesecake after our meal, and then had to wait another 10 minutes for our check. Fancy restaurant prices with a staff that did not match that.

Eh. It&#39;s basically a glorified Friday&#39;s but at least at Friday&#39;s your not waiting over an hour be seated ( even though the hostess said 30 mins- I would have left if it was longer than that)  for fast mediocre service &amp; food.  Don&#39;t waste your time &amp; money- go somewhere else.  We ordered an appetizer, salads and the cheesecake to go because we were over waiting for so long.  The food was just ok, the Salad potions were huge which is totally ridiculous- because who can eat all that lettuce and honestly you wouldn&#39;t want to take it home for later.  The server was nice but can clearly see he was rushed and not very attentive.  Unfortunately I will not be back.

This is a must. The food is delicious, the drinks are even better, and the cheesecake is out of this world. I was concerned about the reviews for the over crowding, because they don&#39;t do reservations, but really didn&#39;t have to wait to long. They really should have reservations.  Also 1 thing about it, It&#39;s very dark in there when there is no outside light, But it doesn&#39;t take away from the taste of the food. Oh and did I mention the drinks are amazing. :-)

We went as a family of four on a Saturday before 5 knowing the wait after 5 is ridiculous. We checked in at 4:57 (valet text time) and we were told a 20-30 minute wait. We were seated at 6. I had checked a couple of times after 5:30 and was assured we were the next table of four. <br><br>When I pointed out to the host that they missed their window by twice as long he tried to pass it off as less than 15 min.  I didn&#39;t push it, I was just happy to finally be seated. <br><br>As far as table service goes we had four main courses served over 10 minutes. We also asked for refills on drinks when there server took the empties away. When we asked where they were 20 minutes later he acted like we never asked and when they came after we were done eating and we complained about how long it took he offered to take them back. <br><br>All-in-all we are never going back. It just is not worth the hassle and poor service.

I have been to other cheesecake factories in the past, so I knew what to expect. We went after a charity stair climb, so it was early, just after they opened on a weekend. We had a large group, and were easily accommodated. Some ordered off the lunch menu, and some ordered of the breakfast menu. Everything was great, and had amazing flavor. My brother in law keeps talking about his waffle and bacon. I ordered the chicken pot pie (from the low cal menu), and it was absolutely delish. It was just the right size for one person to be filled. I also had a small side salad as well. Our servers were great, friendly, and were able to keep our orders straight. Of course we had to get dessert, and I believe we got the carrot cake to share, as its my moms fav. It was really good. Will go back again when I want to splurge on a meal.

Love this place. My family comes here a lot on special days. They have a wide range of food on their menu - pasta, steak, fish, salads, tons of appetizers, and of course cheesecake (they also serve other desserts). For appetizers, I&#39;d recommend their fried mac and cheese balls - so delicious and of course very cheesy. I&#39;ve tried their grilled salmon, which is good. I&#39;m not big on the sauce they use, but it&#39;s a good and filling meal. However, their Miso Salmon is amazing - it&#39;s a sweater sauce and the salmon sits on top of rice, making a perfect combination. Their fettuccine Alfredo is good too. Lots of sauce. The noodles are kind of flatter and thinner than other places I&#39;ve tried so I&#39;m not as big a fan of their pasta but their sauce is good. I&#39;m not a big fan of their omelettes either - very oily. My boyfriend always gets their steak here. My favorite meal here is their caesar salad - it&#39;s really big, and the dressing is just fantastic. My favorite cheesecake is the Oreo cheesecake. For drinks, I tried their passion fruit margarita. I love margaritas and this one was definitely a hit. The service is always good and friendly, and I love the decor inside. I would recommend a reservation as it can get pretty busy some nights.
My husband asked &#34;Is this like a test facility? Is this where everyone comes to train. It&#39;s a very awkward atmosphere.&#34; <br>Cheesecake excellent, the rest is a lot left to be desired.

People just love this place, especially out of town friends, and I can never understand it. Fortunately, they have avocado toast, so I&#39;ll always be ok. Amazingly, they serve cuisine from a number of ethnicities, but with...well, suburban American flair.<br><br>Most plates look appealing enough. Everything is very salty though, and I get the impression that there&#39;s not a lot of fresh ingredients in the kitchen.  The first thing they want to know is what overpriced wine you&#39;d like. It smacks of efficiency; corporate food.

Date of Visit February 28th 2018 5pmish<br>Went for a birthday celebration had a party of 7 adults<br>Our waitress  was great very attentive but not hovering. Our bread and drinks were refilled and a need to basis without having to ask.<br>Everyone had a different dish so I will review my dish only I have eaten here before but it was a very long time ago.<br>The bread was very crusty and I love crusty warm fresh bed and probable over enjoyed the bread to be honest some comments were the white bread was to crusty but I enjoy it that way. <br>I decided to order the grilled fish tacos and take a chance, everywhere I order them I am very disappointed but SURPRISE.. their fish tacos were awesome!! The fish was the right texture with no fishy taste but you could tell you were eating fish if that makes sense. The additional ingredients that were on the taco were fresh tasting with lots of flavor.<br>You got 4 small tacos and a side of rice and beans and I feel this was enough for an adult person serving wise, I did end up taking 2 tacos home  (remember the bread lol) and I tell ya even cold these still are the best fish tacos I have ever had!!!  <br>I guess they may be worth the $15 I paid for my meal without soda or dessert. I only had water and decided against the cheese cake since I just can not bring myself to pay $8 plus for a piece of cheesecake, even tho I really wanted one I just couldn&#39;t do it. <br>The fish tacos were very delicious and would love to have them again and may in the future but I have to admit I thought  the dessert and soda themselves were a bit pricey, toooo pricey. <br>I still think even with cost they deserve 5 stars

Great service at The Cheesecake Factory but mediocre food. The calamari was fresh and very tasty. The soup however was croutons and shredded cheese for French onion. Also, not many onions at all and not much flavor. The kids meal looked delicious and chicken was moist. The four cheese pasta was okay. It was edible but nothing I&#39;d want again. It was room temperature, noodles were very hard and the taste just wasn&#39;t all that great. Strawberry shortcake for dessert was not sweet at all. It was lacking a syrup or flavor to the shortcake. It was very dry. Nothing was awful, but wouldn&#39;t go back.

Cheesecake Factory is a family favorite. There&#39;s so much on the menu. There&#39;s something for everyone. <br><br>Waitresses are always pretty happy and welcoming even though they have a lot on their plate (hehe) <br><br>Speaking of plates, the portions here are pretty huge which compensates for the prices. Some things are kind of overpriced (like the mex fusion or Asian fusion stuff) but it&#39;s a treat for people that don&#39;t have a lot of authentic restaurant in the area.<br><br>To start, the whole wheat bread is pretty good.. it gives a five star based on the theory of &#34;judge a restaurant by the free bread&#34;. <br><br>The calamari is probably the best I&#39;ve had. It&#39;s lightly breaded and I don&#39;t get the feeling that it&#39;s frozen. So good, I&#39;d be deceived if the tartar sauce or cocktail sauce is homemade. <br><br>Entree wise, I usually get the chicken and shrimp gumbo cuz it&#39;s creamy, tomato-y, spicyish from the andouille sausage. Something I rarely find in the Midwest. <br><br>This place is the epitome of an American restaurant and I&#39;m glad is a pretty solid chain restaurant. <br><br>I&#39;m also not a cheesecake junky. I just come for the food. I bet the cheesecake is really good. My sister always gets the Oreo supreme and never shares. <br><br>I only knock off stars for the overcrowdedness being next to a mall :(.. a fourty min wait is wack.

I love the food - it&#39;s the only reason I keep coming back to this establishment.  <br><br>Their policies on reservations are ridiculous. I wasn&#39;t permitted to reserve a table for 11 people. They&#39;d prefer I&#39;d clog their small waiting area for up to 2 hours. Give me a break - I&#39;m not having my elderly grandfather wait to eat dinner for 2 hours. A party of 11 is a pretty good tab and it&#39;s a shame they turn people away.

I usually love love love Cheesecake Factory but what I&#39;m noticing is everything is getting smaller and the prices are getting higher which is very disappointing . I didn&#39;t even get my favorite lemon raspberry cheesecake because it&#39;s not a slice, it&#39;s a Slither $9 !!!! So I ordered Cajun jambalaya pasta it was barely at the rim of the bowl which really pissed me off I&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake Factory for a very long time and I&#39;m very disappointed I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back no time soon

Like any other Cheesecake Factory, their specialities are their cheesecake and Italian food. My group of friends and I stopped by this place after our white coat ceremony on a Friday evening for dinner. My car was the last to come so we sat right away at the table but prior to everyone arriving, the restaurant did have a rule to not seat your party until everyone has arrived.<br><br>I got the chicken and biscuit and a blue moon and the total with tax and tip came out to $30, which I think is a bit steep for the food I was getting. I really do enjoy Cheesecake Factory but the restaurant isn&#39;t super fancy or anything, but their food is quite pricey.<br><br>Service was awesome and their bread is always delicious! My chicken and biscuit was a huge portion (which is fair since I paid so much for it anyways)..I ate half and took home the rest for dinner the next day. The biscuit was pretty good and I really like the mashed potatoes. The chicken was ehh, nothing too special. <br><br>I would suggest that if you are already willing to spend that much for dinner, you should check out Parkers or Maggiano&#39;s that&#39;s nearby. <br><br>Parking was very easy to find.
Went here with a friend on a Friday it was a 25 minute wait but the food was amazing and the Cheesecake even better!

ah! the cheesecake factory. home of the cheesecakes and tasty variety of food! <br><br>tonight started off with some yummy bread &amp; lemonade! the lemonade cup had the top rimmed with sugar, but i was very thirsty and found the lemonade to be a bit tangy instead of refreshing but i was so thirsty i had to drink 3 cups of it! <br>we also got the truffle bacon grilled cheese which was so so good and literally heaven in my mouth. <br><br>i ordered the fried mac n cheese &amp; fries! the fried mac n cheese is soooo good &amp; really creamy when you bite into it. they&#39;re also sitting in a type of sauce that seems to be a type of marinara sauce but it&#39;s sweeter and lighter. the fries were really good too but the bowl of fries were bigger than i had thought they would but was still priced well enough for what they were.<br><br>unfortunately, i got really full with eating bread &amp; the truffle bacon grilled cheese sticks, so i&#39;m going to bring food home to eat later! along with a vanilla bean cheesecake which sounds amazing!  <br><br>would come here again a million times because there&#39;s a great variety of food!

Maybe rename the place &#39;Long wait for luke warm Sysco-like quality food but hey it&#39;s cheap enough so whateverz&#39; <br><br>Has a good ring to it, amirite?<br><br>PS aczatually waited OVER the estimated time that&#39;s rare for a restaurant to be so off isn&#39;t it better to UNDER promise and OVERdeliver LOL anyway during the really long wait I ask can I see a menu. guy at greeter&#39;s desk literally does not look up just grabs a menu and plops it on counter like he is PISSED off that anyone would ask to see their GIGANTIC menu while they wait forever and a day. Uh cheesvake the giant menu is part of your friggin shtick! Don&#39;t you want us to order faster once sat so you can turn and get this long line down?? this is how you train staff??? Hey duh it&#39;s called customer service wake up you run a restaurant therefore someone will ask to see a menu LMFAO!!

So we&#39;re going on 90 minutes of waiting after being told that the wait was 50 minutes! <br>So as a result of the sunk cost fallacy we continued to wait because we had invested so much time already. But I am beyond pissed so this food better be beyond delicious and this server better bring it!

Frustrating that the cheesecake is good because the service almost couldn&#39;t be worse. Ordered whole cheesecake with a happy birthday plaque and of course when we get there it is not ready. Not in the box, no plaque on it. Had to wait 35 min for the cake to go in a box. Then when I looked at it there was no plaque. Probably won&#39;t go anymore after a few of these issues.

I am a fan of this place. Especially the bread you get before your meal--the brown bread is where it&#39;s at. My salad was pretty big and filling, and tasty. I would recommend it if you want something light. Their cheesecakes cannot be beat. I think any type you get will be fantastic so it is always worth it to try a new one each time.

This location is like others except that cell reception here is terrible.  AT&amp;T reception floats from nominal LTE to 4G  (but in reality 3G when you do a speed test).  Web browsing or even sending a text message is impossible.  To make matters worse, they don&#39;t offer free WiFi to compensate for this severe reception deficiency.  Verizon reception is only slightly better.  Cheesecake Factory should step up their game.

AH, the good old cheesecake factory. This place is something special, with it&#39;s 300 + menu items and 60 deserts+drinks, it&#39;s unbeatable in food choice. LITERALLY something for everyone. <br><br>I came here for a casual dinner with my boyfriend. We both had the baja chicken tacos. I was kind of upset though. Their normally huge portions - the bang for your buck menu - is no longer! These tacos used to be huge and now there&#39;s literally four two-bite tacos that barely fed me! They were still extremely delicious though.
