We also had Mai Thai&#39;s and of course the chocolate bread was on point per usual.<br><br>Staff was also great as always and manager Kim V. was full of energy and happily walking around making sure all the guests (including us!) were happy by coming to our table after the first few bites and checking on the quality of our food. <br><br>Overall yes, yes, YES to anyone who&#39;s thinking about stopping by!

Ordered food for pickup and the cheesecake was placed upside down in its container and completely smashed. I understand ordering to go may slightly change the aesthetic of the food but completely smashed and upside down cheesecake is unacceptable. I am disappointed in their service.

I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here. When I think of big chains, I usually think a loss of quality, but this was not the case. The quality was great, the service was good, and the food was delicious. What I was most surprised by was the options on the menu. There was just about anything you could want to choose from. <br><br>We got some drinks at the bar before while we waited, these were also very good. The wait was shorter than anticipated too which is nice. I can&#39;t wait to go back already!

Drinks are great here. Had a passion fruit mojito and it was delicious! Had long islands too but tasted the same as anywhere. <br><br>But the food i think is mediocre. Been here 4 times and never been wowed by the food. I&#39;ve had Baja tacos, spicy chicken sandwich (where was the spice?!), angel hair pasta with shrimp, and some sort of pizza. Honestly they were all so bland. I could make it better myself at home. <br><br>Cheesecake on the other hand is delicious! (You&#39;d hope i mean it&#39;s their name) i had a fresh strawberry cheesecake and mm mmm mmm. <br><br>Great and friendly staff, delicious drinks, but food is meh minus ding ding ding the cheesecake.

Went here last night and it was pretty good. Service was great and food was pretty good. Tried a few different things. The calarmari was pretty good, just wished it was marinara sauce instead of cocktail sauce, just because that&#39;s my preference. We also tried the stuffed mushrooms, which were amazing. Then we had the NY strip steak entree with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The asparagus were perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were delicious. The steak was average, we asked for medium and seemed more medium rare. We didn&#39;t have room for desserts but we did get drinks. I had the Mai tai which was okay, but to my preference it was too strong but was very pretty looking. Then my boyfriend had just a cranberry vodka(grey goose) double shot, short, and he was impressed as they served it perfectly. <br><br>The service was real good though, and overall interested to go again to try different things on the menu.

Hi give me a shake skate factory one store or zero stars if I can because all the food is horrible it takes a lot to do and all the orange juices are horrible and on the water so horrible to want to do and everything so dirty and I meeting a dirty things I can get a disease I can&#39;t even get really bad disease like cancer and I really hate this place in all of the cheesecakes in the world just get batteries in the world. HAHA jk

So not to be bragging, but I am really good friends with jamiroquai, and every time he comes to the Midwest I always have to take him to THIS Cheesecake Factory, he always compliments the freshness and originality at this one.<br>If it&#39;s good for quai it&#39;s good for me!

Love this place. Always busy, but didn&#39;t have to wait long. They also accept reservations for larger party. Food was amazing and the server was great. Plenty of parking. When you&#39;re done dining, definitely go to outdoor mall next door to walk it off. I did.
Yum! The only problem you have is which cheesecake do you choose! Banana cream pictured here  Great salads here too.

I went last night. And after a small issue came up with my bacon-bacon burger. Apparently they cooked it a bit too much. And the Manager came and informed me. That they were going to take a bit longer. No problem. Let me tell you , when i bit into that burger. I had a relationship with that burger! I lived a long life. And grew old on the porch and watched our grandchildren play in the yard with that burger. . . Thats how good it was. My only complaint now. Is i am forever cursed of living in the shadow of that burgers greatness. Unable to recreate it anywhere else :(

Don&#39;t come in and order a burger/cheeseburger well done becuase they will over cook it. It looked good on the outside as soon as I tried cutting into it I knew it wasn&#39;t right. I tried eating a piece of it and it was tough. It&#39;s sad when I could walk into a wing place and they make better burgers regardless of how you order it. My Gf&#39;s chicken looked a bit undercooked which is why I stay away from chicken plates. Their ridiculously huge menu is 80% chicken. At least the ambience and service were good and the manager did right when I complained. Drinks were properly chilled/cold

I am so disappointed in the Cheesecake  Factory. <br>My husband and I ordered the Shepherds pie and had to send them both back because they were literally cold in the middle. Sent an email to let them know how disappointed I was with my phone number and address. We were celebrating National Vietnam Veterans Day, my husband went to Nam, and thought we would have a nice lunch in Oakbrook. I received a phone call from a manager and said they would send out a gift card to us. Never received it.
I was at The Cheesecake Factory for a long lunch. Purchased Cheesecake slices to bring home. When did these slices become one fourth of the size we used to get? Price the same too? What?!

If you&#39;ve ever watched shows like &#34;Restaurant Impossible&#34;, you&#39;ve probably heard that restaurants that try to have a hundred different items on their menu generally don&#39;t have the best quality food. I would say this is completely true about the Cheesecake Factory. There are so many items on the menu that it&#39;s near impossible to decide, but the food is nothing spectacular. They also tend to be super busy, meaning the service is subpar. <br><br>I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, as it&#39;s usually raved about online. The chicken was super moist on the inside, and crispy on the outside. The pasta, however, was oily and the saucy didn&#39;t have any spice to it. There were also 5 slices of mushroom and two or three pepper chunks, which hardly qualifies as present in the dish. The serving was huge, and probably could have fed 3 people. <br><br>I also ordered the Kahlua cheesecake, which was amazing. I wasn&#39;t a fan of the brownie layer, but the coffee cheesecake and chocolate mousse were amazing. <br><br>Overall, you&#39;re paying high prices for average quality food and slow service. I would go for the cheesecake, but eat dinner somewhere else.

Ok, just came back to The Cheesecake Factory to have dinner with friends we sat outside temperature was absolutely great sun was nice and warm breeze was fresh the food was great and the cheesecake was beyond.<br>A waitress name was Maria V. Manager came out and introduce yourself. I think that&#39;s great thank you to shake Factory

Today my experience at the cheesecake factory, was absolutely awful. The servers dropped hot appetizers onto the floor subsequently splashing hot cheese on to my clothing and coat. After several failed attempts  to clean my coat with soda water my coat is ruined. The manager Chris attempted to negotiate service recovery by removing the cost of the appetizers off the bill. When questioned about the condition of my coat. I received a take it or leave it attitude. So let me get this correct. This establishment wasted food on me and ruined my clothing/coat. THE COST OF THE DAMN APPETIZERS DOESN&#39;T REPLACE THE COST OF MY COAT. AND I AM SUPPOSED TO BE THRILLED THAT YOU DIDN&#39;T CHARGE ME FOR THE APPETIZERS . CUSTOMERS SERVICE IS AWFUL.

Still waiting for the 2ed hour for a table they said would take 1.20 mins. Yes we&#39;re a large group of 11 + baby but to wait this long to be told we&#39;re waiting for the last people to leave, they paid their bill but they&#39;re not leaving! Find us another table that will work for us! This is ridiculous!!! Now after waiting 2 hours our family members that we&#39;ve waited with a child had to leave because the baby had to eat.

I LOVE cheesecake and this place serves the best, I gave a four star because when I ordered a club sandwich with a house salad, the salad wasn&#39;t good at all the lettuce seem to have a funny taste, the server was nice and the atmosphere was very pleasant. I will be returning soon, and yes I would recommend this place to others.

&#39;Murica.<br><br>I submit that this chain is the new poster child for &#39;Murica. It&#39;s supplanted the Red Lobsters and Olive Gardens and Chilis and Applebee&#39;s of the world (arguably) and now represents a night out with your parents.<br><br>For your consideration:<br>EXHIBIT A<br>That menu is massive. If you can&#39;t find something you like, then you clearly don&#39;t like eating out. Not that it&#39;s masterfully prepared, but just that it covers the gamut from pastas to salads to burgers and steaks and chops and pizza and every dang thing in between. It&#39;s sensory overload, and it&#39;s perfectly American. We love our variety. We love one of everything. <br><br>EXHIBIT B<br>The portions are massive. So, I don&#39;t want to jump on the bandwagon about big Americans, but the numbers don&#39;t lie. Numbers notwithstanding, I have also noticed that when I travel abroad, the serving sizes are smaller. Paint it how you like--American excess or a culture that seeks out good value--but the portions are honkin&#39; huge here. <br><br>EXHIBIT C<br>Dessert. So much dessert. And again, our national colors are red, white, blue and sugar. And there&#39;s plenty of it. Pages of cheesecake. So much. And some of it (like the cookie dough one I tried) is so sugared and tricked out, you don&#39;t really know you&#39;re eating cheesecake. Do yourself a favor and stick with a simple kind.<br><br>EXHIBIT D <br>Massive interior. This location seemed to go on forever. I went for a hike the left from the hostess stand trailhead and I stopped for food along the way. So many tables. We love our big spaces!<br><br>All that said, my hat is off to them for being open and feeding a road-weary dude like myself. They were open until midnight and still firing food at 11:30 when I rolled in. The pasta and chicken I had, while salty and rich, was still hot and served fast, so I could get to my hotel and get to bed.

At first when I saw the review with only an average (3-star) rating, I was a bit surprised, but after my visit (see visited comment below), I though the rating is well deserved 2-1/2 to 3 star at best.   <br>Although a popular resturant (this particular visit was to celebrate a birthday), the service and food (except for the sweets/desserts) were nothing to be excited about.  First, when we arrived at our table, there were sets of silverwares and plates missing; although, the hostess brought &#34;some&#34; over, but only folks (no knife and no plates)... Next, the server took our orders then came back carried 7 plastic mugs of water to our table with water running out of the mugs down the isle to our table and got one of our gusts very wet (he had to rush to the men&#39;s room to dry up; go figure how wet that was...).  ANOTHER SERVER HELPED BY BRINGING OVER SEVERAL CLOTH NAPKINS, GUESS WHAT!, THE SERVERS BEGIN TO USE THOSE NAPKINS TO WIPE THE TABLE AND FLOOR WITH THEM - I WONDER WHAT ELSE THIS RESTURANT USED THOSE &#34;CLOTH NAPKINS&#34; FOR OTHER THAN WIPING FLOORS, TABLES.... I seriously thought napkins are only for   CUSTOMERS TO WIPE THEIR MOUTHS AND HANDS! Ug!!   If this wasn&#39;t for celebrating our friend&#39;s birthday, I would have walked out already!<br>Food wise, my sandwich/toast was way over toasted, so dry they cut my mouth and the creamy potato soap was less than warm on the cold side...  I can only imagine how the other dishes were for others at the table.  The only &#34;good&#34; food were the refilled bread which were warm and soft.  <br>Writing this review sure gives me a bad memory of my visit last night, thank goodness I was one of the guests; otherwise, I would have called whomever is better hands-on and capable manager already!

Sat us promptly and waitress friendly.  Food came reasonable time. I ordered pot stickers which were extremely sour-more vinegar than pot sticker.  A floor manager came over as well as the waitress.  They took the order back and gave me a menu to reorder.  My wife&#39;s order-chicken Romano was great but the waitress and floor manager that didn&#39;t return until my wife finished eating her order.  Then they asked if I was ready to order. I had to get back to work which I did-hungry! Neither individual apologized.  Wouldn&#39;t a good wait staff be more involved when a patron was already not happy? Will not go back.

This is the one of the few Cheesecake Factory locations in Chicagoland. My experience wasn&#39;t as good as the Orland Park location, but I still had a great experience.<br><br>The service was pretty good. The waitress I had struggled when she started serving us, but then she got better as the experience went on. She was friendly to us the whole time. It feels like she just started working at the place.<br><br>The food was pretty good. They have great bread. It&#39;s nice and crunchy. I had the fried macaroni and cheese, and that tasted good. It was crunchy on the outside, and good on the inside. I also had the four cheese pasta with chicken. The pasta and the chicken both tasted good together. For dessert, I had the Oreo Dream Extreme cheesecake. It tasted like a dessert, and it also tasted fantastic. You have a bunch of ingredients in one cheesecake which taste really good.<br><br>All in all, this is a good place for food and a fantastic place for dessert. I will be back here again.

The service was average. Our food came quick, and our waters were filled regularly. Our conversations were being interrupted suddenly by the waitress just to see if everything was fine. <br><br>The food itself was average as well. The calamari is a nice appetizer that is crispy and tender. There&#39;s also a horseradish sauce on the side that complements the dish amazingly. My entree was the mushroom burger and it was mediocre at best. The flavor was in line with a microwaveable burger for some reason. The meat didn&#39;t have any flavor to it, and the burger was just topped with mushrooms and onions. The mixture was surprisingly bland and heavy unfortunately. The Fontina cheese didn&#39;t really do anything for the burger because it&#39;s quite mild. Definitely not what I expected.<br><br>I ordered the Kahlua cheesecake, which is has flavors similar to Tiramisu, however, the Tiramisu cheesecake here is far too sweet. The Kahlua is just the right amount of sweet, and creaminess in a dessert. It&#39;s light for a cheesecake, and has an accent of coffee to contrast the cake&#39;s richness. If you like Tiramisu or other coffee related cakes, give the Kahlua a shot!<br><br>It&#39;s called the Cheesecake Factory, so the cheesecake was great as expected. The other aspects of the meal were a little bit lacking.

We had a variety of dinners. Mine was the Chicken Constaleeta, was delicious . Chicken was mouth watering delicious with awesome mashed potatoes and asparagus. We topped off our dinners with the infamous cheesecakes.<br><br>Service was terrific.  A gem of a restaurant!

Everything was great, from the experience, local, to service. Loved the pineapple chicken and, off course, the Cheesecake. The porcions are very big, so who eat a little should share. We asked the white chocolate raspberry Cheesecake, amazing.

Not only is this place beautiful, it has the best cheesecake!  The food is wonderful, I suggest the lettuce wraps. It has a full bar, the strawberry daiquiri was so good.  <br>The Wait was a bit long (50 min) but in the end was worth it.

Let me say the cheese cake and the cake was good, but have went up in price. That&#39;s why I only gave on 1 star Then then cashier instead of putting the receipt  in the bag she threw it in the garage. And then had to wait about 5 minutes till the Manager to come print another one out. I didn&#39;t like that either. That&#39;s the other reason why I only gave one star. Hopefully they will practice putting the Customer receipt in the bag for the future.

Always a great choice to visit here! Downside is that if you go in the evening, especially on the weekends, you are guaranteed at least an 1 1/2 hour wait. Otherwise, the food is always fantastic, huge menu of over 20 pages, service is fast and generally always right! One of my favorite places to go!

Been here a couple times and we always have a  good time. I always order fried calamari, it&#39;s one of my favorite appetizers. However this time it seemed a bit overly breaded! But their signature bread before the meal made up for it. It is always warm like it just came out of the oven. Last but not least, the Cheesecake and wine! I recommend my personal favorite the ultimate velvet cheesecake! By the way service is always awesome!

Worst experience of my life at a Cheesecake Factory. The recipe for my meal had been &#34;updated&#34; however, there were no updates of such changes on the menu. I had to send the food back twice and ultimately resorted to not eating.<br><br>My waiter was annoyed and not engaging. The manager seemed uninformed and indifferent about the situation as well. I&#39;ll never come back to this location again. I hope that no one else gets treated as poorly as I have.

Went on one of their busiest days of the year, Mother&#39;s Day. The young lady waiting on us was so great. She was patient, courteous, helpful, calm, attentive, and she did recommend a new dish for me to try that everyone enjoyed. Well done.

I love the Chinese Chicken Salad!  I have probably eaten 25 through the years at different locations.  Last night I ordered one for takeout and was shocked when I got home and opened the bag.  First the lettuce was warm and limp then I noticed it was the dregs of the lettuce. You know when you make a salad at home those yellow parts that most people throw out? That&#39;s what I had!!! Crappy yellow lettuce!  I had 3 mandarin oranges and maybe 5 of the little crunchy pieces!! I can&#39;t believe that was acceptable to the person packing it up!! Have their standards slipped that much?  Also they sent home bread that was so hard I couldn&#39;t even eat it.  Maybe they have been around too long and have become complacent they&#39;re busy so they don&#39;t care about the quality anymore.

You really can&#39;t go wrong here. I swear they have to have one of the, if not the lengthiest menus. I mean it&#39;s a book! For some all the options can be overwhelming but, you will always find something on it to suit your taste buds I am sure. It&#39;s also always packed and usually a 30-40 minute wait on the weekends to be seated because this place is great for groups and special occasions. I enjoy the bar area to eat honestly, and it&#39;s typically first come first serve and not always crowded. I have had so many items off the menu over the years, but my favorites are the shrimp scampi and the firecracker salmon rolls. I literally some days stop in just for the salmon rolls! They&#39;re so tasty and crispy. The spicy chili sauce that comes with it is delicious too! The shrimp scampi comes with huge butterfly lightly battered shrimp that sit and swim in a linguine pasta sauce with garlic and butter and is oh so doggone good!! These dishes have never disappointed and honestly I don&#39;t think there has ever been a time I have been dissatisfied with a dish here. Some people are not into the big chain style restaurants, but I must admit this one here has proven itself over the years to be consistent with great food and great service. Their cheesecake is on another level of cheesecake. I mean like on the level you not sharing!! (lol), and I guess that is why the entire restaurant is named after it. I can eat their cheesecake all day everyday and not get tired of it. Always fresh, made as you order and come in every flavor you can think of. The strawberry is my favorite. Something about big, firm, fresh, sweet, juicy strawberry&#39;s on top of a cheesecake you just cannot get enough of. The drinks are pretty good too. My favorites are the Georgia Peach and the Strawberry Martini. My only pet-peeved here is they do not list the drink prices on their menu, which I don&#39;t understand why they do not? They list the prices of the food in the menu, so why not the drinks? If I am ordering a drink I surely wanna know how much it cost and feel silly asking the waiters how much every drink is. Sorry, but not sorry, I am not paying over $13 for no drink from nowhere. The parking on a weekend can get really congested especially since they&#39;re in the mall and in the restaurant district as I call it, so they share parking space with like 6 other restaurants, but if no parks let up after circling the parking lots over and over, you can park by Neiman Marcus, there&#39;s always  available space over there.
Kudos to Cheesecake Factory for having vegan and vegetarian options. I was so pleasantly surprised that there is an entire page dedicated to vegetarian items. Can you say avocado toast??? Yum

We arrived at 5:30pm, we told the wait would be one hour.  1 hour and 40 minutes later we sat down.  Finally at 8:15 we asked to have our food brought to go.  This place takes no reservations and is completely overwhelmed by crowd.  The food, when you get it, is ok, but it&#39;s not worth a 3 hour wait. I&#39;m DONE with this chain.

I gave this place a second chance. My second experience was worse than the first.<br><br>My niece &amp; I went yesterday evening, we arrived after 7pm. After the wait time was 25 mins to n seated but the food arrival to the table was close to an hr.<br><br>It took an estimate 40 mins for my niece to receive her burger. My 1st veggie burger never arrived. The server who brought my niece burger to the table told me my veggie burger spoils b ready in 3mins. What restaurant brings a partial table order???   15 mins later, no veggie burger. The waiter asked twice  if I had received my burger, he finally told me a manger will come to my table to speak with me.<br><br>The manger apologized &amp; said the burger had burned. He said another burger was cooking &amp; said he wouldn&#39;t charge me for the burger. Do to the late time, I requested my veggie burger &amp; fries to go.<br><br>Today I decided to eat my veggie burger. The burger was horrible. It tasted no where never like the one I had on 7/16/18.  The burger tasted like rice &amp; crumbled black beans, the two main ingredients. The burger had no seasoning or flavor. <br><br>I&#39;m highly disappointed in this location &amp; have no plans to return any time soon.

We love this place. The food is always delicious.  When I was there for lunch on Saturday with my husband, we both loved our meal.  I tried Coconut Curry Mahi Mahi.  It was fabulous.  He did a cheeseburger and loved it, however the fries were subpar.  <br>I also had a frozen drink called the Georgia Peach which has a swirl of raspberry in it. Yummy!<br>My only complaint is how pushy the servers are about dessert.  Makes dieting even harder!<br>Overall, great chain and great location.  Four stars!

I used to not like cheesecake, then I came back after 3 years. I ordered the miso salmon with roasted beets instead of the rice. I came back again and it wasn&#39;t the same. They lack consistency and the food often comes out cool. The service isn&#39;t bad and the environment is nice! Just wish they were more consistent. Sadly, not worth the wait. (This picture is from the first time I went back)
Veronica Was 200% On It~!  Her Service Was Above And Beyond~!  Food Was Made To Order But Service Is Why I&#39;ll Be Back~!  Thank You Veronica For Making Our Adventure Phenomenol~!

Gave it three stars, only because the server was awesome and the food was good and those two combined saved our visit.<br>We were celebrating and went there as a couple and were having a third person join us later. We sat down and moved the table slightly to make room for our third and one of us put our hand in gum under the table!! As we were cleaning it up, and washing with paper towels and soap from the bathroom our server came over and we explained what happened and he looked apologetic and said they scrape the tables regularly...which made me turn green at the thought for some reason! Anyway, we ordered appetizers, meals, drinks, and desserts (took the desserts to go).<br>Food was good, server was good, but the place itself was... not so good. The fork had some kind of paper stuck to it (they use cloth napkins so I am not sure what that was), the gum under the table, and the stringy stuff in the corn (that we will call the silk from the corn instead of someone&#39;s hair). It just seems like the place itself is only so-so but they sure are trying hard to be fancy.

Met up with my friends in Oakbrook for dinner at The Cheesecake Factory - always a great place to dine at.  The atmosphere is always upbeat and the cheesecake selection is plenty big for every kind of mood you can imagine.  That said; I would have given them 5 stars but instead gave them a 3 stars rating because of the service we got from our waitress.<br><br>After self-parking our car and walking in to the restaurant, we were greeted politely by the Valet Parker, even though we did not want to pay him $4 to park our car.  The hostess and the manager greeted us and sat us at our table in less than 2 minutes, but then again, we came at around 5:15 pm - a great time to avoid the dinner crowd, which normally comes after 6:00 pm on a Friday night.<br><br>When our waitress came over to greet us and got our drink and appetizer orders, she quickly returned with the drinks and later, the Thai Lettuce Wraps - SUPER YUMMY!  From there, everything went down hill fast in terms of service.  Like most people, we made a mess eating our appetizers because the lettuce was dripping with sauces on the table - talk about finger &#34;licking&#34; good!  After she took away our appetizers, she didn&#39;t even bother to clean the table - which was clearly messy and visible by everyone.  How can you not see the sauce all over the table and not even wipe it down?????<br><br>We all decided to wait and see what she would do next, and sure enough, she came back with our dinner plates and served them on top of the messy table without blinking an eye - UNBELIEVABLE!!!!  Then she cleared the table of dirty dishes and still didn&#39;t even clean the &#34;new mess&#34; on top of the &#34;old mess.&#34;  After all that said, we ordered dessert and waited for her to bring out our cheesecakes, and you guess it, she served them on the dirty table - WOW!!!!<br><br>Given the price point for this restaurant, you would expect better trained waiters / waitresses, but I guess management did not care.  To be honest, I&#39;ve had much better services from &#34;fast-casual&#34; restaurants then here.  The bottom line, I would recommend The Cheesecake Factory for their atmosphere and food quality, but good &#34;Customer Service&#34; needs improvement quickly!

Finally dine in cheese cake factory, waiting only 20mins. <br><br>I ordered grilled salmon with mashed potato. Mashed potato is a little dry. Salmon is good. The sauce is like mayo with lemon, which matches the flavor of salmon. <br><br>Also I had a smore cheesecake, hmmmmmmm not guilty! I still think all the cheesecakes here are too sweet for me. But it just makes you feel soooo good when you have the taste of cheese cake in your mouth with some cream on top. <br><br>Also great weather for Oakbrook center. May shopping with my friend next week;)

Yesterday I came to this Cheesecake Factory and the waiters was really nice is greeted us as soon as we sat down to take our order. When it came to ordering I order a RARE smoked bbq burger and for side I ask a mix green salad with balsamic. The worse part was that they had me waiting for more then 30mins for a RARE burger that came out to be WELLDONE like for real. And instead of they bring me the mix green salad I order they gave me fries. After I order fried calamari but it tasteless no favor it was more breaded then the actually calamari itself

I haven&#39;t been to the restaurant in about 3 years. I am sad to write that the food quality has diminished. My husband ordered an omelet with potatoes. The potatoes were little bricks and very cold. The omelet was lukewarm. I just had an appetizer of the samosas. These samosas were made with a flaky type of crust similar to phyllo dough. Samosas should be made with more of a fried bread type crust. Doubt I will return.

The best service I have had in a very long time! Giedre was amazing! She checked on my friend and I always at the right times. She took care of us completely from start to finish! Thank you for such a fantastic experience, and the food was great!

I came here for brunch and was so underwhelmed with the service, Schaumburg always has better service.<br><br>I ordered a skinnylious burger with salad and my boyfriend ordered the lunch portion of the orange chicken. To drink i ordered coffee and he ordered a mimosa and bloody mary. <br><br>The food was awesome as usual his orange chicken was so good! I wished I would have orderedit too! Hands down the best meal I&#39;ve ever had here. The pieces of chicken were large and crispy. The sauce it was in was flavorful, sweet and tangy I loved how it got all over the white rice and coated the veggies with the chicken.<br><br>The service....sigh....he forgot to offer us bread and then realized himself he forgot to offer it, we said no as we realized our meals were almost coming out. I ordered coffee and was never asked for a refill we had to get his attention and ask for it, same thing with my boyfriend&#39;s drinks we waved him down again for his drinks. <br><br>I think we will be sticking to the Schaumburg location. Oakbrook never seems to get the service right, unless we sit at the bar, like we have in the past.

Shout out to Peter! He was an awesome waiter, very friendly. We came in to celebrate a very special holiday and he made us feel good. <br><br>The people at the cheesecake section were so so so rude ! ! ! They were very unprofessional . We waited about 25 minutes JUST to order 2 cheesecakes. I do understand they were busy but when there were about 8 employees there not one of them greeted us or told us they would be right with us. When they did decide to help they were so rude , almost like we were bothering them . They really need to get it together. It doesn&#39;t matter if how nice the restaurant is because at the end of the day if their customer service is terrible people will not return. We won&#39;t be going back there ever again. Unfortunately customer service overall sucked , with the exception of Peter.

My family and I came here for dinner on a Saturday evening...around 5pm. It was already a lot of people, and we had a wait time of 1.5 hours before we could get a table for 6 people. It was Mother&#39;s Day weekend, so the wait time may have been increased. We were able to walk around the mall during this 1.5 hours, so we didn&#39;t have to sit around and wait at Cheesecake. They give you a buzzer that they say the mall is within range. <br><br>Onto the food - we ordered few appetizers - cobb salad (which was VERY good - it was everyone&#39;s favorite), texmex egg rolls (I really enjoyed it), Salmon Firecrackers (ehh a little boring), and Southern Fried Chicken sliders which were okay.<br><br>For entree I had the pasta with shrimp and sausage. It&#39;s rigatoni pasta with spicy peppers, Italian Sausage, and Shrimp. I really like the sauce. It was good. My husband had their pasta dish with Chicken which he thought was okay. My mom had their steak Diane and salmon combo..she did not enjoy her steak too much - she said it was a bit too burnt. My sister had a pasta dish and she thought it was okay. My grandma had the salmon dish. She didn&#39;t say much. My mom-in-law had their steak - she like the flavors but also thought the steak was too burnt. We ended the evening with one slice of the fresh strawberry cheesecake. I thought it was good, but everyone else said it was just average.<br><br>Overall - decent food, big menu and lots of selections. Service was just okay - they were very busy so we had to wait awhile for our waitress to come. <br><br>They also do not take reservations on weekends, only weekdays.

I was really impressed with the decor of this Cheesecake Factory. How ever the service did not<br>March the looks. My gf and I got a seat at the bar about 920 pm . Our server was Paulina. She did her normal greeting in the beginning but we did not see her for about 45 minutes after the fact we asked for the usual. Bread and water. We felt like she was more interested in her co workers being off then providing service for us . I hope she reads so she understands there are no hard feelings but take some pride in your service no matter how it is you feel thanks

So the fun thing about this place is, it&#39;s always busy. Parking is available nearby with the connection to the mall, and there is valet parking as well should you need it.<br><br>I know this place is renowned for its cheesecake, but since I don&#39;t like cheesecake, I cannot comment on that.<br><br>The establishment itself looks like every other Cheesecake Factory, kind of like a modern-ish church feel with a bar thrown in there. Personally, I find it far too loud, but that&#39;s because it&#39;s busy because it surprises me -<br><br>The food here is pretty much in my opinion like recooked leftovers, or if you want to bump it up just a tad, like gourmet airline food. I&#39;ve been here nearly 5 or 6 times in the past few years and each time from the food to the service (or serious lack of) it gets progressively worse. The only thing I see as a perk here is the outdoor seating on nice weather, it&#39;s definitely a nice location. But that&#39;s about it.<br><br>You are far better off trying perhaps Maggiano&#39;s across the street or even the Pour House.<br><br>Definitely overcrowded, understaffed (at times), overcooked and definitely overrated. Quality is not a strong suit for the establishment that allows for them to have the prices that they&#39;ve set. They are losing to the competition across the area tenfold as time will surely tell.

I really love the food at Cheesecake Factory. There really is something for everyone, no matter your tastes. Their menu is almost too big... You have to make sure to read it from page to page so you don&#39;t miss anything! I would rather have a bit menu than a small menu any day...<br><br>We came here most recently on a Sunday evening after shopping at oakbrook. We really didn&#39;t think it was going to be as busy as it was, but there was a 30-45 minute wait! We luckily were able to find a seat at the bar and didn&#39;t have to wait. <br><br>The bartenders were all attentive, though it was a little confusing on who you were supposed to order from. Our bread got forgotten twice and we had to remind them, then it never even came in the end. They also brought out two of my salads, so not sure what happened there. <br><br>I like that they have lighter options as well as your normal menu options. We got a few appetizers and a salad, and of course cheesecake!

The food was really great for a corporate chain.<br><br>The waitress gave us one word responses at best.  Sometimes she just tried to ignore us.  I find comedy in everything so we still enjoyed dinner.  I think the aircraft carrier size floor might wear servers out quick.<br><br>Have a better day tomorrow.

I was super excited to come here, especially since I have heard such good reviews for years. Well, I must say that this was not a great experience; food wise or comfortably. <br><br>My husband and I were seated next two individuals who did nothing but use fowl language, so I requested for my our seat to be moved. The h<br>Last thing that I wanted to hear on date night was someone cursing in front of children about some man. Well, we we&#39;re seated on a booth. Now, I regret asking for my seat to be moved because for  a whole hour we listed to cackling hyenas. My goodness we wanted to rip our ears off. <br><br>The food,  considering the portion size we were okay with the price. But, it was NOT good, my husband ordered the shrimp in which he said was not seasoned and tastes funny so he pretty much trashed it, I ordered fettuccini with chicken and added broccoli, this was only because for me it was the simplest thing on the menu that was already overwhelming. Well, it must have been complicated because it was over cooked and the broccoli was hard, the chicken rubbery and overall flavorless as much salt as I put on there it was still bland. The only thing okay that I ordered was the sprite and the long island. <br><br>Will I come back, NO! Very disappointed all the way around. Actually other than the waitress Elsie and Katie.

I would to love to say this place was great, but i cant. We went there on a sunday at 3pm for a early dinner for my mother in laws birthday. However to my surprise they do not take reservations on weekends, not even for large parties of 14 like ours was. We were told an hour and a half wait and that was ridiculous. So we called Seasons 52 and they were able to accomodate us immediately. Now im going to go write a fabulous  review for them<br><br>Update....just received a response. Although i appreciate it. They did nothing to accomodate or possibly alleviate the issue in the future....i am not going to go for a bday DINNER at 10 am when you open

We dined here yesterday for lunch for my sons birthday. I knew they were a little busy but probably won&#39;t be back here again. First I seen few flies in the restaurant. And at the end of our meal a dead one at our table. I ordered a Cobb salad and when it came out my plate was very dirty with something sticky so I sent it back. Any how we let the waitress know from the beginning that we were there for my sons birthday. And it took her forever to bring his dessert so we just ended up taking it to go. I did let her know about the bugs and she said she would let her manager know. Overall not a good experience.

This is my favorite Restaraunt . Amazing food and the best cheesecake you will ever try! The staff goes above and beyond !<br>A bartender I believe his name is Andrew, he suggested a couple things on the menu for me to try with some drinks . He always made sure I had everything I needed , drinks were always filled etc.. extremely polite ! <br>great experience <br>Great bartenders and staff especially cooks ! ;)<br><br>This place wouldn&#39;t be as great as it is if it weren&#39;t for the employees doing such an amazing job !!<br><br>Try the flying gorilla drink!

11:35, and we are told we need to wait to sit in the bar, as well as wait for a window table, because not enough servers are clocked in yet. However, there are 8 servers, a manager, and two hosts standing around the host stand. Hmmm.... I&#39;d rethink perception and professionalism here, guys.

We ordered samosas and it took forever for them to serve them and they were burnt. We kindly asked for a new order and they constantly were bringing out more burnt batches. Not to mention there was only two on the plate when there were supposed to be four. They were very rude serving us acting as we were forcing them to do as we kindly ask. Our food had no flavor and the service was terrible.

My friend &amp; I arrived Sun, 8/19/18, for my annual bday meal. We only had to wait 10 min the food was EXCELLENT!!! I&#39;ve never had black beans that good!!!!!! I am a chocaholic, but decided to go outside the box &amp; got the salted caramel cheesecake. All I can say is OMG!!!!!!! DA BOMB!!!! Lastly, our server was Jillian. She was truly on the ball, always ready to check on us &amp; so friendly. We live an hour away ... If we were closer I&#39;d be there at least monthly!!! Thank you!!!!!!

This restaurant/location has been a family favorite for years, until yesterday. Our daughter had chosen to eat here for her birthday. We always try to get there a little ahead of the dinner crowd so as to not have a long wait. We were seated quickly in a small roundish section on the front edge of the restaurant. There were many tables open in this area and they placed us at a very sunny window. I figured they would drop down some shade if needed.<br><br>Waiter took our drink order and brought waters quickly, but then it was hard to find him to order appetizers or even our meals. One of the times he came to us, he was holding someone&#39;s to go bag the whole time we were ordering. I thought that was a little odd. So as the setting sun was beginning to become a problem for a few of us (and we had mentioned it to our server to no avail) the shades finally began to come down, I could see again! Then just as quickly they went back up. Again something was said to the waiter and again was not interested. And then they came down again, and went back up again. This went on for some time. It was very distracting. (I found out later that it was the table next to us that wanted them up, the shades do not work individually, stupid design and those guests were wearing sunglasses, so why didn&#39;t they just sit outside!)<br><br>BTW the vegetable that came with my dish was snow peas and when I asked to switch them out with asparagus (I love their asparagus!) I was told it would cost extra. Out of the 3 salmon dishes, I was ordering the most expensive as it was and all mine came with was rice and snow peas and they wanted to charge extra for the asparagus! Outrageous, I opted for the snow peas. When my dish came out I then understood why the upcharge. The snow peas, all four of them were garnish, not an actual vegetable, shameful.<br><br>Now for the real reasons we will never come back. SALT OMG!!! My husband&#39;s, and two daughters&#39; pastas were so salty, two of them couldn&#39;t eat them at all. My son&#39;s mashed potatoes were also inedible with too much salt and pepper. We have eaten here enough times to know this wasn&#39;t normal. We said something to the waiter and he brought out only my husband a new plate of pasta, but it too was salty. The manager came out, (he was very nice) and explained that they have to keep a lot of salt in the cooking water for the pasta. Not sure why. But he did nothing to correct anything.<br><br>I felt really bad for my daughter whose birthday we were there celebrating since it was her pasta that she was unable to eat. Also no birthday celebration at all for her. And after a $335 tab we had to go home and eat something else. Guess we will have to take her somewhere else to celebrate.<br><br>On a side note, there was a table that was adjacent to us whom they did come out a sing Happy Birthday to, but it was truly pathetic. The staff looked and sounded like they truly didn&#39;t want to be there. It was so bad that another table of young girls said a big Happy Birthday and clapped for them at the end, which did help.

Bad customer service, mangers there are very rude , Ive gotten carry out there  many times and they have you go to the busy area and stand and wait for someone to get your food and there is always nobody there ! You have to wait awhile and get ignored before someone helps you , I don&#39;t see why you can&#39;t go to the cashier to get your food , you get yelled at for being in the way but there&#39;s not a place for you to stand to wait so don&#39;t sent customers to a busy area when the cashiers are just standing around chatting , They are always late with your orders as well even on slow days/time . I might have to avoid this place altogether . It&#39;s the same service dining in here as well slow service food not fresh when it comes out . I&#39;ve actually had better food and service at other locations which is a shame

Went for a birthday celebration and although the food was good the highlight of our evening was the Ellen our server. She was knowledgeable about all the items on the menu and gave excellent recommendations. Ellen was always available and prompt with our drinks. Ellen&#39;s smile made this an unforgettable birthday. I would definitely return but only if I could sit in Ellen&#39;s section.

Never disappointing, always accommodating, always great service, and always delicious. There&#39;s a reason why this restaurant, at every location, is always packed. <br>I have to keep my sodium intake low, which is impossible when you eat out. Having said that, here they&#39;ve always accommodated my request to refrain from adding salt, and they&#39;ve always done it with a smile. Nut allergies? No problem. They&#39;ll take all precautions necessary to ensure your dish is safe. <br>You&#39;ll have to set your budget a little higher here, especially if you plan on ordering one of their famous deserts ($7-8) but it will be worth it. <br>Points:<br>-If you order a kids meal with fries, ask for no salt on the fries and add it yourself if needed. <br>-The tuna tataki salad is amazing, ask for the dressing on the side. <br>-Like carbonara? Substitute shrimp for chicken, you won&#39;t regret it!<br>-I&#39;m not one for skinny dishes but try their skinny chicken pot pie, it&#39;s not lacking anything and is a healthier choice than most. <br>-The banana cream cheesecake is my number one choice, super light with a fluffy/creamy filling that will satisfy you with a smile, even if you&#39;re not a fan of banana.

We sat down at the table and the silverware was disgusting. Told the waitress and she literally told us what&#39;s the problem. We told the manager he apologized and told us he would get another table as we were walking out and decided to give another section a try. Low and behold a huge fly was just sitting on the table we figured enough was enough and it&#39;s time walk away.

Today my first time going the Cheesecake Factory took my wife for her birthday I felt she wasn&#39;t going to like it but honestly she loved it and So did I ,! she loved the food, service, and really clean this place is,! Service was amazing, even brought my wife a birthday sundae and sang, thank you cheesecake for making her day 5star day !!&#39;

I really loved my experience here with my family. Our server Paula was very attentive and humored my kids (with very short attention spans). We were worried about taking little kids out to a restaurant. Paula went above and beyond for us and made sure we were happy. My 3 year old decided to formally introduce himself and everyone at the table to her -- which was hilarious-- and she remembered his name and kept checking up on us. She even paid attention to the reason we were celebrating -- my husbands birthday -- and she said happy birthday to him (first name basis thanks to my son), brought us a lovely cheesecake which was decorated with sprinkles and chocolate writing. And she got a few other waiters to sing with her. We didn&#39;t have to ask. She is a doll. I hope management reads this because she deserves a pat on the back. <br>   As far as food, I feel like we got great sized portions. Lunch size portions are available for certain dishes. My husband had a burrito. I know, burritos at the Cheesecake Factory? Easily one of the largest burritos I&#39;ve seen at a &#34;chain&#34; restaurant! He said it was amazing. Kids menu is available and had lots of options. Of course, our Cheesecake was amazing too! No complaints. Great service. Thank you!
I love this place the menu has something for whatever your taste desires. The Ahi Tuna TarTar is the best I have ever had.  This is always a great go to when there are picky eaters in your group.
Picking up bday cake. We luv the variety of cheescakes and only dine in for the desserts.

I have been to other Cheesecake Factory locations...this one has the worst service and is staffed with RUDE adults who behave like children. <br><br>I actually walked out of this location after an incident when I was being seated. <br><br>-I was being seated by myself for lunch-I wanted a quick meal with food I recognized that was in walking distance from the hotel I was staying at- Le Méridien<br><br>-I just waited a few minutes before the hostess came out to seat me. <br>-When she took me to the table there was a table that was getting thier order taken by the waiter and he was blocking the way into the seating area that I was going to be sitting at. <br>I was just standing right behind the waiter so the hostess came up to the side of the waiter and tapped him on the shoulder so he could move to the side so I could sit. <br>-He turned around and yelled at me &#34;Where do you want me to go?!&#34;-He thought I was the hostess...I stated to him &#34;Wow, I am sorry...&#34; then he tried to back track and say he wasn&#39;t talking to me but he was trying to yell at his fellow employee...really that is how you speak t the people who you work with? Publicly in the middle of the restaurant floor in front of other employees and other patrons? WOW... <br><br>I walked out-<br><br>I live in Manhattan and on the Island there isn&#39;t a Cheesecake Factory you have to go out to the NY suburbs...SO I thought I would get my fix here...I guess not. <br><br>If you want RUDE and unprofessional service-come on by...

I hate having to give this place 3 stars because I&#39;ve been here quite a few times with no issues, but last night&#39;s visit had quite a few awful moments. No matter what, if you are visiting on the weekend for dinner expect obscene wait times. I&#39;m talking 60-90 minutes. The place is huge and they do their best for quick turnover, but the wait is unavoidable. There is the option to dine outside, but despite the offer from the hostess, it was just too chilly for that. <br>     I suggest you head to the bar during your wait. To the bartender with the full tattoo sleeves-you rock and you made the rest of the evening tolerable. My martini was delicious and the sample of that ice cream concoction was awesome! You made sure we had everything we wanted and you made the wait time fly by. <br>    Unfortunately, that was the only highlight of the evening. Our server, although nice, seemed as if she was having an off night. The table next to us that she was serving received the wrong food-she admitted to ringing it up wrong. They were pretty cool with it. She was pretty hard to get a hold of throughout the night as well. <br>     I ordered the jambalaya pasta and my husband ordered the bacon burger. We also started off with Cuban egg rolls as an appetizer. The appetizer was delicious and I was excited for the main course. I received my pasta-the presentation was perfect. And then I started to dig around my dish with my fork. My pasta was pretty much still curled up in spirals and there was no sauce. That&#39;s right. No sauce added at all. This dish has a cream Cajun sauce that makes it-tonight there was none to be found. My husband&#39;s burger was a bit overcooked and the bacon was extra charred, but he dealt with it and just ate it. The fries also tasted kinda stale to me. <br>   I alerted the waitress about my pasta with no sauce and she offered to bring out sauce or take it back. We had already been waiting quite a while so I just asked for the sauce. Time goes by. I see my waitress come back with no sauce. Apparently it would have to take another 5 minutes on top of the time I had already waited to make some sauce for me. When the sauce finally arrived it just looked like stewed tomatoes in a bowl. No cream sauce to be found. I just took the tepid runny sauce and poured it myself over the pasta-it made the pasta a bit more edible. <br>     Sigh. I usually have quite good experiences at this Cheesecake Factory, but this time I was only left with a disappointing feeling and leftovers that I really didn&#39;t want.

My family had a group of 22 people (mostly adults with a few young kids aged 4 months to 15 years old) and this place was fantastic! I know that Cheesecake Factory does not take reservations so my mom, dad, grandma, and myself arrived around 3:45pm to hopefully get seated by 5pm for our large group. The hostess informed me that a manager would take care of me when I put down the group name and number. He told me that he could get us seated in 20 minutes.<br><br> Unfortunately, my family took longer to arrive than anticipated due to their children&#39;s sleep schedule. However, the manager worked with us to get 11 of us seated. Then an amazing waiter by the name of Steven helped us save two (and then a third) table for our group as the stragglers arrived. The appetizers were brought out promptly. Also, the refills were done without asking a few times which is always a plus! Even when Steven took his break because he was going to work a long shift, the servers and food runners did not skip a beat bringing out out our food, refills, and silverware. The food was delicious as usual. Overall, everything was amazing with our big group which normally is a hassle in a place that doesn&#39;t accept reservations but was a combination of luck, timing, and wonderful service (from the hostess, manager, server - Steve, and the food runners)! Thank you!

I always love this place.  Finally remembering to write a review... I have been to this location on three occasions.  <br><br>The best thing is their decor and 2 of 3 visits have been on par way above and beyond service with excellent recommendations and knowledge of everything.  My latest visit was a dude which has no bearing except for the fact he was more interested in the two ladies at the table next to us than providing accurate service... Forgetting to bring a drink i had ordered and simple things like straws for drinks. <br><br>Everything we had ordered has always been flavorful from the asian salad to crisp won ton tacos to their mahi mahi.

Megan P the server was very rude. My sister ordered at the bar steak tacos, the meat was pink and she tells us &#34;well I didn&#39;t take the order so...&#34; well that&#39;s not how you respond to someone&#39;s food not being right. The manger was accommodating though. My tacos were good. The bartenders were friendly and nice as well. Megan P, you&#39;re rude.

We came in with a group of 7 people and spent over $300 on a Tuesday night (7/24/18). Ive never been more disappointed with service in my life (and half of us are servers/bartenders so we tend to be more understanding but this was absolutely unacceptable!) <br><br>We sat at the bar at 7:45 and not one bartender said a word to us for at least 15 minutes when he realized we were all basically throwing our cards in the air to get his attention to order 7 drinks &amp; 7 shots (not normally a bar tab you&#39;d ignore as a server (big tip?) After waiting another 20 minutes from the time we ordered the drinks we finally got our drinks/shots except for the drink of the person who PAID for the round (how do you forget the person payings drink?) <br><br>Our buzzer goes off and we&#39;re seated in a 6 person booth with 7 people?? Our serve came over greeted us and was very cheerful and funny, he brings us ONE basket of bread for 7 people and ONE small square of butter? So we ate it and asked for more, anyways we were probably seated at around 8:30pm, we never saw our server again after he dropped off waters and more bread for us right away... finally we had to go get a manager to take our order.... a manager came to our table at 9:23pm to take our drink and food order.... our drinks came about 20 minutes later (which she told us the bar was backed up so that was understandable) but our food did not come out until after 10:30.... and 2 of the dishes never came out 30 minutes went by of us waiting for our food and finally we told them to forget the 2 dishes that didn&#39;t come out. Our friend (it was her birthday) never got her birthday cheesecake because the service was so so awful that we had to pay the check as fast as we can and order cheesecakes separately from the front counter because we couldn&#39;t get out of there fast enough. As servers/bartenders we don&#39;t believe in tipping an less then 25% (normally i tip 30%-100% for good service) this service was so bad we didn&#39;t even want to leave the 15% that we did. <br><br>Wednesday July 25th : every single person has had food poisoning symptoms all day.. &amp; we will never return to the establishment. <br><br>I have been to this restaurant before and had excellent service &amp; excellent food so maybe something was off yesterday but it has topped all the food experiences that i&#39;ve had &amp; made me never want to return again

Top Flight restaurant! Beautiful atmosphere, settings &amp; ambience! You have to do a little planning ahead or you could be waiting for an hour, but that&#39;s ok! Their menu selection might be the largest I&#39;ve ever seen, but if u want to enjoy your food, stay away from the butter &amp; bread, you&#39;ll be full before the dinner hit! Lol. My favorite dish is the pasta w/ the Alfredo &amp; all the trimmings! After eating healthy for about 6 weeks, then this is where I go! For restaurant, they make the most Potent Long Islands , &amp; there turtle cheese cake w/ whip cream is to die for!!! Best in the World! Just my opinion....

Update; I had put in a complaint on the website and less than 24 hours later a manager by the name of Alex called back and sincerely apologized for last night. He stated that the manager Chris was indeed in the wrong and offered to give us a gift card to compensate. I agreed because we truly do love the establishment and have no issues ever. Thank you Alex !<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorite places to eat. Tonight, that changed. Just last week my husband and I went to the Cheesecake Factory at Old Orchard. Service was great, food was great, it was overall a great experience as many of our experiences at CF have been. Tonight we decided to visit the Oak Brook location. What a mistake that was! Let&#39;s start with the slower than usual service. It wasn&#39;t busy, we went around 630 and did not wait for a table. This location was also much darker than any other location oddly enough. I had to use my phone flashlight in the bathroom and the lady at the table next to us used her phone flashlight to read the menu. So we get our drinks. Then our appetizer which was the pork belly sliders and they were delicious to be fair. Next we get our entrees, this is where things get.... hairy. While both entrees (Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic and my husband had over roasted chicken with herbs and butter)  were actually good, I noticed a hair in mine after a few bites. This hair was not the same color as my hair nor the same length, I turned my flashlight on my phone on and checked to be sure before I made a big deal. So at this point I alert my server (when she finally comes) she apologizes and asks if I want a new one. Well I had most of my meal still so yes I wanted a new one to go. She then walks a few feet away to the manager and implies to him that it was MY hair. Disregarding the complete difference in hair color! The manager, Chris Johansson, comes and apologizes and says they will make a new one to go. Okay this seems okay so far even though I am irritated that I had eaten this meal with hair and the server was very rude. Then we get our bill and the sever says one of the pastas is taken off of the bill and she walks away. Upon looking at the bill we were still charged for the new one they made and the original one with the hair was taken off. I call the server once again and explain that it is not fair that I am being charged for my ruined meal. It&#39;s about 830 at this point! I want to go home. My meal was ruined and now I have to wait for Chris the manager to come back so we can discuss this bill. He comes back and so very rudely asks what the issue is. I explain that I should not be charged for my meal whatsoever because we had been waiting 30 mins for this take home meal and my dinner was still not satisfactory regardless. He says &#34;it was actually about 20 minutes&#34; wow excuse me sir but that is not how you talk to customers that continuously come to your establishment. He offers me a &#34;slice of cheesecake on the house&#34; we just bought two pieces of cheesecake and no that would not have been equivalent to all of this extra drama we went through on top of being a huge waste of time. I then say I will not argue with him and I will also not be paying for the meal. He says &#34;I&#39;m not arguing with you okay so I will take the meal off and take the take home plate as well&#34; I say fine and he walks away with the check and the meal. Wow. The server brings our new check and another server takes it and brings it for us to sign. My husband works in the food industry, front of the house and back, so we know the proper way things such as this should be handled. I was not asking for our entire check (about $80) to be comped. I was asking for my dish alone (about $18) to be comped and I think that it was fair to expect that. The manager Chris Johansson was the worst manager I have ever experienced at any restaurant, ever. Because of him we will stop going to the Cheesecake Factory all together. I will definitely be calling the corporate office about this.

I&#39;ve been going here for years. I&#39;ve never been disappointed. Of course the waits are always long on weekend nights and parking is always difficult, but it&#39;s worth it. I&#39;m always excited for the bread especially the sweet brown one. <br><br>I normally get the salmon with mashed potatoes which is always good. The chicken and biscuits are yummy too, huge portions. Recently I tried the the fish tacos. I remember the first time I tried them I wasn&#39;t that impressed, but I wanted something light so I decided to try it again. I liked the fish tacos, not so much the salsa though. The fish was very light and no fishy taste at all. The black beans and rice had a weird flavor. I would have rather had it plain white rice and beans. <br><br>The dessert is what&#39;s it&#39;s all about. Can&#39;t go wrong with any of the choices. I personally like the chocolate mouse because it&#39;s a lighter cheesecake for after dinner. <br><br>The one thing I like best is that they give you large portions. I almost always have leftovers to take home. You definitely get you money&#39;s worth.

A terrible experience!!! We got there at four!!! It was not busy and it looked like tables were wide open. Our party waited while other parties were taken in. We inquired and the hostess said it would a 10-15 minute wait!! In protest we were seated across from a large party, which was unacceptable to us. We went back to the hostess and was told again it was a 10-15 minute wait, we said we would be in the bar area and she said we would be called. We never were. The manager came over and made excuses for the lack of service and we would be seated soon....across from a wait station!! Our waiter was fantastic and my Asian Chicken Salad was good. The persons who order the salmon special raved about it and the avocado egg rolls were enjoyed by the other person in our party. We were offered a cup of coffee for our inconvenience...big deal!!

I went here on Saturday with my son for an early birthday dinner for myself, and had a really bad experience. <br>First, I called to ask what the estimated wait was for 2 people. The person who answered said 20/25 minutes. When I got there, they told me 30. I expected that, no problem. I arrived at 5:40PM. At 30 mins, I asked how much longer, and the hostess said 5 minutes. At 50 minutes, I was frustrated. I had a 7:15 movie to get to. I also wanted to do a starter, dinner, and dessert, and this was cutting it close. I spoke with the hostess and she was very dismissive and unapologetic. She said they couldn&#39;t account for people sitting there. I told her that&#39;s fine, but give me realistic expectations. If she told me 45 minutes when I got there, I would have left. She then argued with me that I have been waiting 43 minutes, not 48. I told her I have a text to my bf saying the wait when I got there at 5:40, so they waited to enter me in. She said no it automatically does it. She was rude and not good at her job. Finally we were seated and I figured it would still be okay but it took the waiter 10 minutes to walk over to us. I tried flagging other people down but no one came close. We were only able to enjoy our main dish. I had to take our cheesecakes to go. The food was good, and the waiter after that was nice. I asked him for the manager and he said he asked for them twice and they also never came. If management doesnt show up, why would their employees. I&#39;ve been to a ton of cheesecake factories and this was really bad service. I&#39;m never coming here again.
Good food, attentive service. Drop in stars for cheesecake. Soggy. There seems to be cake inside the cheesecake.  You go for the desert/cheesecake and it&#39;s really gone down hill.

We come to this location rather than the closer location due to the experience of the staff/chief. The food almost always turns out as expected. I gave 2 less stars due to the fire hazard the waiting area causes and how you can barley walk through to get to the washroom. Some simple ropes to section off a clear walk way to the desk would help. Also, instead of using the current method to let guests (not customers since you should be considered a guest) be notified of a table opening up should have the option of via text message so that guests can perhaps even explore oak brook a bit while they wait, elevating the crowd in the waiting room, and stopping the doors from staying open, in return chilling the dinning area--this would save some money during ROI.

Dined here last night for my birthday, which we didn&#39;t tell anyone about--more on that later. <br><br>When we walked in, it was packed yet we only waited a mere 4 minutes before we were seated with Arce! Let me tell you, he was FANTASTIC. Every step of his service. He gave us time to sit and relax, made wonderful suggestions, and really allowed us to have the experience we wanted. Food was not only fresh but absolutely fast and incredibly delicious. Then it came to dessert and we ordered the banana cream cheesecake and when it came to the table, it was accompanied by a candle, and seven staff members who were singing me happy birthday. Arce overheard my husband wishing me a happy birthday and took it upon himself to go the extra mile and bring my dessert for my birthday. <br><br>This experience was a 5+ for us. We will not only be back, we will make sure to blast our check-ins on social media! <br><br>Thank you, Cheesecake Factory, for a wonderful dining experience!

I have been to Cheesecake Factory many times, first time at this location. and overall I am a fan, first of all the decor is great , the wait staff was nice, and i would pick Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Key Lime Cheesecake over any other Key lime cheesecake that I have had. the only negative that i would say is that this place is a little over priced, but overall it was good.

I am absolutely obsessed with Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve gone to a bunch of them and they are all great. This one is located in the oakbrook mall. It has parking on both sides, valet, and outside sitting. <br>There menu is sensory overload. Anything that you could possibly be craving- they have. They have a lite menu for our calorie counters. But remember all their portion sizes are huge- for two people. So no matter how hungry you are, just split. They have happy hour and small plate deals in the bar on weekdays. <br>They obviously have a million cheesecakes. My goal is to try them all. I&#39;ve had the caramel, raspberry, and regular- all delicious. Regular tiramisu is better than the cheesecake version. My favorite dishes are Thai lettuce wraps, baked artichokes, and BBQ ranch salad. And remember, they&#39;re drinks are strong...especially the LIT which I just had and have to say, I&#39;m feeling good :)

The Waiter was rude! He tried to force me to eat a meal that was not ordered the way i asked him too! I will never come here again!!!!!!!!!!&#39; This place sucks! I wish i could rate without any stars!

It doesn&#39;t get any better than this especially only waiting 5 mins for a table unlike our last visit to novi michigan location where we waited over 2 hours. Wife had salmon and shrimp scampi and I had steak diane and their awesome top selling chicken dish <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcombo.il&amp;s=22a917596572e8c946b6c7e4c6eb4f06cf0ecdb27825a5c0f37befda0193b21e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">combo.il</a> also had  a Greek salad that was very good and of course we both enjoyed our desserts. Strawberry shortcake for me and chocolate truffle cake for my wife. Both awesome. We will return.

Went here with my wife on anniversary night. On Thursday evening it was pretty packed. Luckily it only took 15 mins to get seated. Going there for the first time it was a great night. Peter was our server. He was great, serving us greatly. The food was good too. The fettuccine Alfredo and Five or Four cheese pasta was good too. Large portion size. The original and Hershey cheesecake were the bomb. The best desert I have had at a restaurant.<br><br>Service 5/5<br>Food 5/5<br>Ambiance 5/5
Almost always perfect! Love the food, pretty much something for any and every one! A bit on the pricey side, but there is definitely quantity and quality here. Ambiance is loud, but very pretty.

Food is always great and the staff is particularly good at this locatoon. <br><br>Food-wise fried mac and cheese balls, barbecue ranch chicken salad, Jamaican black pepper shrimp, and habatchi steak are my top picks. <br><br>Brandy was an excellent server! One of the best we&#39;ve had at cheesecake. Lidia at the bar was also very helpful and kept checking up on us and offering water long after my drink was done. <br><br>Always a great experience here!
Terrible service and overpriced food. Is all i have to say. Waited for 30 mins and still no service. Left and went to Maggianos
Love this place my first time here my server was very good Andrew he was very helpful even has a great idea

It will take you forever waiting to get seated here, and they don&#39;t take reservations. Once you are seated though...We get excellent service every time we come here, and their food is really not expensive for the generous portions and quality.<br><br>Their menu is enormous. It will take you a while to land on a decision, which is actually a bonus since their sourdough and brown wheat breads are divine for snacking on while narrowing your options.<br><br>Small plates. Order them. The chicken Samoas &amp; dynamite shrimp are fantastic.<br><br>Appetizer. The buffalo blasts with their homemade bleu cheese are to die for!! My favorite item on the menu.<br><br>Dinner options are all good with large portions and lots of calories! They recently added lighter calorie menu options as well though.<br><br>Dessert. Cheesecakes. So good. White Chocolate Raspberry, Adams Peanut Butter Cup, Red Velvet. The only poor decision you can make here is to not order dessert because you&#39;re full. Take a slice home!
The food was delicious. Grilled artichoke was tasty. Fun place to be and the waiter was very attentive. Very busy but service did not suffer. Tried That new birthday cheesecake and it was awesome.
Wonderful food. Always. Staff is great. Usually a wait but it&#39;s worth it. Love this place for date night with the wife.

Always great tasting food but it&#39;s the little things. At this price point more is expected. Friendlier waitstaff, more parking, larger portions, more accurate descriptions, better seating.  Will come back but open to other ideas for the investment required here.

Except for a few hiccups with  the dishes everything was great. The food was delicious. I had the French toast brioche, Napoleon Style. I also had egg white omelet with mushrooms and spinach that was delicious except for the bacon that I didn&#39;t ask for and the cheese that I didn&#39;t get that I did ask for. Yes, I will go back. This visit was on Mothers Day and they were pretty busy.

I am so disappointed in the Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve been a fan for years and has been a staple for my wife and I whether it be for lunch, dinner and just stopping in for one of their many fabulous cheesecakes.  Yesterday my wife and I ordered cheesecake to go for a Valentine&#39;s Day treat and normally their slices were historically enough to feed more than one which makes sense given the price.  When we got our slices, they were so small, less than half the size of their to-go containers.  So disappointed.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, the food is above average, lots to choose from, however after today,  I&#39;m unfortunately not returning. While I appreciate how busy it was bc of the mothers day holiday, the service was atrocious. I complained 2x to the manager who was in charge and he did absolutely nothing except tell me I was the only one to complain today. I expected in the least an apology, but instead NOTHING. We had to ask our server multiple times for things we needed.  He never checked in at all.  We felt ignored, he didn&#39;t refill drinks, just to name one of many things we waited for as our food became cold. We spent 2.5 hrs not bc we were enjoying our time and food, but instead waiting on our server to bring things we needed.  Never again, terrible management.

Came here with my 2 y/o daughter.<br><br>The staff was very friendly, though the hostess could smile a bit. Fancy entry, large in size when you walk in. Immediately saw the cheesecakes and teddy Bears.<br>When we got sat down, host asked if my daughter wanted a &#34;kid&#34; plate... With bananas and chopped up bread. Free of charge.<br><br>Score. Kept her occupied for a bit. No crayons here. They do offer a kids menu. One waitress even brought over her highlighters and pen pad to keep my daughter occupied while our slow waiter came back.  Awesome service on her end.<br><br>No - it&#39;s not all about cheesecakes! <br>From burgers to pasta.... Big menu selection. Pricey pastas. Spent over $17 on one dish... Holy smackers! I did have left overs, probably from eating the delicious bread &amp; butter they served beforehand.<br><br>It was delicious though. It had FARFALLE chicken, mushroom, peas, garlic.. I added brocolli. Loved it. Taste great the next day when reheated. <br><br>Also ordered cheesecake, Chris outrageous. Has coconut, chocolate, all that jazz. Was a big piece, had left overs as well. Split between 2 1/2 people.  Bummed when I saw the bill and it cost $8 just for the slice... Ouch.<br><br>High prices. Good food. Fair portions. Good service. Busy.<br><br>Oh, and the manager or owner offered my daughter whipped cream in a bowl - out of kindness.

They have EXCELLENT food mA!!! It is delicious I tell u delicious. The cheesecake was so heavenly, u need to try the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake. <br>Also check out there avocado rolls n fried mac n cheese. <br>The only thing I wish they had was halal meat

I had horrible customer service with one of their female employees <br>She didn&#39;t know how to move with intention to assist multiple tables. She seemed to assist other tables better. The guy that assist us after did a great job but seemed bother. <br>Also my brother chicken strips had a piece of fried calamari. Needless to say he did eat it after that. Wouldn&#39;t go again.

This place loses points for service. I was there on a date recently and we ordered an appetizer. They brought it out and didn&#39;t get us any plates to eat it on. It was a dip so it definitely needed a plate to rest on, but our waitress was running around everywhere but our table. Ordering drinks took a long time as well.<br><br>As far as food goes, I had a chicken tostada salad that was amazing. Not low fat by any means but I didn&#39;t care. Portions were so big that I had half to take home, and it still filled up the whole container. <br><br>We split a piece of cheesecake. So rich you only need one for two people! It was white chocolate raspberry and was very good. I will go back, I&#39;m just hoping for a different waitress next time!

The most greasy, grisly skimpy lousy sandwich i have ever had and it was 14 dollars Wil. Never go to this crap factory again Service was slow and unfriendly The sandwich was a California Cheesesteak The place was crowded too! What is wrong with people who think this place is worth eating at Mystery to me!

I went on Valentines Day at 2pm, and there was no wait whatsoever! I liked the ambience, the waiter, Marco, was super sweet and checked up on us to see if we had questions. Was timely and polite. The food was not as hot as I would expect but not completely unsatisfactory which is why i knocked a star. Good overall!
Bad place really slow service rude employees I had to wait in line for a long ass time

Massive portions and you can&#39;t go wrong with what you pick because it will be good. I have had many items through out the years and have never complained about any of them. You can bring the pickiest of eaters here and they will find something to pick from the menu. You can get good food, drinks, desert, and service as that has been my experience on every visit. I would avoid busy times because the wait could be very long. Or plan ahead and don&#39;t arrive when you are very hungry or you will end up walking out and going somewhere else. This place does not take reservations either.

I flew in for the holidays and was excited to go in for a quick meal. As I approached the hostess, I was not greeted or acknowledged. I understand that it was rush hour but the young lady in the front desk had a rude manner of greeting not just me but everyone else. It wasn&#39;t till I said something out loud that she started smiling and changing her tone of voice. As a former restaurant employee, the host is the face of the restaurant. They are the first interaction a customer gets, and in this case, this encounter  made me not want to come back. When finally called to be seated, our table was filthy to top it all off. It&#39;s unfortunate that this had to happen since I&#39;ve always liked coming to this location when I was in town.

Next time you want cheesecake just go to the dessert counter order your slice and leave. Service was terrible. Over priced menu. Never got the drinks we ordered. Took over an hour from the time we were seated to get a salad and tacos. She never came back to check on us either. There were ingredients in my salad that weren&#39;t there and added ingredients that weren&#39;t on the menu. The black beans served with the tacos were cold.<br>The cheese cake was delicious!

I ate at this location for the second time last week. I was unimpressed, other than the pretty interior and tasty (expensive cheesecake) it was just an average experience.<br>1.
