Our waiter smelled like cigarette smoke <br>2. Cheeseburger, cheese just slipped right off burger and fell on plate<br>3. For $30 something  (including Tip), I expect something more.

We were a party of 5 midafternoon on a Sunday. It was pretty busy. We didn&#39;t have reservations and waited 30 minutes for a table. Drinks were brought promptly. There was a little wait to order our meal but the food arrived faster than expected and our server made sure we didn&#39;t run out of bread. The dishes were tasty but not spectacular. The food that was supposed to be hot was and the cold food was chilled just right. My water wasn&#39;t refilled as quickly as I like, my son had to remind the waiter to bring his soda, and also the dressing for his fries. It was a good meal. I would visit this restaurant again but this time it didn&#39;t deserve five stars.

Can&#39;t get better value than Cheesecake Factory. I had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which had a kick to it without being spicy. Their avocado eggroll appetizer is a must have as well! Amazing staff and great time as always.<br><br>On a Saturday night, we had to wait ~20-25 min for a table since they don&#39;t take reservations.
This is a very nice restaurant! My waitress Megan was very nice and respectful. I would recommend that all my friends and come here especially because the food is inexpensive!

Always great food made fresh every time. Minimum wait time , friendly service. Moderately priced. Favorites: lettuce wraps, buffalo chicken wraps, bang bang chicken and shrimp, famous meatloaf and not to mention the cheesecake! Perfect location.

HOW DO PEOPLE NOT LIKE CHEESECAKE I JUST CANT!<br>I CANT WRAP IT AROUND MY HEAD!!<br><br>ITS freakinnnnnnn AMAZING! :)  <br><br>Especially here! You do not go to the cheesecake factory and not eat cheesecake its like a rule of thumb i love their mango cheesecake! <br>Nice fancy romantic setting.
Food was good. But no cellular service/signal, and no WiFi here!? C&#39;mon. It&#39;s 2018.  Won&#39;t be back because of just that. Sorry.
Absolutely ridiculous, ordered dessert and waited 30 minutes for it to be brought to the table. Spoke to manager who seemed to be bothered that I asked to speak to her.

Okay.....honestly I only come here for the Peach Bellini. I am not a fan of the food. They have tooooooo many options, which to me means that they not good at cooking any one cuisine well.<br><br>However... Their wings and fries are great!!!! I think it&#39;s the awesome ranch dressing. I&#39;m craving some of that ranch right now!!! :)<br><br>Also.... Surprise surprise ... This was the first time I&#39;ve ever tried the cheesecake from my over a dozen times of being here. I had the Godiva (heart attack) cheesecake. Wow... Amazing!!! It&#39;s very rich in flavor and if your a chocolate lover, it&#39;s for you! Seriously... rich.... I brought it home and it took 3 days to eat it! Ha! :)

I met friends for lunch and really enjoyed myself. I wasn&#39;t quite sure if it was the place for us, because we tend to gab for awhile but the Cheesecake Factory was... what can I say... upscale gabbing. <br><br>We all initially ordered an appetizer to share. Everything was very tasty. The calamari was great, (of course, how could you go wrong), and the avocado egg rolls - magnificent! The pot stickers were ok. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad lunch portion, which was good and more than enough - half went home to son three; so I could have room for dessert.<br><br>It&#39;s too bad my friends and I don&#39;t get together more often, however, truly, our visits are a foretaste of Heaven as are the desserts at the Cheesecake Factory. So worth eating half your meal. <br><br>How do they make their cheesecakes so great looking? And taste... like not of this world - a foretaste!<br><br>Why four stars?<br><br>Our server. <br><br>My friends and I look and act like older, matured women - not &#34;girls&#34;, (or older, matured women looking to recapture youth - we are all fine with our advanced age). It&#39;s not a complement/flattering to be constantly referred to as a girl, seemingly with the intent to make us feel &#34;younger&#34;- it seemed out of place. It would be like the pharmacist calling me &#34;sweetie&#34;. NOT! Just weird.

4 stars for dining here on a weeknight. <br><br>2 stars for stopping in for to go dessert on a weekend.  A 20 minute wait for 2 slices of cheesecake to go is ridiculous!  The excuse: the cheesecake area serves the entire restaurant.

Normally we like this place but not as much today. The wait staff was attentive but...<br><br>Outside patio filthy with trash on the ground and dirty tables already set for the next guests (I used my napkin to clean my area, including my seat, before sitting down),<br>Salmon - out of it,<br>Tuscan chicken -- overcooked,<br>Ladies bathroom - no soap in one of 2 dispensers,<br>Ladies bathroom - stall door lock broken,<br>Ladies bathroom - trash overflowing.<br><br>Normally I might think they had been busy and maybe this explained the messiness (not that this would even be a good excuse), but the place had plenty of open seating both in and out. Apparently the staff on the clock - managers, hostessesss, hosts, etc. were still enjoying their holiday as they certainly weren&#39;t keeping the place up to its normal standards.

Nothing great or special except that it&#39;s close to my job whenever I have a craving for cheesecake. And of course it&#39;s ridiculously busy because it&#39;s part of the Oakbrook center. Be prepared for a wait even if you&#39;re going to pick up cheesecake.

So why would this place have the audacity to charge 19.95 for a pasta dish with 5 PRECOOKED, TOUGH, DRIED OUT, HARD AS ROCK shrimp, with not even a side salad. Need I say, I will NOT BE BACK?  We did however have a great waitress. She is wasting her talent working at this place.

My dad left hungry and unhappy. He ordered a medium rare steak, simple right? Well 45 minutes later when the rest of the family is done, he gets a well done steak.. but not literally well done, more like beef jerky. Alright, Alright. Oh wait forgot to tell you it was his bday! So we bring the manager over here and she says uh oh I&#39;ll get you a knew one. And I say &#34; this doesn&#39;t look pink to me&#34; then another hour later, another good piece of well done steak. I say &#34; cmon, this is as gray as my wives dress!&#34; Keep in mind that a well done steak is the easiet to make. Never going here again. Hopefully they see this

Went here for lunch today - what a HUGE disappointment<br>Ordered chicken avocado club with a salad as a side<br>Sandwich was ok - avocado a bit too ripe and bacon a little burnt - in addition chicken was at a minimal compared to other times <br>But the biggest disappointment.......<br>AWFUL WILTED SOGGY SALAD <br>Honestly felt like I was eating someone&#39;s leftovers or salad that was a week old!<br>After 2 bites my companion and I opted to let the waiter know / he offered a new salad ( NO THANKS) or fries ( which I don&#39;t eat)<br>We declined - I later asked if he let manager know he said he did - but then when manager came over to our table he was a bit dumbfounded - at which point our plates were cleared.<br>He offered a free dessert - we split one<br>This salad should NEVER have been used PERIOD!<br>I would hope that someone in the kitchen is monitoring what is being served before it gets played.<br>The salad leaves were slimey and non-edible - hoping we won&#39;t get sick <br>NOT going back anytime soon - <br><br>Very disappointing!

I found a piece of plastic wrap in my Rocky Road sundae yesterday. The manager Leo Pearson did nothing for us. Just said that it wasn&#39;t up to their standards. I hope so!!!! She could have cared less. She was in a meeting sitting two tables over from us when i asked for the manager. The server went straight to her but it took her 20 minutes to come over non shalantly and ask if everything was ok. She gives The Cheesecake Factory a bad name. Save your money and go somewhere else!

A waiter made a snarky comment about me being on my phone while eating. Very rude and disrespectful, but I would still come to this establishment because the food is worth putting up with rude waiters, very similar to ed debevic&#39;s.

We waited for 2 1/2 hours to be seated! This was after our buzzer &#34;accidentally&#34; went off! I&#39;ve watched other customers that were waiting with me get seated, eat their meal and leave! The manager on duty explained that because our party was large they were trying to sit us in the same area that a current party was located; however this party was going slower than they expected and added guests to their party at the last minute. This is totally unacceptable! They don&#39;t take reservations yet expect the customers to wait an unreasonable amount of time. The poor planning and service has really done this location in! The one star rating was being generous as there isn&#39;t an option for a negative star!

This is the best location in all of Chicagoland. We never wait for more than a couple of minutes. Dinner is always crazy crowded so really, manage your expectations if you hate waiting a long time. We&#39;ve never had an issue at this location compared to others. Staff is friendly. If you get Nick as your server, you&#39;re in great shape. We&#39;ve managed to get him as our waiter three times in a row and wow! What awesome service.

I decided to have lunch at the Cheesecake Factory (Oak Brook) on Labor Day. It had probably been 10+ years since I&#39;d dined there so it was time for a visit. For an appetizer I ordered the Fried Won Tons which were plentiful and tasty (though not true Chinese Won Tons). For my entree I had the Lemon-Herb Roasted Chicken which included an all natural half chicken, mashed potatoes, carrots and watercress and was topped with a light lemon garlic-herb sauce. The meal was hearty and taste good overall. By the time I&#39;d finished my entree I was full and could only order a slice of strawberry cheesecake to go. As always, the dessert was exceptional, light, fresh and satisfying. My visit back to TCF was well worth the trip and re-ignited my interest in their offerings. Next time it&#39;ll be the Red Velvet Cheesecake for sure!
Cajun jambalaya pasta is off the charts here. But the wait is horrible and they should work on their customer service.

I when to cheesecake last Friday for lunch and when I got there it was 30 minutes wait but when we got finally the table it took 10 minutes wait for the server to come and offer bread and drinks after that when we order the food took more than 30 minutes and on top of that the food was cold and very dried

I&#39;m not a fan. I went there twice &amp; neither time did I enjoy it. The first time I had chicken enchilada &amp; 2nd time I ordered the chicken marsala. I had to sent it back because it didn&#39;t taste like chicken. I ordered the southwest salad &amp; it was good if you don&#39;t put the ranch dressing on it. The cheesecake was great! I had a red velvet, white chocolate, &amp; apple strudel.
I had the BBQ ranch chicken salad and it had great textures but was a bit bland for having the name &#34;BBQ&#34;.  We had the coffee cheesecake which was good but not like NYC!

We decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory for to celebrate my daughter&#39;s graduation.  We arrived at 5:00 PM and were told we would have a 1-hour wait, which we understood because the restaurant incredibly does not take reservations.  We ended up waiting 2 hours.  Why they refuse to take reservations is beyond me, but ok, fine.  The foyer was crowded and people kept bumping into us.  My 70+ year old parents had no place to sit.  The food was adequate at best.  We won&#39;t be back.  Hard to believe this place is publicly traded.  If I owned their stock, I&#39;d sell it today.

It&#39;s actually pretty good, especially in comparison to other Cheesecake Factories. The staff were pretty nice although the service took a while. The food makes up for it in my opinion, as long you know what to get.
Phenomenal every visit. Cant wait to return.

Always good food here. I love the ambiance and the Italian inspired decorations. The place is packed nights so plan to wait for a table if you have a party bigger than 2. Wait staff is friendly and they keep your drink full! Oh they have pretty good cheesecake too.

Very disappointed with this experience. We had an awful wait time. The hosts were so disorganized. They told us any minute 40 minutes in to our wait, then again an hour and 20 minutes into wait. They called us just to tell us to wait some more to the side. Servers were running around and bumping into people. The few times I got up from my seat, servers were bumping into me, with no apology. <br>Our server was so busy/apathetic. His name was Marcelino. We waited in the lobby (with a toddler) for an hour and 45 minutes. We were told it would be 45 minute wait. We sat down and waited for a server to greet us. He didn&#39;t say his name just asked if we were ready to order. We asked for another minute. He was about to leave when I had to say that I wanted to order a drink. I asked for a extra dirty martini. It was not extra dirty or dirty at all. I actually went up to the bartender and requested more olive juice. Our waiter saw me do this and asked nothing as to why. <br>He didn&#39;t come back to our table for another 20 minutes before we could order food. (we have a toddler). I asked for a kids menu. Never brought it until a member of our party asked a different waiter. (This took until our server came back 20 mins later.) for him to check on us to get the kids menu. We ordered apps and dinner. Our food was great. All except the kids chicken nuggets that I ordered for my toddler. We asked to have fruit instead of fries. They bring out fries. Fine. They said they would bring us out a fruit bowl. Minutes later, they take the fries away to give to another member of our table. Without a word. Weird, we thought. Since, already they messed up, why wouldn&#39;t they just let us keep the fries and bring out the other persons fries an additional order. That is usually what restaurants do. The Chicken fingers were horrible. We got them for our 18 months old and it was all breading. We had to really tear apart the chicken fingers to get to meat, which is all we would be giving to our child. I honestly expected more. <br><br>Overall, really disappointing. I think its been about 10 years since I have been here. I don&#39;t plan on coming back. I know that this last weekend was really busy for you all, but there has to be a better way. There were 10 people in our party and I know that we spent well over $700. You could have made it a better experience.

My rating would be higher but I had asked the server to make me cheese quesadilla&#39;s to go for my son who was home sick.  I ordered it to be just cheese nothing else inside.  When I got home of course they were made with everything in it so my son didn&#39;t eat it and it was a total waste of money.
Had a crispy pineapple chicken with a pineapple mojito, both super tasty. Biggest decision was trying to figure out what to eat! Marcellus was a great waiter! Wish I lived here! Very tasty food

Best one I&#39;ve eaten at.  We actually are here twice while visiting for a three day trip.  Love the extensive menu.  Yes it&#39;s a lot to choose from, but ask yourself: &#34;am I in the mood for sandwiches, pasta, burger, chicken, steak, seafood?&#34;  They have it! Good kids menu too.  <br>***their sweet potato fries are my favorite anywhere!!!<br>Everything we had was exceptional.  Service, food, everything!
Great service, the server was punctual with the food, and the food was hot and fresh! Defiantly will be returning ! The manager even came to check on us to make sure our food and time was good!

I went to dinner here this past week on st. patricks day. I was there with my boyfriend celebrating my birthday. I had never been to this location (I&#39;ve only been to the location downtown). It looks nice inside and our waiter was very friendly and on top of everything. We were seated right away since we beat the dinner crowed. I would have given 5 stars but the food was very disappointing. :( <br><br>I ordered the Macaroni and Cheese Burger. The friend macaroni and cheese was gross. It tastes like cheap cheese. So I took that off. Then I noticed that the patty to bun ratio was ridiculous. The patty was so small compared to the bun it was actually comical. The burger just wasn&#39;t tasty. And the fries were your usual fries nothing special. My boyfriend ordered the Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi. He said the shrimp was ok but the steak was very salty. <br><br>I wish I had chosen a different restaurant to have my birthday dinner at :(. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?
This place is so consistent as I hit them everywhere in the US. Today was no exception my server at Oak Brook IL, Sally, was so awesome. You would be lucky to get her table.

This place has excellent service and great parking.  The food is always perfectly prepared.  The service is top notch.  The brunch items on Sundays provide an amazing breakfast experience.  The Bruleed French Toast is a favorite.  I usually order this item for my dessert.  The Cheesecakes are the BEST in the business.  The Dulce de leche cheesecake is a must have if you have yet to taste this delicious dessert item.  The sweet corn tamale cakes and avacado egg rolls are our favorite appetizers.  The burgers and sandwiches are excellent.  ALL their entrees are delicious.  The quantity of every item is is usually plenty and enough for the next day.   The new items such as the steak tacos are good.  They were plentiful (4 per order) although I prefer the traditional steak taco.
I love this restaurant. One of my favorite places to eat. The menu is very long and many options. Always order cheesecake to go!

Stayed across the street at the hotel. Ate this three nights in a row via takeout, on the third night I was on hold for over 25 minutes. Had to call back three separate times because I was just being set on hold. On the third call I asked to speak with a manager able to take a to go order. Was left there for an additional 10 minutes. Hung up and called back a manager immediately picked up sounded like she was in the back office, she told me that there was a long line of people and that&#39;s why I was on hold for so long. She didn&#39;t know that I was staying at the hotel across the street, so when I WALKED by I saw two people there. I got the manager on the phone just to let her know that we took our business elsewhere. Riddle me that.

Food was good but not great. Service was really good tonight though. The cheesecake tasted great but was maybe a bit too sweet for me. But that&#39;s my opinion. The food was yummy but for the cost I would&#39;ve liked more. The calamari was such a small portion but it was tasty. If the main course was a bit better I could have given this place a 4 star, and maybe one day I will. But for now I give it just a 3 star.

My fiance and I came here for lunch one Saturday afternoon after my class ended at College of DuPage. When we got here, we had to wait a fair amount of time but nothing terribly long. I had been to another location before, but this was Dan&#39;s first time.<br><br>Now we both ordered lunch and got a decent sized meal. I had the mac-n-cheese burger (again) and the fries. I gobbled it down no problem and you&#39;d have a hard time getting me to order something else. I mean, I know it&#39;s good. I know I like it. Why change?<br><br>Dan really liked his food too and I believe he ordered a sandwich with fries. Then comes the cheesecake. After convincing Dan it was a must, we ordered a slice of the white chocolate cheesecake.<br><br>Normally, I want like 18 flavors that include chocolate and peanut butter. But Dan wants something simple, so I met him halfway. The cheesecake was awesome. Even though Dan was full, we still fought over every bit to see who can get more!<br><br>I would definitely return here. The service was what I expected, but I would avoid their busy times as the wait can be long.

Always enjoy this place... Service is kinda of slow but I guess it&#39;s expected ... I enjoy the happy hour aptzr though drinks seem smaller and at times watered down ... Food is consistent ... My favorite is the hot sour dough bread... Oh it&#39;s Yumi

The ONLY reason I went was because I received a gift card and now I remember why I do not go to this chain.<br>I always hated waiting for like 30 to 45 minutes for a seat, it seems with the decor as ugly as it is, the chain could do more. Maybe a second level instead of high freaking ceilings with ugly decorations???<br>I had the BBQ chicken pizza because the menu does not tell you everything that comes with the item! So I went with the safest thing on the menu!<br><br>For example the shrimp appetizer came with a weird thousand island sauce covering the entire plate on the bottom of all the shrimp! If you do not like the sauce nor see it listed in the menu or are allergic (like myself) you will be surprised!<br>Overall, i will not go here again gift card be damned

Pro:  good food, big portions, nice environment, right price.<br>Cons:  Too many fucking shoppers at peak times.<br><br>I love this place.  I&#39;m a big fan of the cheesecake factory from many years ago.  Almost twenty years now.

I&#39;ve got to admit, they have good cheesecake... It&#39;s just good though. I&#39;ve had cheesecake that was creamier and the choices are so endless and over complicated even deciding is frustrating.<br><br>The reason for the low score is that I think everyone involved is just so overwhelmed. The service was good, almost too good to be real. Our servers constantly used psychologically suggestive phrases like &#34;Is everything still delicious?&#34; And everything we ordered was &#34;an awesome choice.&#34; <br><br>In terms of food, it was fine but I can almost taste the chain restaurant-ness. Dishes offered single dimensions that you&#39;d expect from places you don&#39;t pay $15 a plate.
Service was great. Food was overseasoned and very mediocre. I may go back again and try something new since the menu is huge.

This restaurant is probably the absolute worst that I&#39;ve gone to (and I&#39;ve gone to ALOT). <br><br>The service was very poor. We were first seated by the air conditioning and when we asked to move, our waitress said &#34;She&#39;ll deal with you,&#34; and handed us off to another waitress. Silverware still had remnants of food and crumbs on them, which grossed us out extremely.<br><br>The stuffed tater tots were very good going down, but an hour after the meal they gave me a hearty stomachache.<br><br>The Colby burger tasted just like any other McDonald&#39;s burger, which is the opposite of what you&#39;d expect considering the price.<br><br>The fettuccine alfredo was similar to the tater tots: very rich and creamy going down, but not very good an hour after the meal.<br><br>We also had to wait 40+ minutes for our meal, which quite frankly is unacceptable for the quality of the food and service we received. I do not recommend at all.

Gonna let you in on my dirty little secret.  I LOVE Cheesecake Factory and have since they first opened their doors.  This one in Oak Brook is no exception: great food all day long, end of story.  <br>For the unenlightened, EVERY SINGLE ITEM on Cheesecake&#39;s menu is made from scratch in their kitchens.  Their salad dressings?  Scratch.  Meats, veggies, cheesecakes?  Scratch.  Soups? Yes, scratch.  I could eat at Cheesecake 4 days a week for the rest of my life and be happy. Great food, great service, just too damn crowded so you have to time it right or you&#39;ll be caught in the crush of hungry bellies.  <br>Had soup and salad here yesterday: amazing New England clam chowder (do I have to say it?), and tossed salad with balsamic vinaigrette.  Winner, as always.  No complaints here, only praise for one of my fave chains in the USA.  Great, great service with a smile, as usual.

If I can give this place a zero I would for the horrible service. It is so obvious that most of the staff do not know how to greet and treat their customers. My family and I were hoping to get a table on a Wednesday night around 7ish. We arrived and were told to wait about 20-30 minutes so we did. After 30 minutes, we kept noticing the host was sitting everyone except for us( even the people that were coming in after us and big parties) We asked if our table will be ready and they told us yes soon. So we decided to continue waiting and then after waiting more than an hour, we noticed we were the only ones waiting for a table. The host told us that our table was not ready and that he can sit my family in two different tables. We were all upset that after waiting for more than an hour, the host wanted to sit us in different tables. When we asked to sit together, he seemed careless and told us we will have to wait who knows how long. Very unprofessional and not friendly at all. Next time just tell your customer the truth about the waiting time and make smart seating arrangement. I was once a host and completely understand the situation but it&#39;s important to always communicate to the customers and make smart seating arrangements. At the end we were fed up by the situation that we decided to leave and eat at another restaurant.

Gotta love the menu, if you can&#39;t find something you like, then you should go home. Definitely a novelty restaurant. But I&#39;ve never been disappointed. Always good to keep this in your selection of possibilities. Again good to fair price. Good volume of food, and taste is usually better than good. It sounds loud inside, service is usually good in Oakbrook, the downtown not so good!!

Amazing service, food was really great and would most definitely recommend this place and this location is particular is really big and they even give the option to dine outside in a patio which is really nice too.
Good food but slow service once seated.  Staff was friendly but again slow and at times felt deserted

Great service, great food! I always love coming to this location, great every time.  I ordered the four cheese pasta with alfredo sauce which was fantastic.  We had a thirty minute wait but it went by quick and our food came out 10 minutes after ordering which was impressive given how busy they were.

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Had most of the family there including our littlest food critic Elwood! He loved the bread and flirted with everybody there! We will definitely be back! The entire staff is first rate!

The food is terrible under seasoned. I ordered a chicken and shrimp gumbo with rice. The description even states this dish is suppose to be cajun...there was not cajun flavor in this dish. I doubt there was even salt and pepper in it because no matter how much I added it was so bland. My entire table ended up sending their food back due to how poorly seasoned everything was. 2nd, why the hell is so dark?! I understand mood lighting but it was 8pm and pitch black outside already, you can barely see what you&#39;re eating with how damn dark it is in there. Then after sending our food back, we were offered to order something new, which we did but IT NEVER CAME. Our waiter, never came back to check on us, never even looked our direction again, we waited almost 45 min for the new food before just walking out. I&#39;ve never had such a POOR experience in a restaurant in my entire life. The worst part was that I had brought someone here for their first time. NEVER AGAIN.

I appreciate the feedback from the Cheesecake Factory.   I would like to advise you that every time I am there I DO let the manager know ! <br>One day the floor in the washroom was so wet my young child fell and bumped her chin on the nasty wet washroom floor.  I walked up to the manager with her and we both told him what happened and all he said was he&#39;s have an employee take a look at it. Not at all sympathetic <br><br>To be completely honest with you, he blew it off <br>I was really disappointed.  I love the cheesecake and when the food is on point it&#39;s delicious ! <br><br>But the washrooms and the smoking RIGHT outside the door to walk in are huge turnoffs.  If we&#39;re going to wait for over an hour for a table, things need to improve !   I can promise you from the bottom of my heart that the management has been notified several times regarding the washrooms being filthy. Next time I go I will get a few pics and post them to help you out.  I understand when management is going into an establishment, everyone scrambled to make things  look perfect.  Go there unannounced on a weekend night and you&#39;ll be in shock

Can&#39;t miss by going to a Cheese Cake Factory. We had the best service, the bread was hot out of the oven, and free refills. Only disappointment was they didn&#39;t take the Chicago area &#34;Let Us Entertain You&#34; cards any longer. I was also disappointed they didn&#39;t have crayons, or something for the little guests. (So bring your own!) But our waitress was stellar, and even went out of her way to get me a whole plain cheese cake, WITHOUT the sour cream topping. Great place, great atmosphere, and great food &amp; service.

Cheesecake Factory is amazing for everyone who wants to taste incredible cheesecake. Really, I didn&#39;t expect my White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake to be so delicious. Crusty and salty nuts, sweet caramel were combined with smooth and tender taste of cream, blended with white chocolate... Perfect!<br>Also, I tried Steak Diane and I was surprised that this restaurant can be proud not only of their cakes but of their meals too. Very good medium grilled steak with mushroom sauce and mashed potatoes was wonderful. <br>The stuff was very nice there. Although, there were many people we didn&#39;t have to wait for a long time to get table and our meals.<br>I didn&#39;t give them 5 stars because my friend found some hair in her meal. Well, it happens. Who knows? We were outside and it was windy, so that hair might get into her plate eventually. I still believe The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to have dinner ;)

We had a great experience here today. Marco was our server and he got us everything that we wanted very quickly. We ate the bread right away and we asked for only brown bread for the second basket. He instantly brought us three loaves of the bread. Marco was very nice and attentive and the food was fantastic. We will be returning!

Cheesecake factory in Oakbrook Terrace is one of the best place for dining with waiting hours. This place is always crowded whether its weeknd or weekdays. Finally after waiting for 20-25 min,we got settled and ordered mocktails Typhoon Punch and Red Sangria. I liked Typhoon punch,very refreshing.. The menu was big with many options. We ordered Pasta Da vinci and Four Cheese pasta. Both were delicious,with large portions.<br>This place is very big with beautiful interior,staff was very helpful.

the waiter and service here were incredible. It was my first time ever coming here &amp; the menu is pretty big so my family and I took quiet a long time deciding on what we were gonna eat, not once did she ever rush us. We got out food fairly quickly with how busy there were at the time &amp; everything was magnificent!! Very huge portions size &amp; free bread! It was my birthday this day and they went out of there way of singing and writing a adorable happy birthday message on my delicious carrot cake. I Will 60000% recommend to try this place to anyone who hasnt.

We loved our lunch we had here last week at the Oak Brook location. Our food was great, but we had an awesome waiter Tyler, he was the best! We never had to wait for anything and he came and checked on us frequently.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory with our Church&#39;s Usher Ministry.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.  It was my first time there and I look forward to returning.  I highly recommend the Cheesecake Factory.  It is a great place to dine or celebrate a special occasion.

This place is amazing. Everyone that I bring here falls in love with the food and cheesecake.  The only reason this place received 4 stars is because like every other place there&#39;s room for improvement  and by that I mean possibly adding on and making more seating. Awesome place!

This review is solely for the cheesecake to go counter... the service here is atrocious! Every time I&#39;ve come to buy a slice of cheesecake to go there is always at least a 20minute wait! Why?!? It&#39;s not like you&#39;re baking the damn cheesecake for goodness sake! I&#39;ve come on different days and times and it&#39;s always the same service! I went in today and the there was a line of orders ready to be given to the customers but apparently only cashiers can hand out the slices... and the cashier was no where in sight. I finally got my order once a manager got there to help! Today was the straw that broke the camels back and I will not be wasting my time or money at this place! The service in Skokie and at the John Hancock is nothing like this!

Had a great time waitress suggested a drink based on my likings. Very tasty, my grandson was not having a good day and they were very accommodating very kid friendly! Dinner was mouth watering and very good. Dessert was extremely good remember it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory .

So we ordered DoorDash delivery from Cheesecake Factory. Order came promptly. This is when things went south and I will NEVER eat from here again. My son was missing chicken in his chicken quesadilla. My Santa Fe salad only had lettuce and cheese. NOTHING else!! We called Cheesecake Factory and was told twice that &#34;it&#39;s not our fault once it leaves the restaurant&#34;. Last time I checked your kitchen is at fault and absolutely no responsibility. Awful food and awful service. No attempt to make things right. After spending $115 we will happily take our money elsewhere.

When I was a small, going to McDonald&#39;s was a treat. Now it makes me feel sick. Then, when I was in my early 20s and didn&#39;t know better, TGI Friday&#39;s was my FAVORITE restaurant. At that time, going to the Cheesecake Factory was a big ooh la la deal. I considered the Cheesecake Factory to be high class fancy. Not so much anymore. Now I just think it&#39;s overrated.<br><br>The super high ceilings, murals, and lighting are reminiscent of a banquet hall or ballroom; however, that&#39;s in stark contrast to their booths and regular tables. The servers do their jobs. Nothing more and nothing less. It&#39;s not exceptional.<br><br>At one point I wandered around looking for a bathroom and it took several employees passing me by before one kind soul gave me any kind of direction.<br><br>The food is okay, although I only got dessert during my most recent visit. My buddy got cheesecake (which he loved!) and I got a Tres Leches Milk Shake. The milk shake was super caramel-y and super sticky sweet for my taste. It was also so huge that I hardly devoured a quarter of it before I brought it to my fridge at home.<br><br>I might visit The Cheesecake Factory at the Oak Brook Mall if I happen to be there for something else (e.g. shopping); however, I don&#39;t think I would seek it out just because. I mean, heck - there&#39;s even better restaurants at the mall. I might only head over to the Cheesecake Factory if I want dessert.

Chicken Marsala, Cajun Pasta Jambalaya, Thai lettuce wraps, cheesecakes, Sunday brunch - all awesome. If you can&#39;t find something you like here, you&#39;re just too picky. <br><br>Everything is pretty good, portions are large, and the delicious bread basket is terrible for those on a lo-carb program.

I went here on Sunday &amp; all of our food was fresh and so delicious. It was a big group of us &amp; they got everyone&#39;s food right. The fried Mac &amp; cheese was so delicious &amp; the spinach dip. My pasta was good as well. Can&#39;t wait to go back and eat more.
Mom an daughter day! Enjoying life with my Mom! Lunch at Cheesecake Factory!  Our server is very nice an helpful! Thank you

Great food - bad management!<br>We order the Jamaican shrimp &amp; chicken.  They ran out of the black beans as a side, so the waiter offer a substitution.  I was agreeable to this - no issue there.<br><br>My order came out missing two side items - including the substitution for the black beans.  I waited to get the two side items for another 12-18 mins.  Then the bill came - they charged me extra $$ for the substitution of the black beans!!!<br><br>I told the manager as I was wondering why the item came out higher than usual?  He corrected for the extra charge - saying he didn&#39;t know why the system over charged me. (If he didn&#39;t know, how would I know??)<br><br>If my kid and I didn&#39;t review the bill carefully and knew the prices as regular customer, the restaurant would have over charged me for their multiple mistakes and shortage of the regular item.<br><br>Three mistakes on the same item - yet no offer to discount or an offer of slice of desert!?? No apology by management!<br><br>This was ridiculous - I should file with the BBB for the erroneous charges to the customer.  The food is great!  Service - always sub par!!!<br>I would try another venue!

I used to love the franchise and go to this location a few times a year.  No longer.  They changed my favorite dish, the Pasta da Vinci.  It used to be a wine reduction sauce which was delicious.  Now it&#39;s noddles swimming in oil.  When I asked my server about it, he made a joke about it and asked if I wanted another serving, while all I wanted was to understand how they could butcher what used to be awesome food.  I already knew their food wasn&#39;t very healthy but this made me loose my appetite and I will no longer eat there.

What can be said about Cheesecake Factory that hasn&#39;t already been said? It&#39;s a chain restaurant with a cluttered menu and the cheesecake is so-so. <br><br>You have to be really hungry to eat at this particular Cheesecake to put up with the wait (you&#39;ll wait at least 30 minutes when their are empty tables everywhere), the parking situation is crazy. You&#39;re fighting for parking spaces because there are no less than 3 other restaurants sharing the same lot. And don&#39;t get me started on the slow service. The staff has no sense of urgency to greet you or bring water or bread. <br><br>Save yourself the stress. If you really need a cheesecake fix just get it to go and be in and out in about 5 minutes.

I LOVE this place!! Excellent service every time we go, the food is consistent and delicious no matter what location we go to. the ambiance is very beautiful and welcoming. By far one of my favorite places to eat since we&#39;ve never once had a poor experience. Bravo!

The first time I went there, the waitress, Lauren was very rude. We were celebrating my birthday &amp; she was just so rude - maybe because we were a younger crowd. Then, when they sang to me, she walked away halfway through the song. She never checked up on us, we had to beg her to come back to us to order desert. Then, she dropped my cheesecake. Horrible. <br><br>A few weeks later, we came back to see if it would be any better. They seated us in the way back of the restaurant as if they wanted to hide us. We told them, and they said it would be 20 minutes to move us, which is wrong because we should not be behind the register. Our waitress was very unwelcoming and careless. She was fake &amp; clearly didn&#39;t care that we were there. I will not be returning ever again as both were horrible experiences. Save your money for a cheaper, more welcoming restaurant.

This is the restaurant to choose to please the whole crowd. The savory menu is vast and varied: fish, fowl, burgers, pizza, pasta, eggs, sandwiches, salads, steaks &amp; chops, comfort food,  Asian-inspired, Tex-Mex, fried stuff with cheese. It&#39;s All-American and wrapped up in an eye-popping, technicolor, Egypt meets theme park package.<br><br>And then there&#39;s cheesecake. Lots and lots of cheesecake. Cheesecake-On-Ice. There are, at minimum, two dozen types of cheesecake from plain to fruity to decadent chocolate. Ever wonder what is meant by the phrase gilding the lily? The answer is: The Cheesecake Factory cheesecake. Whipped cream is not enough for these people! They must stuff it with candy, or maybe stir in booze, or sprinkle it with chips or streusel, or top it with frosting. They layer it with cake, or brownies, or fresh fruit. If you&#39;re a person who, when it comes to desserts, believes more is more; then The Cheesecake Factory is for you! The sweets don&#39;t stop with cheesecake either. Oh heavens no! There are ice cream sundaes, cakes, tortes, milkshakes, and tiramisu.<br><br>Now I know I just called this place a crowd-pleaser, but that does not mean it tops my personal list of restaurants. Although the food is good and I&#39;ve never had any dish here to complain about, it isn&#39;t great. The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s strength is variety. You can please the kids, the grandparents, and the vegetarians all in one place.<br><br>For me, the entire concept from decor to menu is over-the-top. Sensory overload. Too many menu items. Too many embellishments. Too much noise. Too many people. Too many tables too close together. Too many smells. No, seriously! Try enjoying your cheesecake on a not-exactly-clean table only a foot away from neighboring tables eating fish and pasta. It&#39;s too much for me. I&#39;m much more likely to drop by for a slice of cheesecake to take home.<br><br>But then again, if I&#39;ve got a big group to feed with varied tastes and of various ages, I will likely consider The Cheesecake Factory.
This place is horrible. Over 2 1/2 hour wait to be seated. They refuse to the reservations.  Absolute garbage.

For Mother&#39;s Day my mom requested to have lunch here today. Called ahead to inquire about the wait time was informed by the young lady it would be 1 hour. Once we arrived the story changed to 20 minutes which was good. Waited about 10 minutes before being seated our waitress was good and attentive. My only negative we were seated next to a couple in which the gentleman complained about his waitress. His complaints went on and on which caused a problem due to my mom and I couldn&#39;t enjoy our meal in peace. Even the couple sitting on the opposite side of this couple found his constant complaining very annoying. Other than the constant complaining our experience was good and the food was great.

I really enjoy dining at this location. The Cheesecake Factory has good food and excellent service. Last night we tried their fish and chips, steak Diane, and garlic spaghetti which were all very tasty and full of flavorful.<br><br>I didn&#39;t try the fish and chips but my husband said the fish was nice and flaky . I had one of their combination platters half steak Diane and half herb salmon with smash potatoes.  I liked the steak more than I liked the salmon the mash potatoes were yummy.<br><br>My friend had the garlic spaghetti which was full of good garlic flavor and I really liked how you got to have a choice of shrimp or chicken to go along with the dish. <br><br>we had for dessert their famous Apple Caramel Cheesecake and their Lemoncello Torte which is amazing.

I&#39;ve stopped here for dinner a few times with my family and it&#39;s generally been fine -  nothing memorable, but convenient if we are stopping by the mall.<br><br>Tonight I would have given it 2 stars for my mediocre meal, but my family had slightly better luck so I&#39;ll give it 3 stars overall. We arrived around 6pm when it wasn&#39;t busy (we had maybe a 10 minute wait for a table) yet it took nearly half an hour to get our food.<br><br>I opted to try the eggplant parmesan with pesto pasta for the first time. I won&#39;t be ordering it again. The five eggplant medallions arrived looking tasty with a tightly wound side of very oily angel hair pasta that looked stiff. It was. I&#39;m a fan of al dente pasta, but it mine was simply undercooked and tough. No problem, when our waiter, Stephen, passed by I let him know and he said he&#39;d bring more. <br><br>In the meantime I was enjoying my eggplant medallions. Alas the last two were also undercooked - eggplant is good firm, but it shouldn&#39;t have any crunch to it! Because we wanted to head out, I didn&#39;t bother mentioning this to Stephen and just finished it up along with the fresh pasta (which was cooked properly although still way too oily.) <br><br>My daughter and wife had fine meals. We ordered a slice of cheesecake to go since we were running a bit late due to the slow service. Fortunately my daughter took a peek in the takeout bag because our server had brought the entirely wrong cheesecake. Not a big deal, but another delay and an easily avoided problem if he had just double checked the order.<br><br>My takeaway from the evening is the reminder that there are better options in the mall area.

i&#39;ve come here multiple times in the last 10 years and not once have i had a problem here! they do get quite busy, so i would get reservations beforehand. but if you&#39;re grabbing just dessert, you can grab one of the high top tables by the bar! the list of cheesecakes i&#39;ve had...oh man. and the bread too! oh man. delicious!<br>+1 for the staff!

We had a wonderful experience here last night to celebrate by son&#39;s birthday.  Nick is a fantastic server in every respect - one of the best I&#39;ve ever seen.  Service and food was great and manager checked on us as well after minor issue.  Could not have been handled better.  The service alone will bring us back again.  Cheesecake selections were top-notch, thanks to Nick for his recommendations.  Highly recommended.

Went on a Saturday with my husband and 2 year old. It was crazy crowded! We had to wait for over an hour for a table even though we were told the wait time was 30 mins. Then when we finally sat down the silverware on my husband&#39;s side were very dirty. Did not expect something like this after waiting an hour! This is a serious tip for everyone check the back of the forks and spoons at restaurants. The food was decent we got 2 veggie pastas but the red velvet cheesecake was delicious! We got a raspberry cheesecake as well which was good. Overall the experience wasn&#39;t worth it. Next time I&#39;ll skip waiting for an hour grab a cheesecake for take out and enjoy it at home.

To be honest, this is def not a bad restaurant! However, its not the best. The menu has too many options, and the food does not look like the pictures/ taste like them either. I used to come here a lot with my friends when I was in high school, but after I got older, I started to realize that there are so many other options for food that relevantly cost the same. I am not belittling the restaurant, the food does taste good. however, it is just not my go-to anymore.

The food and service at this location is wonderful...that is, if you even get a chance to experience it. The wait times are terrrrrrible on the weekends! It wouldn&#39;t be as bad if they had more seats on the inside for the people waiting. Instead, you walk in to a sea of people waiting to be seated and a lot of times they&#39;re blocking the check in desk. <br><br>All that aside, they have a pretty vast menu that caters to whatever you&#39;re in the mood for. I&#39;d definitely go back, but not during peak hours.

Stopped in after a day of shopping. Attempted to place a order to go by phone for my favorite cheesecake. After holding several minutes, I decided to walk over. I stood in line and placed my order and held on the phone just to see how long it would take. <br><br>After I ordered face to face, one person answered. I told him I was holding and decided to come in. I was told it is quicker to come in. <br><br>So, I would recommend against a take out order if you are nearby.

I hate it. First of all girl let me tell you. I walked in okay then I sat my ass down and ordered my food. It was all pretty good. Honestly best food I&#39;ve ever had. But then when the lady came back to check up on me she took my plate and asked if I wanted a dessert, of course I said yes. But hold up... they had no cheesecake. What time of joke is this???? You&#39;re gonna have a restaurant called the Cheesecake Factory with cheesecake in the name yet not have any???? I&#39;m very disappointed and I will never be going back. Very mad.

Terrible service! Waited forever for some bread. We asked four times for them to being bread in between the two servers who switched on us. The kids plates came before any bread which was super hard. I give it one star for the food is actually good.

The fact that cheesecake forgot MY tossed salad or claimed they never got it is absolutely UNNECESSARY &amp; UNEXCEPTABLE. I&#39;m so pissed and disappointed bc I am on my lunch and wasted $10 that I should of kept. Never again doing a pick up order. Poorly customer service

Never had a bad experience here. Food is always fantastic. Tried the fried macaroni cheese burger and oh man ... get the napkins cause it&#39;s messy. But well worth it. The burger itself is HUGE. Super filling, loved every bit. Definitely had to take a portion home. Cheese cake was excellent like always.

Ahh, &#39;murrica. Home of massive portions of mediocre food. And then dessert.<br><br>The best thing about The Cheesecake Factory is their ability to accommodate large groups. I dined with a party of 20 and they were great about sectioning off an area for us, even though a party of that size requires two tables, two servers, and (at least) two checks. <br><br>My friends tried to bully me into getting a different cheesecake for each course of my meal. Had I not eaten ice cream for lunch that day, I may have done just that. Each slice is like a generous slice of heaven. Depending on your mood, you can get something light and palette cleansing, like the mango key lime, or something rich and decadent, like the Godiva chocolate on chocolate on chocolate. But in all honesty, I would definitely be a happy camper just making a meal of their brown oat bread and a slice or two of cheesecake.

So, does this place really need another review?  Yes, because I had to walk out to compose myself and then return to finally get seated ~ just as they opened.<br><br>Given the occasion for my being there in the first place, the first booth they tried to seat me at would not work.  I asked for a table.  It doesn&#39;t exist in this restaurant.  EVERY TABLE has at least one bench for seating ~ no 4 chairs.  So while I&#39;m waiting for the person to check on a switch, another guy comes and tries to seat another party, RIGHT WHERE I ALREADY AM.  He gives me the, &#34;excuse me&#34; I want to seat someone else where you are sitting.  Then the first guy comes back and arranges 2 tables in the most crazy way ~ put them together between other tables instead of just putting us at the end of the row.  Before I can gather all my belongings from the original booth, the second guy is back with the same party he tried to seat while I was still there.  When I asked about the end, the original guy became very frustrated with me and said I needed to speak with a manager.<br><br>Why is this SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO friggin&#39; hard?<br><br>So, I come back in and am seated in exactly the SAME location only on the other side of the wall.  Okay, the rest of the party begins to arrive.<br><br>Then, when we are comfortable and chatting, another guy comes over to inform us that they are going to have to move us so they can seat other patrons where we are.  Being the bold Yelper that I am, I refused to move, one more time.<br><br>He tried to convince me that we WERE going to move and when another person in the party spoke up, he very sarcastically said, &#34;Enjoy your meal.&#34;<br><br>Each meal came out individually, one at a time.  Again, something I have never experienced before.  Not hot by the time mine finally came out.  NO BIG SURPRISE THERE.<br><br>Large selection so, to me, that says they really have no special dish they are famous for.  Our server was very pleasant.<br><br>Way too many other restaurants to choose from to treat patrons in this manner.

I&#39;ve said it once and I&#39;ll say it again, this place is awesome. I love the huge menu, so many choices can be overwhelming but it works at this place. We usually go to the Orland location, but things are just as good here. The server was on top of things and food was great as always. We had red velvet cheesecake like always and it was fantastic. I would highly recommend this place to anybody looking for a date night or just a nice place to go out and eat.

I have always been a fan of the cheesecake factory. It is by far thee best place to eat just that ... Cheesecake! Do not be fooled they give the absolute best portions of food with a twist. It is a restaurant with a diverse variety of food for fairly reasonable prices. This specific location is always busy so please walk in to reserve a specific time. Parking is limited due to it being in the area of a huge outdoor mall. The service is excellent and I am definitely sure you will receive the same. I would recommend.

We has a taste for some cheesecake for dessert. Saturday before Christmas, we thought for sure we would never get a table - but there we went anyway.  I said, before we got out of the car, if the wait is too long, we are leaving.... We walk in, see people waiting - ask for an estimated time to wait - 15 minutes - WOW, that&#39;s nothing.  Then we were told that if we wanted to sit at one of the high tables in the bar area, there was no wait - SOLD!<br><br>Our waiter, Michael was a gem! He was so attentive and friendly and was quick to describe all of the cheesecakes we asked him about.  Loved him!  He helped make this a wonderful experience - even if it was &#34;just dessert&#34; it was a welcome break after a crazy day of shopping madness!!  <br><br>As far as the food, we had several types of cheesecakes - all of which were really good.  <br><br>Will definitely be back if we are in the area!
It has been quite awhile since my family has eaten here so I honestly could not recall my last experience. In short the restaurant was beautiful, our waiter was awesome and the food was delicious.

Can&#39;t go wrong with the cheesecake factory. However I like their sister store. &#34; The GrandLux &#34;the best. Large portions and of course the cheesecake. Craig&#39;s outrageous is what I&#39;m having today. The best if you have a later group to order a bunch of appetizers and share this will fill you up. Sharing is what makes the world work. :)
I love the cheese cakes here. They are good and the portion size is big. It helps that the kids like the food here. I hate the wait but what do u want for good food.
I like Cheesecake Factories.. This is the same as all the other. Cant beat their cheesecake! If you&#39;ve never had them.. Try the Fried Mac n&#39; Cheese balls!

More flavors of cheesecakes than one can imagine and each one more delicious than the last. Also, their whipped cream is a marvelous accoutrement to the edible euphoria that is a cheesecake from the Cheesecake factory. The sandwiches and burgers are also delicious. The only quibble is that there should be a greater selection of sugar free dessert offerings.

Yeah, I know, it&#39;s a big chain with a big menu, blah blah blah.<br><br>But I will give them some credit: they actually do make everything fresh, and regularly change up their large menu with seasonal items.<br><br>Here&#39;s what I liked:<br><br>No wait around 5:30 on a Friday (though there certainly was one when we left)<br>Service was solid<br>Food was really good, actually<br><br>We got nachos as an appetizer; they had tasty pulled chicken, good amounts of cheese, fresh guacamole and pico de gallo, and were nice and hot. For my dinner I got two items from the small plates -- a sausage and ricotta flatbread and an arugula salad, lightly dressed with lemon, olive oil, parmesan, marcona almonds and golden raisins. The flatbread was deliciously garlicky (a little skimpy on the sausage but oh well) and the crust was airy and chewy-crisp. The salad was well-dressed and just the right size.<br><br>My husband got a chipotle chicken sandwich and seemed to enjoy it. <br><br>Not all of the portions are huge, I&#39;d like to add -- they do have a nice variety of more reasonable sized plates. That said I did see one of the biggest burritos in existence, about a foot long and at least four inches wide. <br><br>What&#39;s not to like? Well, the building has huge ceilings and the tables are close together so it&#39;s very echoey and kind of loud. <br><br>And there is the argument that if you have a menu spanning sushi rolls to pasta dishes to Tex-Mex you may not be doing any of it well -- I can&#39;t speak for the entire menu, but I can say that what we ate was good. That said the prices are a couple bucks higher than I&#39;d like for the quality and atmosphere.<br><br>We probably won&#39;t be regulars here, because it does seem to cater primarily to tourists, business travelers and mall-goers, but I would come back.
Food was wonderful service was not to good the poor waitress had a large party that took priority...
My man and I go here once in awhile and we get okay service. Food always good, but they servers we had a few times we had gone were too slow to get to us and too slow to bring the food out.

I&#39;m not a big cheesecake factory fan. The menu is to big, they restaurants tend to be to big. The drinks too expensive and I always inevitably get a sassy server. But this time I don&#39;t know if it was the occasion or the day or what but I actually had a great experience. <br><br>I&#39;ve never been to this cheesecake factory before. It was sooooooo big. I thought it was nicer than the one in Caesar&#39;s palace in Vegas! (Don&#39;t ask me why I went to the cheesecake factory in Vegas. It&#39;s a long story). Any who, the hostess told me and my friends that it would be an hour and a half wait. We were a big group and it was Sunday afternoon so I get it. They&#39;re busy. So what did we do?  Hit the empty bar! Why wasn&#39;t everyone waiting at the bar I have no clue. <br><br>Our bartender was amazing!  Attentive, happy to be there,  funny,  everything you wait your booze slanger to be!  We all ordered fancy drinks that were delicious and apps that were also amazing! When they finally called our group we were all sufficiently liquored up and happy.  Our server was equally awesome!  She got all our orders right (there were 10 of us) and she offered to split our checks! We didn&#39;t have to ask!! <br><br>They have a really nice happy hour special. I never would have thought about going to the cheesecake factory for happy hour in the past but now l can&#39;t wait to go back!

I went here with 3 friends for my 60th birthday lunch and I was so disappointed in the meal that I really never got to eat.<br>We went in and waited about 30 minutes not big deal it was Saturday afternoon and the wait was not bad. We were given a nice table and waited quite awhile for our server but they were busy so that part was okay and she was really nice.<br>Now for the food. It just was awful. I was so looking forward to trying the mac/burger since it was my first time at this place. I ordered it medium with no salt on the fries. It came out like a brick and the fries had so much salt I sent it back. Than when it came out again it was RAW I mean not even medium rare but raw so I couldn&#39;t eat is and by that time I was done. My friend had a veggie burger and she hated it very mushy but she didn&#39;t say anything. My other friend had a chicken buffalo sandwich they brought the wrong sauce (blue cheese) and when she said something they just brought out new sauce but by then the sandwich was ruined and she didn&#39;t eat her either. My other friend got a salad and sweet potato fries and said the salad was just okay but the fries were full of grease.<br>The manager did come over and take 2 items off the check but it wasn&#39;t enough we should not have been charged for anything other than the drinks. Just bad customer service as far as I am concerned. Even with 2 meals taken off it was still almost 75.00 without the tip.<br>This was suppose to be an amazing afternoon with great friends and turned into a rotten day with really nobody having anything much to eat.<br>It really just sucked to have my birthday lunch just ruined and to top it off it was my idea to go there. UGH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place looks great and has a monster menu.   That being said the food is average at best, yet the price is much higher than average.<br><br>During the last visit, we went for brunch.  My kids got pancakes and didn&#39;t finish them.  That should tell you all you need to know, but it&#39;s pretty hard to mess up pancakes for a kid.  They just didn&#39;t like them.  I tried something different, some kind of eggs benedict variation.  It looked spectacular, but once again it was just OK.....and $15 for a breakfast entre with no meat.<br><br>About once a year we decide to give it another try, but we are always underwhelmed.

A great place for large groups because of the large variety of food. <br><br>I love their avocado egg rolls. Seriously delicious. They have a cilantro sauce that really puts them over the top. <br><br>Obviously their cheesecake is fabulous. I live the mango key lime coconut one.

There are probably tons of reviews for Cheesecake Factory, but if you don&#39;t mind I&#39;ll add one more lol. First, I cannot give this place 5 stars because it seems like every time I go the wait can be really long. Also, the service amongst wait staff is not consistent. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because of the food. Some of my favorite dishes are the Crispy Chicken Costoletta, Tex Mex Egg Rolls, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken, Shrimp Scampi, and surprisingly the Steak.

Not too fond of the management staff. The larger African American manager is not helpful at all. I called in an order of salad dressing. They said it would take 15 min to prepare. I get there 20 min after I called. Still not ready. Waited 10 min before someone came to the bakery which  is the pickup zone. There were workers preparing cheesecake but did not acknowledge the line that was forming at all. We waited 10 min before someone came to the register. From there the dressing still wasn&#39;t ready. It was getting ridiculous. So I finally was able to pay and another 10 min went by before I asked to speak with and complained to the aforementioned manager. She went to the back and another 7 min went by before she finally came back with the dressing. At that point I was a bit ticked and just asked for a refund. No empathy at all was shown. No sorry. No sense of hospitality whatsoever. I felt wronged. Still do. I truly feel like there has to be better candidates for the manger position here.

Great service, nice atmosphere, amazing food. Perfect meal. The Salmon Grnovese was the best salmon dish I&#39;ve ever had. Natasha had the California Chresesteak Sandwich. She was going to take some home, but I guess it was too good!  Eat outside if you can.

I was so utterly impressed with this place. I&#39;ve been here a number of times and always felt the food&#39;s wonderful but this last experience was exceptional all around. <br><br>When we got seated our very friendly waitress came over and greeted us warmly, and when I asked her about a certain menu item being gluten free she didn&#39;t know right off hand but the manager was right next to us and he knew right off the top of his head the exact ingredients in the dish that made it unsafe for a celiac to eat. I was very impressed..our waitress said they had a meeting about gluten free food and how to avoid cross contamination..for someone with very bad food allergies it&#39;s heavenly to hear that. I decided to go with the shepherd&#39;s pie and it was out of this world! I can honestly say it was hands down the best thing I have ever eaten...ever. I demolished that plate without an ounce of guilt. I ordered a gluten free beer and even contemplated eating their gluten free cheesecake but I was already struggling to breathe haha <br><br>Seriously, this place is a gluten free paradise. They have ruined me. I dream about that damn shepherd&#39;s pie.<br><br> I will have you again pie..and when I devour you I will not worry about being ladylike.<br><br>Mmm...

Terrible experience with management and we hadn&#39;t even walked in. Extremely rude. <br><br>Update: came back. Made reservations for specific tables, the Table was given to another family and our group was forced to split. Have never had a good experience at this location. Management and customer service skills are subpar.

I have been to this location a few times, and every time I go, the service seems to worsen.  I expect it to be busy on a Sunday afternoon, but apparently their staff was unhappy about it? Every staff member there seemed to be pissed off or just plain unhappy to be there. I saw not one smile on anyone&#39;s face.  When I finally got seated at my table the hostess wouldn&#39;t even acknowledge me, just told me to stand off to the side.  Our waitress was ok. Not super friendly but at least she was attentive.  Luckily we weren&#39;t seated in the next section over because the table next to us had their order messed up twice, and when their waitress broke a dish she served up MAJOR attitude with whoever she had asked to help her clean it up.  As for my food I had a pasta dish with chicken.. asked for no pancetta but apparently they still put some in there anyways.. chicken was way over cooked, and all of it was sloppily thrown into the dish.. if they are going to charge as much as they do, maybe they should put more effort in, no matter how busy it is!

The s&#39;mores cheesecake is TO DIE FOR. Same with the Reece&#39;s PB cup. <br><br>As far as food, the pasta da vinci is always my go to. Great combination of flavors of the grilled onions and creamy wine sauce. Amazing. <br><br>And don&#39;t forget the brown oat bread! Always fresh and delicious. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had a poor experience at Cheesecake Factory before. Highly recommend it to anyone!

I love this restaurant. The Food is good, the drinks are great, especially the Bloody Mary. Defiantly a mid afternoon treat. The Staff is friends and defiantly knows  their menu. I go here At least 3 or 4 times a month. Never leave disappointed.

excellent! best restaurant i&#39;ve eaten in my life! amazing service , unbelievable<br>food, and peaceful ambience!<br>i recommend their stuffed mushrooms, fried calamari, and a burger! even better if you substitute the burgers beef with kobe. after get a cheesecake of your choice. i&#39;ve eaten here for about 12 times in my life ! keep up the good work!

This Cheesecake Factory is going downhill. Brought the family to celebrate my wife&#39;s birthday. Waited 15 mins and we along with 3 other parties were pages at once. They we all waited an additional 15 mins. The hostess didn&#39;t even remember we turned in a pager. Finally sat down, looked at the menu to find no fettuccini with chicken and sun dried tomatoes. They took it off the menu. They they got our appetizers wrong. Bad experience. Must be under new management.

Wow, really liked it, and so did the family. Had the orange chicken, and after one bite, said &#34;This is definitely NOT Panda Express!&#34;. We all had something different, and all loved what we had. Great cheesecake too. Will definitely be back as often as we can.

The restaurant was crowded on a Sunday afternoon but there were only two of us so we were seated right away (lucky)! <br>We waited over 5 minutes to get greeted and I waited 10 minutes for my Bloody Mary. I suppose I&#39;m spoiled because I work in an upscale restaurant that obtains 30 second greet times and 2 minute first round beverage time standards. It was a little bizarre. <br><br>The guacamole was fine. Again, took forever to get out. It&#39;s a huge restaurant so I understand if the kitchen gets a little backed up-but it was backed up on every aspect of our meal! No manager came around to apologize (something that is crucial in my place of employment when time standards are not met). I suppose it&#39;s just a different type of service! The food was ok. I got the beet salad which I thought would be bigger but I&#39;m watching my weight anyway so I was ok with it.<br>The only item that didn&#39;t take long was the swiping of our credit card! I guess they were eager to get us out!! <br><br>Tip for management-if time standards are not being met, a simple greet at the tables make a huge difference. It&#39;s your responsibility to look at ticket times in the window and ensure people aren&#39;t waiting over half hour for food.

This is my new fav place to eat. Great Gluten Free Menu. I had the shepherds pie. SOOO GOOOD. WOW. I loved this place. The staff was very knowledgeable  about Gluten.  I felt like they cared. For sure will be back.

Well this place &#34;use&#34; to be great...now it&#39;s hit &amp; miss.  The last 2 x&#39;s (this year) I was at this place there were issues...both times the silverware was dirty &amp; one of those times the waitress forgot to put my daughters meal order in.  I hope they get it together but in any event I won&#39;t b back.

I try to like this place...but after 4 visits...I can&#39;t.  the food is average.  not good....not bad....just meh.....expensive meh.  the menus is like an 80&#39;s greatest hits list....and the servers try hard but don&#39;t seem to be very well trained.<br><br>the cheesecake however is good.  I could see going for dessert and sit at the bar with a cocktail...but no more acid washed jeans and friendship bracelets for me.

Called to place an order for cheesecake. Midpoint through the order, informed that unless ordering more food, would not be able to place it and I could just &#34;walk up to counter and place order, we are not busy&#34; (right, 6pm, holiday season). Find parking at this place, walk up, wait in line. Complained to attendant, who gave a me free piece of cheesecake and gave my order ahead of everybody else waiting there, not really fair to them. Still a 20min ordeal, and unbelievable to me somebody calling to place a $100 order is interrupted and unable to complete the order. Always an unpleasant experience coming here.

Hair hair everywhere!!!  my sister and I went there for lunch and win the food was delivered there was hair on my plate underneath my food so I waited patiently to flag down the waitress to send it back and I did and the manager came over and said they make me  a new one. But as she  was going to walk away I found another  hair in my cocktail! She offered to make a new one but by that time I was done trying that hairy food. She didn&#39;t charge me my meal but she charge my sister for hers when it was just terrible and we shouldn&#39;t have been charged. Plain disgusting

I&#39;d love to give this place a 5. A few years ago, I&#39;d probably do it but it has slipped. I&#39;m a frequent visitor and often take my clients or prospects here for lunch since it&#39;s an amazing menu and I&#39;m a huge fan. I was there a couple months ago and the service was just average and my order was wrong and we had to wait long for them to get the new order. Kinda frustrating when your guest is limited in time. Fast forward to last Friday when I decided to pick up dinner for the wife and kids and take it home with some cheesecake. I called before I left work and placed the order and was told 30 minutes, which was perfect. I arrived about 10 minutes early due to potential crazy parking. I got in and went to host desk and was routed to the cheesecake line for pickups. I saw my order with my name but waited 10 minutes as they kept getting cheesecake prepared for others in the establishment. Then two girls that worked there came to assist me (and 3 others waiting) until they noticed a potential error in giving a wrong customer the wrong order (apparently before I got there). I literally waited another 10 minutes for them to figure out the possible error. All good- they figured it out. Then, they started calling our names for pickups. First off, I was there first but they didn&#39;t acknowledge us by who was in line first. Secondly, they started calling orders of food dropped off from the kitchen after mine was sitting there. How the hell does that make sense?? I commented and told them I was there first and my order was sitting for a while. The reaction was a blank stare before they gave me my food. Guess what? Apparently, their card reader machine was acting up &#34;again&#34;. LOVELY! If this happens often, someone should fix it or call to get a technician out. They decided to reboot the machine while I wait. I waited there for 30 minutes total and then drove home 10 minutes to ice cold fish tacos, cold fries, and soggy salad. Don&#39;t worry, the cheesecake was melted. Disgusting. Almost $80 and we threw most of it away. So disappointed. I called to speak to a supervisor and was on hold for 10 minutes before I gave up. I should&#39;ve just left the order because my gut feeling was it would be cold.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! my waiter was very sassy and rude (rolled her eyes at me) also very slow and unorganized, we waited for our bread for 30 min. not my first time here but this time i was very unpleased. don&#39;t make the same mistake i did of coming here.

Me and my wife love the Cheesecake Factory. From the bread with butter, to your meal that you ordered, and of course they have amazing cheesecake. My favorite thing to eat here is the 4 cheese pasta and my favorite cheesecake is definitely the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. The service is also really great, everything we come here. I would recommend this location to all my friends and family.

No WiFi!  <br><br>What modern restaurant doesn&#39;t have WiFi?  How can you have a business lunch without WiFi?  Unbelievable!  We walked out and across the parking lot to Wildfire. <br><br>We could have gone to any other restaurant in the mall.  <br><br>They ALL have WiFi!

Honestly, this is the only cheesecake factory that I&#39;ve been to that I&#39;ve completely enjoyed the food and thought it was great. However, the service I had my most recent time was terrible. There was probably 10+ servers walking around, and it was not crowded at all on a Friday afternoon around 2:30pm. Regardless of the light business at the time and the incredible amount of servers that seemed to be walking around we waited a very long time for a server, our food, drinks, and rarely saw our waitress. It also seemed as if all the servers were scattered about and did not have specific sections and were running around all over the place. Basically, it seemed very unorganized and the service was not good and unfortunately that made the time less than exceptional.
Worse service in the world. If you ever want to waste your time, here&#39;s the spot! Enjoy!

I had a cheesecake factory giftcard and wanted to go out to dinner the night before Christmas eve to celebrate with my boyfriend and a few friends.  I called ahead of time and tried to make a reservation because I hate to wait.  Their reservation policy is ridiculous.  They told me in order to make a reservation I needed to have over 8 people in my party, have our reservation between 3pm-5pm, contain at least one capital letter/special character, and contain the blood of a virgin.  Ridiculous.  So anyways, no reservations were made and our wait time ended up being about an hour.  Not completely terrible but reservations would of been useful.  Anyways, our waitress was great.  She was able to handle our party of 9 with ease.  I had the Baja chicken tacos and they were ah-maz-ing.  The rice and beans that came with it were nothing special but the tacos made up for it.  The best part of the meal?  They accidently sent me home with two slices of peanut butter cheesecake instead of one.  #winning

I don&#39;t know how this place has any negative reviews. Yes the wait time is long on weekends, but of course that&#39;s when any restaurant is the most busy and that just proves how much people love this place! Personally, I thought it was worth the wait.<br>We ordered a lot of appetizers; calamari, cheesy bread, edamame, all of it was Delicious! Our dinners themselves were just as satisfying and there is something for everyone. <br>The cheesecake, as expected, was excellent and the portions were huge slices. Absolutely going back as soon as I can!

I ate here just the other night during the half off cheesecake special and it was CROWDED. We luckily found a table in the bar area and only ended up with a 15 minute wait. While we were waiting, I had a delicious blueberry mojito! Only complaint? I wish the blueberries were fresher. <br><br>We tried the avocado, zucchini and portabello fries and the were quite tasty indeed! Other things eaten: fried mac n cheese balls (not good the day after), hummus and pitas (a LARGE amount of hummus), southwest chicken sandwich (very tasty!), red velvet and smores cheesecake, southwestern egg rolls, and a couple other things I can&#39;t remember. <br><br>I think the cheesecake factory does a great job with their menu. Good portions, well prepared and great combinations of flavors. I haven&#39;t been disappointed thus far and I&#39;ll most likely go back in the future!

We came on a very busy Saturday afternoon and were looking to seat eight people, two of which were children.  The staff was very accommodating and sat us at a very large table.  (nothing is worse that trying to squeeze that many people into a table that should really be for six).  Our party sort of trailed in which might be a little difficult for the waitress, but she was great.  She had iced tea ready and waiting for the late arrivers and gave us ample time to get settled and look at their ginormous menu.<br><br>We had the spinach and artichoke dip and calamari for appetizers - both were tasty.  I was happily surprised that they now have a Skinnylicious menu that provides different calorie categories.  I ordered the seared tuna tataki salad.  It was delicious and just the right portion, which made me feel a whole lot better when I then split the scrumptious cookie dough cheesecake with my husband for dessert :)

I forgot when Cheesefake factory turned from a family style restaurant into a snooty &#34;upscale&#34; italian style restaurant. Whenever it was it was a day that will forever be labeled as a catastrophic error in strategy. <br><br>Your business model is not impressive. You way overcharge for food thats quality is essentially macorni grill and you are the baker&#39;s square of cheesecake. That means you should be somewhere in those caliber of dining establishments. Prices and light fixtures are unable to convince me otherwise.

I sent an email to The Cheesecake Factory and within a few days of submitting my email complaint I received a few calls and then a formal letter of apology along with a $25 gift card. 5 stars for trying to make things right.

Fav place!! So much to choose from but I still have a solid list I work from.
