Stuffed chicken enchiladas, kale salad, angel hair pasta &amp; shrimp, shrimp bistro pasta, bang bang shrimp app. Can you tell I like shrimp? Torn b/w the plain &amp; banana cheesecake. The carrot cheesecake used to be awesome until it was changed from a layer of carrot w/a layer a cheesecake to cheesecake w/chunks of carrot cake. No bueno. Oh yea! I cannot forget to mention the turkey burger is also tasty for the non-meat eaters.
Very good food and very good service! Dawn was our waitress and she was very good at what she does! And the cheesecake was so good and sweet I feel as if I should see the dentist tomorrow!

Their cheese cakes may be the best but their customer service is among the most arrogant. I would never dine there again after my husband got scolded by the front desk lady. She failed to buzz us when it was our turn to have a table and then  spoke harshly to us when we questioned about it. The food may be worth the long wait but their service ain&#39;t.

This place has really gone down hill...terrible food, terrible service but packed so I guess they don&#39;t give 2fs? Were seated immediately, but it took 15 minutes for the stoned waiter Sc*tt to come over, another 15 for him to bring us our drinks. The food came out relatively quick but my omelette was over cooked yet cold, my daughter&#39;s pasta was ok but skimped on the chicken. The aforementioned Sc*tt kept disappearing (nice shark eyes btw) and it took forever to get the check. He said that he &#34;tried&#34; to talk to the manager to get my meal comped but that he wouldn&#39;t do anything. I also tried to get the manager&#39;s attention (bald guy, huge beard) but it looked like he was more into his fantasy football than serving customers!
Food was very good! We came in and had no wait (after 9pm) the waiter was kind of slow but it did not effect the quality of the food! And the cheesecake...delicious!!

My last review stated that the golden rule of Cheesecake Factory was to avoid, avoid, AVOID on Fridays and Saturdays.<br><br>My rule has changed:  Avoid Cheesecake Factory (Oak Brook) altogether.<br><br>My friend and I met here for a gluttonous Fat Tuesday meal.  I had the macaroni and cheese burger, followed by a slice of raspberry lemon cheesecake.  I felt like I had a brick in my stomach all the way through to the next morning!  I&#39;m not complaining, though, Cheesecake Factory really is one of America&#39;s best and holds up the stereotype that we eat way too much.  But the food is good.  <br><br>The menu is all over the place, so they don&#39;t really have a speciality.  Order what intrigues you or your guilty pleasure - you&#39;ll like it.<br><br>So why the 2 stars?  The service here is HORRIBLE!  Our waitress, Tasha, seemed normal at first.  She told us about the specials, and her favorite cheesecakes, and our drinks and food arrived without a problem.  The end of the meal is when it got strange.  She delivered our checks with 2 pens.  2 pens with Cooper&#39;s Hawk printed on them.  Huh?<br><br>When she came back for our checks, she demanded to know where the second pen was.  I ignored her at first, since any sane person would glance around quickly and then walk away.  It is, after all, a pen.  A pen that belongs to another restaurant!  Instead, she stood there while I stared right back at her and said, &#34;I don&#39;t know.  I don&#39;t know where it is.&#34;  She stood there while I looked under the table and my friend shuffled plates and napkins around.  No pen.  She continued to stand there.  Awkward.<br><br>When she finally walked away, I overheard her sarcastically say to another waitress, &#34;do you have a pen I can borrow?&#34;<br><br>CF needs to stop hiring waitresses with high school attitudes.  I probably won&#39;t be back.

Yummy yummy!  We went here for dinner last night and it was delicious!  I ate off of the skinnylicious menu and had the shrimp tacos.  They were really really good - I really enjoyed them.  I also had a couple bites of the dolce de leche cheesecake.  It was OMG good.  Seriously omg good.  I loved it.<br><br>No complaints about the location - service was great, parking was easy, etc etc.  Overall - loved it.

I&#39;m not huge on Cheese Cake but this place is great. I&#39;ve come about 8-10 times a year and enjoy the selection of food they have (Hibachi favorite). Desert are good as well.<br><br>Service is great and the cheese cake is good!<br><br>Only downside is it&#39;s usually packed at all hours. Parking well it&#39;s Oak Brook expect to drive around for awhile. <br><br>Great place for most occasion from family to dates it works.

I don&#39;t know, Man. The food just seems pretty run of the mill to me. <br><br>Like, borderline microwave made or reheated. And I get that huge portions are their schtick, but it just makes me feel like an American pig. <br><br>I got the fish tacos on my last visit and they weren&#39;t good. The fish had a questionable taste and the taco filling ingredients just didn&#39;t go together... or maybe it was still the sour taste of the fish *cringe*... thus, I&#39;m not eating fish anymore. Hello, aversion. <br><br>In the Summer they do have a nice little outdoor patio but it really just overlooks the mall parking lot. Oh, and the parking lot is a TOTAL mess. There&#39;s just not enough parking and what little is available is reserved for valet parking... and I&#39;m just not about to pay to valet my car at Oakbrook Mall for the Cheesecake factory. Yaknowutimsayin?

I had my first Cheesecake Factory experience this weekend. My girlfriend loves the place and insisted we go. I try not to be snobby, but I have high standards for food. My date was quick to remind me that it&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory, not &#34;The Food Factory.&#34; Noted.<br><br>We were starving so we got the fried cheese off of the &#34;small plates&#34; menu. Mozzarella sticks, essentially. They were good though. In fact, they were probably better than my entree.<br><br>I got the fish and chips. True to Cheesecake Factory lore, the portion was massive. The fish was decent, but the breading was a little thick and doughy. It was served with a fist-sized portion of coleslaw and tartar sauce. Provided the breading wasn&#39;t too thick, a piece of fish with tartar sauce and a forkfull of coleslaw made for a pretty good bite.<br><br>My girlfriend got the shrimp and bacon sandwich. It was giant. Triple decker. Lots of lettuce. The shrimp were grilled, and unfortunately they were insanely overcooked. The sandwich had good flavor though.<br><br>Anyways, one comes to the Cheesecake Factory for the cheesecake, right? So we got some. She got the new Oreo one, and I got raspberry chocolate truffle. Hers was total overkill, but delicious. Mine was a little more traditional, and excellent.<br><br>I&#39;d definitely go back for cheesecake, but I don&#39;t know about this place becoming a staple in my list of go-to restaurants. <br><br>Notes: The place is MASSIVE, yet at 4PM on a Sunday it was still a 15-20 minute wait for the two of us. Also, I&#39;d estimate that 85% of the massive menu is deep-fried. They have a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu with lower-calorie options, but the Cheesecake Factory is 100% an all-American eatery, both in methods of food prep and in portion size. Take that as you will.

Sat outdoors for lunch on a Friday, no wait to get seated. Took 40min for food. Beer I ordered was apparently being refilled so I had to wait. 20min later the waiter came back saying that beer was actually not being refilled, it was finished. Got wine on the house which was good but had to wait an hour while seated to get a meal.

Since this is right across the street from my office- I tend to eat lunch here quite a bit.<br><br>Each Cheesecake Factory has a theme to it.  I always wondered why they chose an Egyptian theme for this particular restaurant located on the pad of Oak Brook Mall, but it is nice to look at nonetheless.  <br><br>If you go at lunch- plan to wait as they do not take reservations.  A hint for all of you:  If you don&#39;t mind eating at a hightop in the bar and are willing to gamble that no one is smoking- you can be seated right away.  I often do this and have never had an issue with anyone smoking.<br><br>Their menu is more like a shopping catalog.  Every other page is an ad for something over at the Mall.  But the menu itself if so diverse, that you can find anything you or anyone in your party wants.  Another hint?  Order the luncheon size portion whenever available as the portions are huge!  And always- ALWAYS save room for a piece of cheesecake! (I always plan to do this but never do as I am always stuffed!)<br><br>The salads and sandwiches are all very good.  Every day there are fish specials (usually salmon and mahi mahi) which you can get blackened or grilled.<br><br>All in all- a good place to meet for lunch as they turn you around quickly and get you back to work.  Hmm . . .now I wonder . . .is that a good thing?

Yep a chain but one I have never been to as they have none near me so I was curious. Besides I fricking like cheesecake so I could care about whether it is a chain really. We went for lunch and were happy.<br><br>The surprise was the food was actually really good.<br><br>I had a lunch portion of the herb crusted fillet of salmon, it had a very tasty lemon butter sauce and was served with asparagus, instead of potatoes they gladly substituted some sauteed spinach which rocked with the lemon sauce. All in all very happy.<br><br>My husband had a grilled shrimp and bacon club sandwich and I must confess as tasty as mine was, his was better. Gah huge with lots of shrimp and crispy bacon, lettuce, tomato and a good special dressing on light multi grain-ish toasted bread. He got fries with his and said they were just ok. He gloated about his better overall pick though.<br><br>He got the chocolate mousse cheesecake which rocked hard. I went with the dulce de leche (hello caramel) and was in cheesecake heaven. My poor arteries.<br><br>Service was good, atmosphere was pleasant and a good time with no glitches was had.<br><br>I think we need one of these in Detroit. Stat.

We went to dinner with our 2yr old and we couldn&#39;t have been happier with our experience. We were greeting promptly and received a table next to the bathroom. This was apreciated as I did not have to travel far to change a diaper. Sheila was our server and she was amazing! Our order was quick, accurate and absolutely delicious. She made several trips to our table and even made sure to stop when our daughter called to her. Our  daughter delighted in telling Shelia about the man who was smoking outside who disappeared (she told this several times). Our visit was pleasant and very satisfying. We will return and hopefully get the privledge of sitting in Shelia&#39;s section.

Everyone knows Cheesecake Factory so I won&#39;t waste your time going into too much detail. I will talk to this specific location though. We didn&#39;t have to wait the usual hour here usually and always find the food and decor better here than the other locations. Service has been just sort of ok but nothing egregious. <br><br>Menu is the usual overwhelming gigantic mess but at least there are options for everyone. I recommend using the small plates or apps to make a meal. It saves money, still lots of food, plus you will have room for a cheesecake. The latter can easily be split among three people or two depending on how hungry you are. This also limits the resulting obesity and diabetes. Overall, everything tasted great and I have had no complaints here.

You cheap, cheap bastards. Garlic does NOT equal flavor. Their food wood be quite good if they would just season it lightly and lay off the pounds of garlic. And I&#39;m a garlic lover!<br><br>While the food is decent, there is no consistency. I&#39;ve always liked what I&#39;ve had, but keep finding that I order the same thing and sometimes like it more than other times.<br><br>The last time I went there they must have decided that they don&#39;t care about their customers. I was going to get a few pieces of cheesecake and wanted to make sure they would put the raspberry sauce they usually do. They said it comes with that. Then I decided to save some money and get an entire cake. The cakes come frozen. She made sure they had the right cake and I asked for the sauce. She said the whole cakes don&#39;t come with the sauce. Are you F-ING kidding me? I&#39;m paying $32 and you can&#39;t give me some sauce? What is it, 50cents? You&#39;re going to begrudge me half a buck? I call BS!

This is the third time I have been to the oak brook Cheesecake Factory. All 3 times I have ordered one meal, they bring out the wrong order and try to convince me it is my fault/ what I ordered. They offer no apologies and are irritated that you mention the order is wrong. For having so much staff,  can&#39;t seem to get it right.<br><br>Long wait times. Too busy to focus on the customers. Not dependable. Disappointed.

The Oak Brook location was easy to get to with lots of parking. Was staying close by for a few days and had dinner elsewhere prior. Stopped by for desert and coffee only. Coffee was good but desert was just OK.  <br><br>Nice enough place over all with staff trying hard. Have had OK experiences w the chain in the past for dinner and will likely be back sometime when convenient but probably  not for desert.

Yum Yum!  This time I will start with dessert - dulce de leche and the red velvet cake was to die for!  Any Cheesecake slice should be shared otherwise you might end up visiting the ER and get a single or double bypass because its too cheesy rich!  :)<br>For meal we had the jambalaya, chicken madera and bam bam thai and they are all delish!  Only thing to watch out is both the chicken thai and madera are sweetened dish so if you are not into sweet then this dish may not be the right one for you!

Ok I just have to say The Cheesecake Factory has never dissapointed me. They are just that good and they have a huge menu which means lots of choices. Ok maybe too many! The prices are a little high for ME so going there is def a treat! I have been TRYING to stay on the low carb diet again so trust me I was happy to see a few low carb cheesecakes listed! Yummo. <br><br>I really enjoy the cobb salad there. I was so happy that the waiter I had asked me first which size I wanted. I guess the larger size feeds like 4 people. Dang! :) <br><br>For the Oakbrook location you want to get there early like by noon during the week. I have not gone there on the weekends. I have been to the one on Michigan Avenue in Chicago a few times during the week and on the weekends. It&#39;s the city so of course that one is always CRAZY.<br><br>I will def go back there again.

Boy, service here has really gone down. For a restaurant with such fancy prices, I would at least expect service to match. <br><br>Now before you judge: I understand this is a large restaurant and that it&#39;s difficult for the servers to go all the way to the kitchen and back in a speedy manner, especially when you are seated outside. However, what isn&#39;t acceptable is when your server ignores you completely and caters to the tables all around you because they&#39;re drinking and spending more money.<br><br> We were seated and spoke to our service twice in the entirety of our visit. Twice. No table bread. No water. No utensils. No refills. ...and guess what? No tip. The only competent person was the girl that brought us our food. She was intelligent enough to realize we didn&#39;t have bread plates (or bread for that matter) and brought us the utensils we lacked. We gave HER the tip instead, because she actually earned it. <br><br>In the future my cheesecake will be &#34;to go&#34; and I won&#39;t be dining here again.

Very very very biased review. I am a total freak for cheesecake. I love it! They have a million types of cheesecake and a pretty good food selection in the restaurant. Tutrle Cheesecake hurt me baby...Blueberry cheesecake...euphoria...cherry cheesecake...Im a boy again!

I never dine in there before but, ordered cheesecake to go. They have so many types of cheesecake, it be ridiculous to attempt to try every flavor they have. I like the Godiva, S&#39;more, and Tuxedo cheesecake the best. It&#39;s well packaged and literally make it look like the actual product when comparing to ad on tv or magazine compared to other places. The place is artsy and high class and floors are even amazing and matches with the scenery. It is very pricey and good for like a special weekend or event out. Also its in the  Mall area, so you could get your shopping done around there too.

Usually pretty good food.  However, I was just there on Saturday April 15 at 3pm and while they were busy, I have seen it much, much worse. So imagine my displeasure at the nachos that were so overbaked they were brown; a drizzle of cheese and 3 jalapeno slices. (I should have taken a picture). And my son ordered a steak well done and it arrived medium. The waiter tried to justify it by saying the meat next to the bone is always pink. First, not true. Second, the pink piece was cut from the opposite side. We requested a credit on the bill and the nachos were made over and this time they were perfect.  But the celebration experience was already ruined by the meal.

I always have the veggie burger but this time it was cold and our waitress was having a bad day or something, she basically ignored us, then was so ticked about a 20% tip she gave us the dirtiest looks. Not going again.
Love the Cuban sandwich.  The buffalo blasts are to die for.  I am diabetic so I can&#39;t have sugar, tried the low carb cheesecake and it was amazing

Stick with dessert! Hence the name, the cheesecake and coffee make for a great after dinner stop.  Don&#39;t get the mushroom soup. The avacado eggrolls used to be good.  Lately they&#39;re too greasy and had a couple times where the avacado was past.

Food is good.  Service is awful.  I literally would eat here all the time for lunch as I work very close.  However, their take out leaves a bit to be desired.  The last time I was there, the worker was throwing the butter around and shooting it in the bag like it was basketball.  Well, it hit my foot.  Also, I&#39;m typically on hold for at least 10-15 minutes to place an order.   I&#39;ll try them in 3 months to see if their service has improved.

Food was not good at all. Came in for brunch with a friend. Ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes for myself and an omelet to share. The eggs for the &#34;omelet&#34; tasted like rubber. The pancakes were meh. The only reasoning I am giving 2 stars is because the waiter was extremely nice and attentive.

The service is so bad, they will not hear what you are asking for such as a table far from kitchen or bathrooms even though the place was empty!! The food was terribly delivered to our table, we ordered the 3 small burgers as an appetizer and there were so greasy and placed in a tiny plate on top of each other and looked discussing.. same for the rest of the food as if they were in a rush and throw the food on the plate. Very disappointing branch.

I wouldn&#39;t even give this place a star if I didn&#39;t have to. Got there at 550pm on Saturday understand wait time do to a Saturday. After waiting hour and 10 like we were told (they stated we only been waiting 47 minutes) we were to another 30 minutes. Okay fine so wait another 20 asked again how long was told another 30 minutes!!! We ended up leaving I&#39;d rather spend my money else where. We were not the only ones this was happening to at the time.

A manager called me (presumably to apologize) last week and she left me a message. I forgot to call her back until this week. She was out of the restaurant when I called the first time but no one offered to take a message. I called again yesterday, was told she was there, and then waited on hold almost 10 minutes before I hung up. This customer service reflects exactly why I wrote a review in the first place.

An extremely popular place. I don&#39;t know why. Way overpriced. Cold  fries. Friendly waiter . Assured us the turkey in the turkey club was roasted turkey not deli turkey but it wasn&#39;t. The club sandwich looked thrown together. Cut pieces missing bacon  or lettuce or turkey. I get a much more beautiful put together club sandwich at Rainbow in Elmhurst or even Yorkys on York Road for way less than this  place.   Not going back.

The Cheesecake Factory never dissapoints me. Their menu is HUGE!!So I always find something. Sometimes I find more than one thing and then I have to chose :( The burgers are Ginormous, one of my favorites. Their plates are pretty generous as well.  I&#39;ve actually have never had their cheesecake. Oops.<br><br>I&#39;ve gone there for lunch and had to leave because it was too crowded. Other times we are lucky and find a spot at the bar. Dinner is no better. The wait at around 6 is an hour, but it&#39;s worth it!

My party of four arrived at the Cheesecake Factory about 6:50pm on a Saturday. We were told that the wait would be 50 minutes, so we decided to hang around, and were seated within that time window. <br><br>The ambience of this location is interesting. It&#39;s reminiscent of an Italian cathedral with high ceilings, buttresses, and sconces on the walls. Our table was in the corner of the restaurant, in a large circular area that provided a nice intimate feeling. <br><br>The waiter was quite attentive. We ordered Chicken Madeira, Chicken And Biscuits, Chicken Carbonara, and Chicken and Shrimp Jambalaya over Fettucine. I was a bit surprised that dinner didn&#39;t include a soup or salad option. Our meals arrived in a timely manner - or at least most of them did. Three of the dishes were brought out by the runner. We waited about 5 minutes, then I found our waiter and informed him that one of our party was still waiting for their plate. The FOH manager came by and I informed him of the missing dish. He disappeared for a few moments and brought back the missing entrée - all without an explanation or apology. <br><br>A few minutes later the waiter came back and explained that this particular runner had forgotten dishes at least twice that evening. The waiter said that he had informed the kitchen manager of the problem as well. The rest of the meal was uneventful, and the dishes were very tasty (although my son, who had the Chicken and Biscuits, became violently ill that night).<br><br>I realize that sometimes there are issues - however, a simple apology from the manager would have gone a long toward a higher rating. If we do Cheesecake Factory again, we&#39;ll try another location.

I went to order a slice of cheeecake. I stood at the register for at least ten minutes and not one of the four associates addressed me with a hello, one moment please, or let me get someone to assist. The sad part is at least two of the associated we&#39;re managers. The person who actually worked in that area was fooling around on the register. She looked me directly in my face and said nothing. Then after she was done with whatever, still no assistance.  A waitress walked up to the register and asked for change as if I wasn&#39;t standing there waiting. Finally, she took my order and as she handed me the bag I said &#34;have a good night&#34; no reply. I&#39;m not sure what the issue was that day, but I hope it stops.

Had a great experience coming here after a visit to the Morton Arboretum!<br><br>We arrived on the early side, around 5ish on a Friday night, and were seated immediately in a booth by the bar area, where we were informed that from 4:30 to 6:00 pm, we could order the normal portions of appetizers for $5 (about half-price).  We decided that was a worthwhile deal, and planned our eating accordingly, since the portions really are enormous here.  The two of us split an order of the guacamole appetizer (medium spicy, which was perfect), as well as an order of the garlic noodles.  We finished the guacamole, had some bottomless free refills of our diet cokes, and ate about half of the garlic noodles-- leaving enough for one person&#39;s lunch the next day! (Albeit, a ridiculously salty one-- the garlic noodles tasted like a metric boatload of butter, garlic, and salt; my boyfriend and I both agreed that the asparagus was easily the best part of the dish!)<br><br>We got the Chcoolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake, which was to die for.  Went home happy and full.<br><br>The restaurant definitely feels like a chain (hence the 4, not 5 stars)... but I have only good things to say about it!

Arrived at 5:00 on a friday as most of our group had very early flights out the next day.. Our party of 5 was seated right away. The restaurant was incredibly loud. The music was pounding. We could barely hear each other talk. Add a screaming baby and you have bedlam.<br><br>Our waiter had a plastered on smile that never moved. However his eyes never actually looked at us. He kept scanning the restaurant for who knows what. The waiter lined us up with two glasses of water each. This was our first sign that he did  not intend on coming back very often.<br><br>We ordered appetizers: grilled artichoke, calamari, corn cakes. The artichoke was good, the corn cakes were excellent and the calamari was sub-standard,<br><br>I ordered the Moroccan chicken. It was good but not exceptional. My friends said their food was ok, but not really remarkable.<br><br>We finally were able to flag down the waiter to order deserts. One of our party asked if there was a cheese cake sampler. The waiter replied &#34;That would defeat the purpose.&#34; I have no idea what that meant.<br><br>We ordered two desserts and requested five plates and forks so we could split the deserts. The waiter returned with three forks. No plates. No forks for the other two people in our party. We asked again for the plates and two more forks. We never saw him again until he delivered the bill.<br><br>Final total was about 48.00 per person. Not worth it. For that price I expect good service and a nice atmosphere. If it was this poor at 5:00, I can only imagine what it was like later in the evening.

The food is usually good at Cheesecake Factories but one thing that seems to occur at any location we have been to is poor service.  We experienced it here and in Schaumburg and Lincolnshire.  I had an omelette which was excellent.  My husband had spaghetti and it took a long time to get extra sauce.  The hot fudge sundae was very good. There was no near-beer.

Where do I even begin?  I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever had it this bad at any restaurant except one, ever!  Usually I love Cheesecake Factory and they are always friendly, professional, and food is great.  Well, I guess not all restaurants are the same.  As far as the Oak Brook location, I&#39;m very scared for them.  I&#39;ve never experienced anything less than great from the Woodfield location.  <br><br>I went in for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon.  My friend showed up late so we sate around 1:40 pm.  She came around after a few minutes to get us water and drinks.  Then at some point came by to take our orders.  We&#39;ve been catching up so we requested a few more minutes, not a half hour!!!  She didn&#39;t come or show her face for another 30 minutes.  Took our order and finally gave us bread.  Now remember we sat at 1:40, but I was waiting there for my friend since 1 pm!  Imagine how hungry I am.<br><br>Took our orders great!  Food come out in another 20 or so minutes.  My food is ok... tomatoes are a bit mushy.  I got the Chicken Avocado Club... my friend got Orange chicken.  His was so badly cooked he couldn&#39;t eat it and sent it back.  I believe the rice and flavors were somewhat burnt tasting and was not tasting normal, and he&#39;s had this dish many many times.  So another 10 minutes before we could find someone to take it back.  Few more minutes to come ask take another order.  Instead of lunch he settled for cheesecake.  She came back with the check and left it there.  I admit we talked for at least another hour or so but, she never came by for at least an hour and half to even check on us.  Maybe filled our waters twice during our entire meal.  I have no idea why it was so hard to get any service at such a restaurant with many servers.  It was as if she either didn&#39;t care much or just didn&#39;t want to show her face.  I don&#39;t know whatever her reason was, but it was unacceptable.  Usually, I&#39;d call over a manager right away, but seeing how bad service was, I was afraid the manager wouldn&#39;t manage as well either.  So instead, sadly, being a past server and manager myself, I never do this but I did not leave much tip.  I won&#39;t say how much but just simply wrote, &#34;Thank you for the bad service,&#34; on the receipt and left.  <br><br>Maybe a manager will see this and hopefully they will manage a bit better or check on their guests a bit more?  With so many employees, why was it so hard to do their jobs?

The Cheesecake Factory is great, I have always been a huge fan! The menu is literally a book, so there is something for everyone (even a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu for healthier options). I would recommend the orange chicken or the Chinese chicken salad (It&#39;s HUGE!). The cheesecake is to die for but the meals are usually too big to save room for a piece! The only reason I gave Cheesecake Factory a 4/5 stars is because the wait time can be lengthy, especially in the evenings and they don&#39;t take reservations, so you will show up at 5:00pm thinking you have beat the dinner rush but end up waiting 30-40 minutes. When this happens, we usually go across the street to Mon Ami Gabi or Maggianos, so we don&#39;t get to eat here. However, overall, awesome food!

Went there on Saturday afternoon.  This was my first time at this location.  It is huge!  Just like every Cheesecake Factory, we had to wait for a table.  This was  my first turnoff.  The line of people waiting to eat was out the door.  Anyway, we waited the 30 minutes for a table and had lunch.  The food was decent.  I&#39;ve had better at the downtown location.  I&#39;m not complaining about the food or the service.  I&#39;ll be back.  When we left out the door, the line had quadrupled.  The overcrowding really turned me off.  Next time I come, it will be when they first open (but I&#39;ve heard that there&#39;s always a line at that time too...smh).  Oh well, the things we do for a decent meal.<br><br>Oh, and the menu is over 20 pages!  That never bother me before, but now I think it&#39;s insane.  How can their chefs/cooks master the menu when there&#39;s so much on it?
This is a great restaurant. Beautiful place with excellent food with great service. We&#39;ve been here dozens of time and we have never had a bad experience here.

I cannot complain about one single thing during my visit. In fact, it was amazing even down to the wait times on Mother&#39;s Day. We only had to wait for 40 minutes which is certainly acceptable. The food was amazing, you must order the Imperial Chicken (not currently on the menu). And the new Lemon Meringue Cheesecake is delicious! I wanted to buy an entire pie. The service was amazing. Our server was very attentive and took her time to make suggestions and knew the food very well. I will definitely be returning to this location.

HUGE menu - the the point where it&#39;s difficult to choose something. Everything&#39;s good.  They have an entire &#34;Light Side&#34; menu.  Of course they have an immense amount of cheesecake flavors.  The classic is still a classic for a reason, though.  Top with cherries or strawberries for a traditional punch.  Decor is gorgeous and dramatic, although the tables are too close together, in my opinion. And the wait can be too long if your group is larger than a party of two.  Parking is often difficult, too.

I was here with my mom and wife to celebrate our civil wedding anniversary and it was my moms first at Cheese cake. Was a Saturday night and we just had a 15 min wait. We ordered the fried Mac and cheese balls on red sauce which was awesome. My mom just loved it. My mom is a total vegetarian so she got the egg plant Parmesan with pesto pasta, my wife ordered the veggie burger with sweet potato fries and I got the chicken salad sandwich. Off these 3 only the veggie burger was good. The pesto pasta was too oily and the eggplant was kinda soggy. The chicken sandwich was soo salty and greasy. I wanted to finish the night with a low calorie cheese cake which was soft and was upto standard. On the whole not a great first experience for my mom and I wasn&#39;t impressed either.

Had a quick management meeting after work around 10pm tonight and decided to go here and grab a bite to eat while we discuss work. Waiter was Mark.,. He was great! Very courteous and friendly. Checked on us multiple times but didn&#39;t over do it. Food came and was hot &amp; delicious. Although they closed at 11, no one came to rush us out which I appreciate. They let us enjoy our food and talk. We respected their time and didn&#39;t stay too long after closing.  Great service tonight!

Well where should I start, first off it was about a 90 minute wait for two people and the wait did not stop there. Took about 15 minutes for a beer and sangria to get to our table and then the habachi steak without mushrooms we ordered medium well was burnt and had mushrooms. Our server Megan was beyond amazing though asked if she could fix anything for us. Then the manager stopped over and told us our cheesecakes would come out faster than normal. We laughed because at that point we&#39;ve already waited enough for everything anyways. Coming from the industry ourselves, we know how things work. The only thing good about our meal was Megan our fantastic server. Such an asset to your company, everything else on the other hand..could use some work.

I had never bin here ,but my date night here was awesome right from the appetizer to dinner: the combo steak Diane and Romano chicken wow right to the awesome vanilla bean cheese cake, it was so creamy and cloudy ,now that I got your attention it awesome food but you better be ready for the bill and don&#39;t  get seated toward the back corner near the kitchen they seem to drop a lot of dishes lol but other then the loud dish dropping and interesting Spanish banter between the bus boys the food was awesome .

Food quality was okay, taste was marginal. Service average, our server had a piercing voice. When our meal was completed, we decided to take some cheese cake to go. That experience was, well an adventure, told the young lady several times no whip cream, finally got it straight after she prepared 3 of the five slices. Never bothered to acknowledge us thru the whole experience, other then when we paid. In summary, will never go back to any of there locations.
Food is awesome as always !! Orderd shrimp jambalaya Fish tacos and Grilled salmon.. Afcourse my all time fav tiramisu cheese cake and godiva cheese cake too.. The only issue was our server.

The wait times here are ridiculous!! Waiting an hour? Good thing we had a gift card, because otherwise we would be having pizza somewhere. The food is usually so-so. However, I have finally found a dish that I really enjoy. The Romano crusted chicken was amazing, thin, lightly breaded chicken with some pasta was lovely. Hubs had the bang bang chicken and shrimp and was not impressed at all. We usually get the jambalaya; I&#39;m glad I tried something else. And what better way to top off a delicious meal than with the mango key lime cheesecake. Aaaah :-)

Cheesecake is pretty standard across the spectrum of their restaurants and the one in Oak Brook is no different. Fantastically large, diverse menu, incredible cheesecake options. Service has always been good at this location. Main issue here is wait times. This is a very busy location and we have passed it on many times because the line is out the door, even in the snow!

So I want to start off by saying this was my first time ever at the cheese cake factory and I was pretty excited. Well, that got shut down as soon as we sat down. I&#39;m VERY disappointed with our waitress to the point that I DO NOT want to come back. Mayra our waitress make my girlfriend and I feel very uncomfortable. She had two tables next to each other starting at the SAME TIME and it was more like she had only one. Not once did she ask us how was our food but CONTINUOUSLY asked the other table right next to us. Not once did she ask me if I wanted more water but asked them. She would just walk back and forth and just look at our table and keep walking. THE TABLES WERE LITERALLY SIDE BY SIDE. I was literally appalled at her service. We had to call her over to get the check and a to go box. I do not care if the food is amazing if the service is horrible I will not be returning. I&#39;ve never dealt with something like this before.

Nothing says Happy Hour like good food at a great price. That is exactly what the Cheesecake Factory offers with their half-price appetizers everyday during Happy Hour from 4 - 6 pm. <br><br>Thankfully, the Cheesecake Factory has not succumbed to pulling the Happy Hour Bait &amp; Switch routine like many restaurants in the area which only provide a limited selection of small portioned foods or watered-down drinks during their Happy Hour. <br>The Cheesecake Factory offers the full portion of their appetizers for half price. The only downside is that you have to sit in the bar area and sometimes seating is limited. <br><br>With so many dining options in the Oak Brook area it&#39;s nice to see that a restaurant understands the importance of quality and value. This combination truly makes it a Happy Hour.

Very disappointed with tonight&#39;s service. We were seated 15 minutes later than said. Ignored for the first 15 after being seated. No waitress came to take our order. The check from previous customer was left on the table. The silverware was dirty. We were not provided bread or drinks until we asked for it.

Not happy.<br><br>I needed a quick lunch to carry out, so I called Cheesecake Factory. Here&#39;s what transpired:<br><br>Person #1: Hi! How can I help you?<br><br>Me: Hi, I&#39;d like to place an order for carry out please.<br><br>Person #1: Sure! Let me transfer you to our curbside line.<br><br>*on hold for 3 minutes*<br><br>Person #2: Hi! How can I help you?<br><br>Me: *repeats above *<br><br>Person #2: Sure! Let me transfer you to our curbside line.<br><br>*Getting seriously annoyed now. On hold for another 4 minutes *<br><br> Person #3: (with thick accent) hi, how can I help you?<br><br> Me: yes! I&#39;d like to order a soup and salad please.<br><br>#3: ok what kind of dressing do you want?<br><br>Me: what do you have?<br><br>#3: (unintelligible, partially because of the accent and partially because she&#39;s talking so fast)<br><br>Me: I&#39;m sorry, can you repeat that?<br><br>#3: (unintelligible again)<br><br>Me: I&#39;m sorry, you&#39;re talking REALLY fast. Can you go a bit slower?<br><br> #3: (apparently gives up, because asking her to be understandable is too much): Your total will be ($) and it will be ready in 15 minutes.<br><br>Me: Um, I&#39;d still like to know what kind of dressings there are please.<br><br>#3: (FINALLY slows down enough for me to catch a few words, from which I can figure out my options).<br><br>Me: ok I&#39;ll take the vinaigrette please.<br><br>#3: It&#39;ll be ready in 20 minutes. *click*<br><br>I get there (I love how after picking my dressing the time I had to wait magically went up by 5 minutes) and they forgot the bread (when I pointed this out they actually looked in my bag to make sure I wasn&#39;t lying before giving it to me.) The soup was bland and the bread was stale. Thanks Cheesecake Factory for mediocre food and worse, deplorable customer service. Why you would have someone with an unintelligible accent taking to-go orders over the phone is beyond me, but to have that person be extremely rude as well means you&#39;ve lost a customer.

&#34;I was very disappointed with my service at this location. After placing my curb side to go order via the Internet, I arrived at the scheduled time of 9:15pm. I called the number on the sign, and it rang for several minutes before being answered. I then got transferred to the curb side to go staff, where I waited even longer before the call was answered. When my call was answered at 9:31p, I was told there was no more curb side service for the evening. Had I known that I would&#39;ve gone inside immediately upon arrival rather than wait. When I got my order there was no apology or anything offered. Then, when I received my pizza - it was cold (because it obviously sat for so long) and my cheesecake topping (I ordered lemon meringue cheesecake) had melted. I do understand policies and things change, however if curb side service was no longer offered, an email or phone call would have been appreciated. &#34;
Cajun Jambalya Pasta ALL THE WAY!!!! A little bit on the tangy side but I love it!!! =)

This is my favorite restaurant. It&#39;s so good and it has everything. The only part that is not so good is the long wait usually when you go there. I love the chicken costaletta and the fried macaroni. The potstickers are awesome as well

I have always liked the Cheesecake Factory, but I had never been to this location. <br><br>My lunch visit allowed me to try an excellent app and two wonderful small plates.  I was a bit skeptical about the Buffalo Blasts, but they were as good as the description made them sound.  For my two small plates, I had the Vietnamese Tacos and the Roasted Pear &amp; Blue Cheese Pizzette.  Both were absolutely delicious.<br><br>Overall the experience was a good one.  The service was slow, especially during the lunch hour.  4 stars for food, down to 3 stars due to the service.

30-40 minute estimated wait turned into an hour 20 minutes. Understandable because the table they had planned for us stayed longer than anticipated but they couldn&#39;t have pushed two tables together earlier than DOUBLE our wait time? Food was amazing as always but they didn&#39;t do anything to make up for the wait

This was probably my worst experience here. We went on a Wednesday with a group of 9 people. They don&#39;t take reservations so we didn&#39;t know what to expect. We got there at around 6. They told us it was an hour long wait or we could sit outside in a slightly shaded area. So we waited more than and hour (1 hour 20 minutes around there) before we were seated. For a Wednesday in the summer it was crowded. We sat down and right away we noticed it was freezing cold, we were sharing jackets and asked them if they could turn the temperature up. They said they did but to be honest it was the same. The bathrooms and other parts of the restaurant where warmer. We got our drinks and bread a few minutes after sitting down. We all ordered our food, our waitress was nice and was understanding at first. We waited an hour for our food. (2 hours in at least) So we got some food out of our order and then one order had the wrong rice which we sent back. There food was &#34;hot&#34; when they got it and by the time everyone else got there food they had eaten it all or it was lukewarm. One person in our party asked why all of our food we coming out separate then all at once. I don&#39;t recall what our waitress said.  Everyone got there food and it was lukewarm or warm. We came to a conclusion that they probably left it under the light before it came to us. So we ate our food and it was delicious as always but never ONCE did someone like the waitress or manager ask how was our food or apologized for the wait. Our waitress later in our visit was very snobby like &#34;it will be out ok&#34; or &#34;yes I know&#34; in a very snobby tone. The rest of our meal was ok, we asked if we can take our food home and waited at least 10 minutes before we got our to go boxes. Obviously they were short staff. We ordered cheesecake to go and some didn&#39;t come out until we were just about to leave. She obviously had tables that had just came in that she was working on but never asked for any help. We have now been there for more than 3 hours. We left unsatisfied with no apology from our waitress or the manager. I have been there a thousand times and never have had an experience like this so I would never go with a group over 6 people.

It&#39;s really 3.5 stars but can&#39;t do half stars here. Anyways parking is difficult and they don&#39;t take reservations so wait times are ridiculous sometimes. The bread in the beginning is quite good. Drinks and beer are pricy so save your money and go to pour house across the street. They unfortunately do not give complimentary cheesecake for your birthday , bit of a shame. Had chicken teriyaki it was so so. Tried the nachos and spinach dip. Decent flavored.Greek salad I liked it really was well put together. They have wide menu but nothing stands out out of the world tho aside from cheesecake. Casual place with family in the mall. Service is good have never had a problem. Cant wait for the patio seasons but granted you get all the gas in your face from driving by cars.

First of all, this restaurant is massive.  The ceilings are sky-high and the building is beautiful.  It feels like a pretty classy place. <br><br>My table got avocado spring rolls as an appetizer, and it was very yummy! (I think I found a mock-recipe on Pintrest, must try!)  My boyfriend got the Thai chicken pasta and I got the fish tacos.  Both were good-tasting, but for reference I would compare it to food you could get at Chili&#39;s or Applebees.  The others at our table ordered the garlic noodles and the eggplant sandwich... I&#39;m not sure what they thought but everyone ended up cleaning their plate or bringing home leftovers so I have a feeling it was all pretty tasty!<br><br>Of course, we got cheesecake for dessert, and the b-friend and I shared the mango key lime flavor.  Deeeeelish-- it was easily my favorite part of the meal.  It was light (as light as cheesecake gets, that is) and the fruity touch was a nice way to end our night.  <br><br>Oh yeah, but we went there on a Saturday night and the wait area was packed.  Luckily we only had to stand around for 20 minutes or so, but if you are in a rush I would try somewhere else.

Loooved their food and service; wait times are VERY long but definitely worth the wait (depending on the day, you can get reservations, I went on a Sunday and they were not taking reservations so it was first come first serve so the wait was an hour). Food is delicious and there is a huge variety of plates to select (pasta, vegetarian, steak, seafood, chicken, gluten-free, etc). It is also pricey (not surprising: downtown Chicago is always pricey) and if you want dessert it is at a minimum $10 that you would pay for dessert, so you can imagine the price of the rest of the plates, BUT it is SO worth the delicious food and I had a wonderful time with my family admiring the theme of the restaurant (very Alice in Wonderland) and chatting with each other on a Sunday evening and that was worth the money and time I wasted getting a table there.

We had an absolutely DELICIOUS lunch/dinner, at the Cheesecake Factory, in Oak Brook today!!!!  Salmon, Chicken and Steak....mmm...mmm....GREAT!!!!!  LOVE THE AMBIANCE and DAKOTA, our waiter, was THE BEST!!!!!  It was my Auntie Terry&#39;s B-Day and he certainly made sure that EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT!!!!!  We will be back very soon!!! Thumbs up for a GREAT TIME!!!!

The only reason this review gets a three instead of a two is because of our waiter. He was awesome. But the server tried sitting us in the middle of two other tables... Uh no. We asked to be moved and she gave me attitude. Then I order avocado egg rolls. There&#39;s these little plastic pieces in it... Okay. I am usually shy to complain so I didn&#39;t mention it. What seemed like 30 minutes later our food arrived. My eggplant sandwich fell apart when I picked it up. I was so upset. I waited so long for the food and it sucks that it instantly was inedible. Boyfriend said something to the waiter and he was awesome. He comped us and brought out a different meal(after another 20/25 min) . Also the manager came and apologized. Really appreciated that. However it took us two hours to dine there due to the wait of food. Was pretty disappointed. Oh well.

My opinion is this place is overrated. Yeah the cheese cake is great but the food is whatever. Way overpriced  again in my opinion. I tried to see what others see but the long waits and pricey food ruins the experience. I would still come here with others but definitely not a first choice. No special trips to the cheese cake factory for me.

We&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory for years, but this is my first review. I have to say that Cheesecake Factory is one of few restaurants that consistently rocks in all aspects of a dining experience. The service is always great, every dish we&#39;ve tried tastes very good and is well prepared.....seafood, beef, chicken....whatever you like. They even have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu that is equally delicious as the regular menu. The portions are huge. The cheesecake is extraordinary. This is definitely one of our &#34;go-to&#34; restaurants when we want a guaranteed good meal.

While I love their cheesecake and appreciate the variety on their menu, it is very frustrating that they don&#39;t accept reservations. I have waited for a table for almost an hour. The lobby gets very crowded so even if you go in to just get cheesecake, it&#39;s very chaotic. I think if they took reservations and organized themselves a little more, they would get 5 stars!

My wife, son and I went to the Cheesecake Factory tonight.  50 minute wait but we knew that is part of the deal. After being seated, we order drinks - Sangria for my wife, Long Island Iced Tea for me and strawberry lemonade for my son.  My drink was awful! It tasted like 15 sour lemons squeezed into a glass with a splash of brown liquid.  Undrinkable!<br><br>Asked for manager, and was presented with Christopher Johannsen, who said he was sorry I didn&#39;t like it. It was it that I didn&#39;t like it - it was that it was the most horrible cocktail I have ever had the misfortune to sip!  I asked for a Diet Coke instead.<br><br>Dinner comes.  My wife&#39;s skinny steak is fine - my skinny enchiladas look good as well.  However, no cheese pizza for the son.  Christopher comes out - again - to let me know it will be 5 minutes.  We decide to eat as my son doesn&#39;t care if we do, and after my second piece of &#34;chicken tooth&#34; (or gristle - whatever you want to call it) - I was done.  Set the plate aside and explained to waitress that two bits of enchilada spit out pretty much soured me on the whole experience.<br><br>Pizza finally comes.  I ask to speak to the manager again, and I suggest that as pizza was late, my food and drink were nauseating, and our whole evening and experience was a disaster, that Christopher not bring me any bill whatsoever.  Christopher, in his infinite manager wisdom, would have none of that and offered to comp my drink, my dinner, and the pizza, but not the entire thing.  We discussed this back and forth and I made it clear I would not expect to be paying ANYTHING but ol&#39; Christ would not hear of it.  <br><br>I explained this to the waitress and asked if there was a &#34;real&#34; manager I could speak to.  Eventually some other older guy came over, and with no attempt at an apology, or even a fake act to show that he was at least concerned about our experience, told us to go ahead and not pay and just leave.  So we did.<br><br>What a disaster!  It&#39;s obvious that the Cheesecake Factory is so large that they don&#39;t care about a customer here or there, so that is why I was so surprised how hard it was to get them to comp our lousy meal.    <br><br>I hope everybody reads this and forwards to the awful management staff at that restaurant but I doubt they would care.

We were here for Father&#39;s Day dinner and it was after the dinner rush, about 8:30 pm. We didn&#39;t have to wait for a seat (it was busy at the time though) so that was a plus. The waiter brought us our bread but we had no plates to eat on. He brought us our alcoholic drinks pretty quickly but failed to bring my daughter&#39;s Sprite which I had to ask again for along with plates. Appetizer came, still no plates. Finally, the young lady that brought out our food brought us some plates. Rather than taking our order before the appetizers, he waited until we were done with them to take the order. Meanwhile, we are watching people with other waiters/waitresses, place their orders, get their food, finish their food, all while we wait. Once the food came, and the young lady that brought them out was asking who had what, our waiter finally decides that it&#39;s a good time to interrupt her and see if we wanted another alcoholic drink. Very rude and disrespectful to the server trying to give the customer their meal. The food itself was fantastic. The wait time was less than pleasant. Our waiter just kind of ruined the entire experience. This isn&#39;t the first time I&#39;ve experienced less than stellar service at this location. It may be time to find a new Cheesecake Factory to go to.

IF I COULD GIVE ZERO STARS I WOULD!  We have been going to this restaurant for more than a decade and generally are pleased every time. This was nothing short of horrific!  We ended up sitting at a table near the bar area-possibly the first problem. Server gives attitude to my wife and son while I am away apparently. Food comes and my son&#39;s order is wrong--somehow they mistake pizza for Mac and cheese; Madeira good as always. They say they will get pizza. 15 mins later we ask another server to get us bread and check on our pizza because we have not seen our server. Oops-- they never put the pizza order in. Our server finds out and apologizes and says it will be right away-first order in kitchen and promises us they will cover meal and a couple pieces of cheesecake. Meanwhile she disappears again and I go up to bar to get refills for water and Cokes for our table on several occasions--not the most pleasant group there but fine. <br><br>Another 15 minutes--no pizza and more self service on the drinks. I lost it and went to look for a manager. He ends up getting us a different waiter Brandon B who was very nice--but the damage was done. Then the &#39;manager&#39; actually has the gall to reduce the comp for the bad service; he takes off the small pizza and 1 slice of cheesecake that we had to get &#39;to go&#39; because it was now late and we had been done with our food for 30 minutes.  I get it--some people probably complain and take advantage of you--but that wasn&#39;t me so you need to figure out a different way to identify abusers.  That comp for that bad of service was weak--frankly you should have paid me tonight--that&#39;s how bad it was. <br><br>To put it simply--Your service sucked tonight!  I hope to finish off my gift cards from this place at another location but frankly nothing is real convenient from Wheaton. We may suck it up for a few times more but you definitely lost a loyal customer tonight. You need to replace your servers and managers-- go across the street to Maggiano&#39;s. They seem smart enough to hire pleasant ones.

The herb crusted salmon is great! Their drinks are good.  The Mai Tai&#39;s are delicious!!!  But..... strange how this place is called &#34; The Cheesecake Factory&#34; but the cheesecakes aren&#39;t all that great. If you are going to name your restaurant after a dessert, that dessert better be perfection. LOVE the decor though.

Food was perfect as always. I had seared tuna salad and it was delicious! however baby changing station in the woman&#39;s restroom needs to be fixed. I was afraid for my two months old baby that she will fall down, because the station was broken :(
I love their cheesecakes! I took my now husband there for his birthday and they gave him a free slice with decorations around it stating Happy Birthday. It is a bit pricey but well worth it.
Try their jambalaya or steak medallions. We really enjoyed the food.   Their red velvet cheesecake is also delicious.

where do i start ?<br><br>the hostess was rude from the beginning ! hello! she should realize she is the first people see when they come in !<br><br>lastly my wife went to the bathroom and it was a mess!!! that was the last straw! we left !

Today I got a to go order of cajun chicken and shrimp pasta and it had no taste. I called the location and spoke with the manager on duty named Chris and he was rude as ever. He explained to me the dishes are to be consumed right away. This explanation took me by surprise seeing they have a to go area and it doesn&#39;t state that. Although in years past I have enjoyed dining here, however I&#39;ve begun to see a change in the quality of product. So my visit wasn&#39;t enjoyable and my advice is only get cheesecake to go not the food.  Furthermore, if you have an issue don&#39;t speak with the manager Chris as he has no customer service skills. So you be the judge I won&#39;t keep going back on the name of a restaurant if I can&#39;t receive quality service 100%. You judge!

We went in as a large group.  Food was very great but the server could not handle a group with food coming out randomly, some not at all and the bills took 45 minutes to get and pay.  The manager corrected as best he could and my seared tuna salad 5 stars on its own

I was there on a Saturday afternoon with my two grandchildren.  I ordered the salmon, it was delicious. My grandchildren ordered pasta, which they loved. This is now my grandchildren&#39;s favorite place.  Mine, too.<br>  <br>Diana was a great waitress.

Awful service. Not to be a baby, but at one point I felt  the&#34;angry tears&#34; coming on. <br><br>See, Hubby and I haven&#39;t had a chance to get out in a long time. I tried for rezzies at some more upscale places like Wildfire and Gibsons but I was out of luck. We settled on the Factory but I wasn&#39;t dissappointed because I was in the mood for eating and was looking forward to the dessert. <br><br>This CF has a really amazing ambiance. It&#39;s pretty dramatic and I&#39;m an ambiance girl for sure so that was a plus. The place is ginormous. <br><br>Soon as we were seated our server walked up to us and barely looking at us mumbles that he isn&#39;t going to be our server for long because he&#39;d already been there all day! Practically warning us that our service is going to be shotty. GREAT! Just what I wanted to hear on our one big night out.<br><br>He takes our food order, we order a bottle of wine to celebrate a night away from the kiddos and the server comes back to TOSS a basket of bread on our table again without even looking at us and walks/ no runs away. We didn&#39;t even have any bread plates. He avoided eye contact with us each time he quickly walked past so we ended up eating our bread off of our napkins. SUCKY!<br><br>Sitting there like hostages still without our wine, and eating bread off of napkins, we hear the two different servers on either side of us entertaining their guests with the specials and soups of the day which we of course heard nothing of!! Damn because they sounded interesting.<br><br>After about 10 minutes our food is brought out (which is faster than the last time I went to Burger King) by another server whom I&#39;ve never seen. Then  Mr. I-CANT-WAIT-TO-PUNCH-OUT-FROM-MY-SHIFT-SERVER makes eye contact for the first time and he introduces us to our &#34;NEW&#34;  server who is now the third person we&#39;ve seen. Three of them at our table and not one of them notices we never got our wine, had no bread plates, no water.. they are fine with it and ready to get rid of us asap. <br><br>And there is where my &#34;angry tears&#34; almost started. <br><br>Hubby and I were thinking about forgetting the wine but server #3 promises to get it. After server #2  and #3 do some bumbling and bumping into each other all confused like for a minute, #2 finally brings the bottle after we are well into our meals. <br><br>It was stressful, annoying and I felt pretty angry that our bill was over $100 with tip for two people and we were treated like we were at Chilis, where our bill is usually half that. Wait, We get MUCH better service at Chilis! <br><br>I had the Bang Bang Shrimp and it was good, It was like a sweeter version of Panaang, if I am ever forced to go to the Factory again that is what I&#39;ll order. Cheesecake of course was fantab as always, no complaints there.

I am extremely disappointed in this Cheesecake Factory location. I am from Denver, and visit the Cheesecake Factory a couple times a year, always having a great experience. My visit today was extremely terrible. After seating ourselves at a bar table, we had to wait quite a while for service. When our server Pam finally came over, we ordered 2 mojitos and 3 appetizers. Our food came out before our drinks did. Our server didn&#39;t even bother to come over and say anything to us about this, or even ask how our food was. We then found out by asking another server that Pam was on a break..?  Our mojitos tasted like sugar water and the food was mediocre. I will never go to this location again. Very disappointing. All this happened with about 20 people in the whole huge restaurant.

Gordon Ramsay would have a stroke upon seeing the twelve pages of menu.  However the Cheesecake Factory somehow manages do do most of it very well.  Options range from healthy to extremely fat and calorie laden, and most portions are ginormous -- which I guess one can view as a pro or a con.  Personally, I am a big fan of their seared wasabi-crusted tuna, but have not had anything at the Oak Brook location that I felt was poorly prepared or bad.  And then there is the cheesecake -- too many varieties to count.<br><br>The only downside is how crowded this location is most evenings, every weekend, and often during the lunch hour.  Waits can be very long.<br><br>I also do not entirely understand the egyptian-looking decor; though it is unique and attractive.<br><br>Bon appetit!

I have spent thousands of dollars at this location. I have never been so upset. I made a purchase to go of a salad that was not made correctly and the manager Chris only wanted to comp me a cheesecake. I had a friend pick the salad up for me cause I was on my work lunch break, meanwhile, I hadn&#39;t eaten all day so I was starving. I contacted Chris and told him I was at work and I couldn&#39;t leave. He said that he would give me the apples they forgot to put on my salad and a cheesecake. Not a new salad with apples. He expected me to not eat on my lunch break and wait 4.5 hours and drive back to the restaurant for apples. I  tried to be very nice about the issue but he kept insisting that I was only getting a cheesecake. Eventually he opted out of cheesecake and said he would give me the salad, but not willingly. Therefore,  I stood there and cried cause I couldn&#39;t believe I had to go thru all this for lettuce. I left without anything cause I was so frustrated that I had to be treated like this and all I wanted was my salad made correctly the way I paid for it.
I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecake factory! They have excellent food and desserts!
I have said it before about this and a few other big chains, but stop pretending like you are too good to like Cheesecake Factory. It is -objectively- delicious. That is all.

The wait time is unbelievably rediculous!!!! I cannot believe it takes that long to eat! we waited almost 2 hours after being told the wait was 50 minutes. On top of everything they messed up our order which was just the cherry on top of a horrible experience.....will never return to a cheescake factory ever!!!! not even for a cheesecake!!!

Lunch for two on a Monday.  First time at a Cheesecake Factory.  Nice crowd. Decor a little gaudy.  <br>They started us with warm bread and big glasses of water.  The bread was good.  The dark bread had a tinge of sweetness.  We ordered the meatloaf and the shepherd&#39;s pie.  Both were very generous portions. The meatloaf was good and came with mashed potatoes and succotash.  The meatloaf and succotash were spicy. The shepherd&#39;s pie was the best made with beef I have ever had. They used plenty of ground beef and it was filled with a lot of gravy and vegetables including mushrooms, carrots and peas.  The mashed potatoes were topped with a thin coating of melted cheese.  <br>The service was attentive and friendly, although the shepherd&#39;s pie does take a little longer.  <br>What we ordered was really a dinner not a lunch and we were stuffed.  So we took a couple of original cheesecakes to go to have with a lighter dinner that night.  And it was excellent.  We will return.

Good food with great cheesecake (as expected.) however ordering online has its issues and almost every time they have messed up my order. Overall it&#39;s a nice chain restaurant to go to when in need, but with all the other great restaurants near by I would recommend going elsewhere.

My family waited an hour and a half (were told wait time would be 45-50 minutes when we checked in). Were seated at a nice table towards the back. Our server was very nice brought our drinks and bread right away she was the best part of our experience. I ordered fish tacos I have had them before but this time they were awful just a friend piece of fish in a tortilla with barely any salsa and they forgot the slaw. The side of lime on the plate was all dried up and the Rice and beans were both cold like they were just taken out of the refrigerator. My husband had the enchiladas it looked like a plate of slop covered heavily with cilantro. He said they were tasteless. My daughter ordered the chicken Madeira she said the chicken was rubbery, the mashed potatoes were cold and she mentioned the sauce was very salty. My other daughter had the chicken bellagio which our server said was amazing, needless to say I could tell by the few bites she ate it was far from it. My mom ordered the Cuban sandwich when I asked her how it was she said it was fine. It has been awhile since we have been to Cheesecake Factory and after the long wait it was a big disappointment. They are a quantity food establishment not quality.

As corny as CF is, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal there. The cheesecake is delicious and there are so many tempting kinds to try and the dessert menu changes often, perhaps too often - although, the mainstays remain. I like that the menu has calorie busters and very low cal choices, all of which are presented well and taste good. While CF&#39;s prices are a bit steep for a casual chain, it seems the competion has stepped up to the plate and they&#39;re all the same. It&#39;s relatively easy to spend $50 for 2 to have lunch and $70 for 2 to have dinner.

Yes.. you will have to wait to be seated, sometimes for an hour or more.. so plan accordingly because its a popular place that has the beeper system, no reservations! They offer valet parking which is nice for a special evening, then again, its loud inside as their seating capacity is upwards of 400.. ( i think).. For first timers... that giant book is not the next Twilight installment, its the menu.. I found it odd they have advertisements in there but so what, they have everything from Italian, Mexican, Asian, etc.. all with a &#34;everyone will like it&#34; American way about it. Ive had quesadillas, the burrito which is the size of a forearm, Evelyns favorite pasta, whoever she is.. got it right. Pizzas are also good, lettuce wraps, the eggplant sandwich, different appetizers including these fried cheese balls which were freakin amazing! As you can see, the bigger the group you go with, the more variety you will get to sample as the menu is huge, Ive never been for breakfast/brunch but seen that omelet menu and need to wake people up early enough to come here on a Sunday for brunch! <br>Entree portions can be large, so share along with conversation, take your time, and I cant stress enough how important it is to save room for Cheesecake, as if the name didn&#39;t tip you off. Red Velvet Cheesecake is their understated best hands down, the tiramisu cheesecake, dulce de leche, original with strawberry, or even the unique reeses peanut butter cheesecake...or the rich Godiva cheesecake.. with a latte or cappuccino.. They have a special Take out section just for picking up cheesecake on the way home from work... if you&#39;re avoiding the wait, and the noise. Even with 4 stars, this is one of my Favorite restaurants in this area!

I went there in the afternoon on a weekday, and there was a small wait. The ambiance is great, the walls and tables are very pretty.service was okay. The server brought us the wrong food but recovered fast and got is the right order.I had the soup and salad and it was pretty good. my only thing was the wait. Parking lot was very full tough to get parking.

Had lunch there today and it was good as usual.  I ordered the steak diane medium rare and it was a little too cooked, but I ate it anyway.  But the thing I am annoyed with today is when I left I decided to order a piece of cheesecake to go at the take out counter.  I waited patiently by myself, there was no one else waiting, but the preparer did not even acknowledge I was there.  She was busy putting together a few orders but not once did she say &#34;I&#39;ll be right with you&#34; or it will just be a minute&#34;.  Either responses would have been fine.  But after 5 minutes I just left.  Too bad, I really had a taste for a slice of raspberry lemon cheesecake.  Poor service to say the least.  It was 2:45 in the afternoon so they were not slammed at that time.

Food was terrible.  Ribeye steak tasted like hamburger.  Kids pasta was cold.  Greek salad had almost no feta and was only about a cup full of salad.  Server only came to bring the food never checked in or brought drinks unless we waved her down.  Will not be back

I always like the food at Cheesecake Factory. So the food and service were fine. However, I did have to take a star away because the floors were dangerously slippery. Especially holding a young child, we were super careful with walking since we kept slipping as we walked. Luckily, no falling but we did mention to a few staffers. One even said something to the point of &#34;tell me about it. I&#39;ve almost slipped a few times already.&#34;

I thought it was grossssss. I got the spicy cashew something and it was really salty and the waiter took forever to refill my water. <br><br>CONCLUSION: If you like salty nuts in your mouth... This is the place for you.

My wife and I frequently eat here and love the food. My wife is celebrating her birthday today, she asked to eat here and due to plans we would need reservations. Unfortunately you can&#39;t just walk in and get a seat..... You have to wait almost 30 mins for a seat! So I asked to
Food was good as always, but the service sucked.  Slow service, served cold bread, when asked for warm bread, they microwaved it.  Just seemed very lax in attention

I really enjoyed this location.  Weekends are a bit busy and it&#39;s first come first served.  The staff was great and as usual the food is delicious. I always get one or two slices of cheesecake to go. Overall great establishment.

Last night my mother and I visited The Cheesecake Factory - Oakbrook for dinner and really had an enjoyable experience.  I have visited two other locations - downtown Chicago and Orland Park but this was my favorite by far. The decor was so beautiful and the dim lights - relaxing, great service, but most importantly the phenomenal food and scrumptious cheesecake!

Very disappointed at this location.  My niece and I went here for her birthday lunch to the Oak Brook location and after our visit I will never come back to this location.  Let&#39;s face it, cheesecake factory Ain&#39;t cheap, so when I go I spend a lot of money and expect good service!  our waitress did not write down our order at all she needed to ask us again while speaking loudly kitty corner from the computer to order our food.  She didn&#39;t even take the time to come to our table personally to ask our order again.  I ordered the Chicken California avocado club and got just that, minus the avocado.  So I spoke to the waitress explaining I ordered the Chicken California club and her response was &#34;oh really, let me go get you some avocado.&#34;  I just wanted her to take the sandwich back and give me what I ordered but instead she gave me avocado to put on my sandwich.  The waitress stated that it&#39;s the same thing I just need to put the avocado on myself.  I would&#39;ve preferred the sandwich be made completely over, this is the Cheesecake Factory not Steak N&#39; Shake.  Our waitress was just different to begin with, even my 15 year old niece was like what&#39;s wrong with her.  I&#39;ll stick to the Schaumburg location, never had an issue there.
Went in at 5:45 on a Friday and only had a few minute wait! Our server was super friendly, food was good... As usual too much for just one meal.

Ok as we all know the food here is delicious. However each time I have gone here the service is questionable. I&#39;m not a needy customer but I do get a little annoyed when I have to wait for water and bread and I see others getting it right away. This has happened each time I&#39;ve gone to this location. I still go back because I love the cheesecake. I don&#39;t expect being served like a queen but the basics wouldn&#39;t hurt. When Someone comes into a restaurant chances are they&#39;re really hungry just bring them bread right away. It might seem small but it makes a huge difference in a dining experience.

Just wanted to share a very odd experience. I visited with a party of 15 that was split into 2 tables. That was not the issue, we didn&#39;t make reservations. However, our waiter was very forgetful and unorganized. He constantly asked each guest at our table what they order. He was complaining about a medical condition with the nerves in his leg or something. He brought out dishes that no one ordered. We laughed about it for the most part but this kid did not seen equipped to be working as a waiter ... anywhere.

We go to this establishment quite often, as I liked their pasta Davinci​ and the staff are also very attentive, for the most part. Last night, for our anniversary, my husband and I went out for a late dinner. We both ordered rib eye, medium done. the waitress did not​ ask our preference for our sides, but it was fine, as I​ figured she must be tired already. The meal came in less than 10 minutes, both were burnt. I tasted it and it was so bitter. We called our waitress back and had it sent back, which she did. My husband did not want to bother her, and his was not as burnt as mine was. When the waitress came back, she told me that the other wait staff were thrilled that I sent back the rib eye and that all of the took a bite out of it. It made me feel like I was just being picky, or that I do not know how a medium steak would taste and look like. I told her it was burnt, and tasted bitter. Anyway, the second one she gave tasted great, like the way the cheescake factory usually does it.
This place was hopping and fabulous late at night, the Steak Diane was unbelievable, served the kids, they loved their food, had a great time; wasn&#39;t sure, but now hooked; gotto go again, soon.

This place was pretty good but it wasn&#39;t good enough to wait an hour and a half for even if we could find a parking spot. We skipped the insane crowd on a Saturday evening and went for an early sunday lunch (which didn&#39;t have a wait surprisingly). <br><br>The seats that they seated my boyfriend and I at were so close together. I could rub elbows with the people at the seat next to me if we tried and the conversation of the  two girls next to us was so depressing. I could hear everything about each of their friends that had passed away. I&#39;m sorry that it happened and I mean no disrespect to them but I felt so bleh after trying to ignore their conversation. <br><br>On the other hand our waitress was really pleasant and the food was pretty good. We had ordered the calamari for an appetizer and it was good. I ordered the grilled fish tacos which were also good. My boyfriend got the Cali cheese steak and he said it was good. The food was just good. Nothing spectacular. The cheesecake though was really good but was pretty expensive. I think it was $7 a slice. <br><br>The decoration was really nice, the feel of the place was relaxing, the bar was overly stocked and the menu is huge. <br><br>Over all everything was pretty good but I would recommend going on a weekday or a morning.

Well, a little disappointing with the service. I don&#39;t mind waiting for my table but when they are off by 30 minutes from what they told me that&#39;s a little annoying. To compound this, after finally being seated, it&#39;s been 15 min now and I&#39;m still waiting for someone to take our order. WTF!!!

I enjoy the ambiance here... The high ceilings and beautiful decor. The service has never disappointed me. Parking is easy too. Last time I was here I got their seafood gumbo and ahi tuna tar tar... Very good. I actually don&#39;t like most of their food on the menu!

Met some friends here for lunch on Sunday around noon. We sat in the bar at a high top. Our waitress was attentive, and kept our glasses full for the majority of the meal. It took us a long time to choose our orders because we were catching up, and the menu is like 30 pages long... Seriously who needs that many options? <br><br>Anyway I had a couple tall Honker&#39;s Ales as they were on tap. I ate the Chicken and Biscuit meal. The biscuit and gravy was excellent while the chicken was so-so. The mixed veggies and mashed potatoes served with it were also pretty good. It was the 1st time I have ever finished a meal at the CF without feeling like I was going to explode. <br><br>My wife ordered a side caeser salad (love their dressing), and a lunch portion of a sundried tomato and chicken pasta. When her pasta was delivered, it was covered in a cream sauce which was not mentioned anywhere on the menu (interesting as they have plenty of space for that kind of detail). She requested they make her a new one without cream sauce as she is what I lovingly refer to as a lactard (lactose intolerant). The waitress that dropped off the pasta said something along the lines of &#34;well it always comes with cream sauce on it.&#34; Which I thought was pretty rude, but I let it slide. Our actual waitress came over, apolgized for the mixup and took the pasta to have it remade as requested. The manager also stopped at our table to apologize and offer to bring my wife a complimentary soup which we politely declined. When the bill came they did remove the pasta from the bill which was appreciated.<br><br>The other couple we met ordered the buffalo burger (burger with fried onion straws, bleu cheese, and buffalo sauce) and the chicken avocado club. Both looked delicious. <br><br>Overall, the experience was pleasant. The good thing about cheesecake factory is you seem to always get exactly what you would expect.
